showerReviews.reviewText: I had a very concerning experience at the swim school with instructor Charlotte. During my 4-year-old's lesson, Charlotte was clearly distracted and not paying attention to the kids. My child slipped off the platform and she didn‚Äôt notice until I shouted around three seconds later. Drowning for kids can happen sliently in just seconds, and it's terrifying to think what might have happened if I hadn‚Äôt been watching as well. This lack of attention is unacceptable for a swimming instructor.  But other instructors like Stephenie, Sami , whom my child previously had are great.
showerReviews.author: Shawn. W

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hot. If you're swimming in the summer it's a comfy, easy breezy place to do your training and I'd recommend it.

For viewers... 100% humidity and 29 degrees consistently. They have tried to do their best with industrial fans but the effort doesn't mean results.

Cafe, foyer and facilities that support the pool 100%.

4 stars for swimmers.
3 stars for viewers.
showerReviews.author: Chris VT

showerReviews.reviewText:
"hi, i just came down from kawana's 3.7m deep pool yesterday in the sunshine coast, can i swim in ur deep pool, i dont want to use the high diving board, just that im capable of swimming 17m down and holding my breath for 1 minute and can scuba dive" - me

"no, its not open to the public, there are rules about holding ur breath and we would need to have a spotter or life guard walk past, no, you cant swim". one of the two old ladies at reception who was having a nice yarn to each other.

"that's ok, i rang ahead to gold coast aquatic center and they said i can swim in their 5 meter deep pool.". -me ready to leave and drive 80mins to hold coast.

"then have a nice drive, its really long." - said with narky attitude that i should now suffer for not giving brisbane aquatic center entry money

funny how they have rules and look confused when i say i can swim in gold coasts 5meter deep pool.

public funded privitisation at it's spitiest.
showerReviews.author: Logan Ralph

showerReviews.reviewText: The place has a solid setup with both indoor and outdoor pools, which worked out well because the weather turned halfway through our swim. The lap lanes were clear enough, though some folks didn‚Äôt really stick to the slow/fast lane signs, which got a bit annoying. The gym upstairs looked alright. Nothing flash but seemed practical if you‚Äôre after basics. The change rooms were serviceable, but honestly, they could use a little spruce up; tiles look like they‚Äôve been around since the early 2000s. On the upside, plenty of parking out front, which is rare for these sorts of centres. Prices were fair, especially compared to other spots around Brisbane. Good for casual swimmers and families, but maybe not the place for a ‚Äòpremium‚Äô feel.
showerReviews.author: Ian Vera

showerReviews.reviewText:
My regular place to swim. I love that it‚Äôs heritage listed. The people who swim here range from babies to ppl in their 80‚Äôs. Lots of ppl over 50.
You don‚Äôt need the body beautiful. Just be yourself. Most of the regulars are friendly and say hi to anyone.
When Tim worked here he started playing ABC classic radio. At first I wasn‚Äôt sure.. now it‚Äôs the only music to swim to there. It‚Äôs also had the impact of me seeing orchestra at QPAC. It‚Äôs delightful swimming to classical music.
The staff seem to change regularly. Some are more friendly than others. Some seem to work harder than others too.
They do learn to swim lessons.

Updated: august 2022
Recent renovations to pool. Felt so happy to be back.

What an amazing place!

Popped in for a quick visit this morning. I had outstanding service from Edwina, who obviously loves what she does. She even gave me a tour üòç

Highly recommend!

The carpark across the road does early bird parking for $12 so you can start your day with a refreshing swim and hot shower and then spend the day exploring the City.

Top tip: read my car park review and don't arrive before 0610 (a good margin for error).

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brilliant atmospheric, heritage Victorian baths with 25m swimming pool.

The street front looks more like a small house front than a pool entrance.

The 25m (I‚Äôm willing to bet it was 25yard originally) Pool itself is surrounded by Victorian change cubicles (think the heritage pool where Moriarty confronts Sherlock and Dr Watson in the Great Game episode)

The old concrete pool has a viewing gallery, character heritage no spitting signs and is Semi open to the elements as befits a semi tropical climate.

The only downside is the steps/recessed concrete ladder to get into the pool are difficult or impossible is you aren‚Äôt fully able. There is no ramp or easy steps.
showerReviews.author: Paul W (Berci1ak)

It has all facilities, a well equipped changing room and a nice bar. Entrance fee is 2AUD which is great and can be easily reached by bus as the stop is right in front. showerReviews.reviewText: Wonderful 50m swimming pool in the middle of Fortitude Valley in Brisbane.  One of Australia's most famous pools, that over the years has seen many Olympic medallists and international swimmers use it as their training base.  Recently, the Scottish Swimming team used this venue to prepare for the 2018 Commonwealth Games.  Venue is clean and has good surrounding space for sitting or sunbathing.  Small coffee shop on site as well as a swim shop and fitness gym.  Easily accessible on foot but probably difficult to find good nearby car parking space.
showerReviews.author: Ian Wright

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dear Management Team,

I am writing to express my concern following a recent visit to Sandgate Swimming Pool with my family.

While we were there, we were surprised and delighted to see a family of ducks ‚Äî a mother and her ducklings ‚Äî swimming in the pool. It was an unexpected and charming sight, and naturally, many people, including my five-year-old son, were curious and stopped to watch.

However, what should have been a lighthearted and educational moment for the children quickly turned unpleasant when one of the lifeguards suddenly yelled at my son, telling him to go away. This was not only unnecessary, but also quite distressing for a young child. He was not approaching or touching the ducks ‚Äî merely observing from the side, as were many others.

If the ducks are protected or if there are specific safety or environmental concerns regarding interaction, this should be clearly communicated with appropriate signage or a calm explanation ‚Äî not with raised voices directed at young children.

We fully support the care and safety of local wildlife, but also believe that respectful and age-appropriate communication is essential in a family-oriented environment such as yours.

I hope you will take this feedback seriously and ensure that all staff are trained to handle such situations with more understanding and professionalism in the future.
showerReviews.author: stephanie park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dear Management Team,

I am writing to express my concern following a recent visit to Sandgate Swimming Pool with my family.

While we were there, we were surprised and delighted to see a family of ducks ‚Äî a mother and her ducklings ‚Äî swimming in the pool. It was an unexpected and charming sight, and naturally, many people, including my five-year-old son, were curious and stopped to watch.

However, what should have been a lighthearted and educational moment for the children quickly turned unpleasant when one of the lifeguards suddenly yelled at my son, telling him to go away. This was not only unnecessary, but also quite distressing for a young child. He was not approaching or touching the ducks ‚Äî merely observing from the side, as were many others.

If the ducks are protected or if there are specific safety or environmental concerns regarding interaction, this should be clearly communicated with appropriate signage or a calm explanation ‚Äî not with raised voices directed at young children.

We fully support the care and safety of local wildlife, but also believe that respectful and age-appropriate communication is essential in a family-oriented environment such as yours.

I hope you will take this feedback seriously and ensure that all staff are trained to handle such situations with more understanding and professionalism in the future.
showerReviews.author: stephanie park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Management failure.
Maintenance and cleanliness is terrible (yellow slime growing in 50m pool, loose soil -at least I hope that's what it is- in 25m pool, pools/half pools closed for long periods, changerooms shabby and smelly).
In peak periods, 5-6pm, there are 4 lanes out of 18 available for public swimming, and these are crammed with swimmers of all speeds and abilities and understandings of lap swimming.  The rest of the lanes are taken up by lessons/squads, usually 2 swimmers per lane, and recreational pool users (little kids playing around but taking up a whole lane).
Life guards do nothing to handle it, probably because the "management" of the pool clearly has decided and communicated to them that it's future lies in squads/lessons -people who won't care about the maintenance and hygiene issues.
showerReviews.author: Steph anie

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the most horrendous heated pool I've ever visited. I used to attend this pool 7 years ago when I lived nearby, but went elsewhere because the swimming lessons often used to take up whole heated pool. I'm needing some hydrotherapy and thought I'd see if things had improved. I even rang and asked about the schedule/procedures earlier in the day. I was told there would be one lane left for walking/laps - free from ppl playing. I was told after 5:30pm was a good time to come. This was not the case and nothing at all has improved! In fact, it was so much worse and basically a free for all. Not to mention, it's more expensive than other nearby pools. Only one lane on the end was left for public use and was full of adults and kids just mucking around. Kids were jumping in everywhere and parents weren't much better. The swim instructor taking the group in the next lane was encouraging her students to splash and play tag, with no regard for others.

I gave up after 30 mins and tried to enjoy the spa section, only to have a child run and jump from behind, right on top of me. Not once but twice! Hurting my neck and spraining my toe. His mother was very apologetic. I get that kids are kids but honestly why isn't this pool more organised? Other pools post their lane availability online (this one does not) and most have set times for parents and kids to enjoy and separate times for people needing hydrotherapy. I'm so, so cranky. I can't wait for my usual pool to be open again. I realise now it's heaven compared to this pool.
showerReviews.author: Chantal Lilly (Twilight Creative)

locations.title: Parkinson Aquatic Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà751 Algester Rd, Parkinson QLD 4115

showerReviews.reviewText:
The two stars are for the female manager who was on shift on Sunday, the 2nd. She was an active listener.
I always visit this place for swimming because it‚Äôs only a 10-minute drive away, and the staff are usually friendly and engaging. I usually don‚Äôt rate places, but an incident yesterday left me really pissed. I thought I should bring this to your attention again.
A 40-year-old Caucasian man approached me in a disruptive manner, requesting we leave the lane for his convenience while I was sharing with a child. The reason given was it was the fast lane, but I explained that I was sharing with others. This led to an argument between us. I refused to move and engage further as I think this abusive behavior cannot be tolerated, so I said to him that I couldn‚Äôt understand him. He threatened to get someone to come to me if I refused to speak to him. A few minutes later, a staff member approached me for a conversation. I was extremely upset because he didn‚Äôt ask for the full story and instead asked us to move. It was a Sunday afternoon, and many families and children had come for fun. The pool was quite packed. I explained to him that the male was rude and disrespectful. He agreed that he thought the male was rude, but continued to ask us to move. There were two kids around, so they remained quiet. The mother had no choice but to ask them to leave the lane. I tried explaining to the young man by questioning his decision and thoughts, saying that the male couldn‚Äôt be an Olympic athlete. However, he accused me of being rude. Later, I saw him circled back to the man and have a brief chat before leaving. The man continued to stay in the lane. I came out of the pool, ran to the staff, and asked him to stop for a conversation. He didn‚Äôt respond, so I asked to speak to his manager. The lady was lovely and thought it would be fair for everyone to share the lane instead of the male kept it to himself for his preferences. She said she would speak to the man and offered me a free entry, which I declined. I expressed my gratitude, as I had used the pool before the incident.
My point is that this kind of behaviour is unacceptable, especially with children around. It would be beneficial to provide more training for staff on conflict resolution.
showerReviews.author: Jennifer Liang

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been a member for a number of years now and am sad to say the centre is going quickly downhill.
The hygiene is disgusting, the toilets consistently look like they have never been cleaned. I have personally witnessed discarded food left ontop of a female toilet bin for nearly a week, a public toilet should not be going a week without being cleaned, its absolutely disgraceful. The disabled toilet is an absolute disgrace too and not safe for anyone with a physical disability.
The gym equipment is so old and worn and bordering on a safety hazard.
Management are unprofessional whenever issues are brought up.
The swimming lessons are good but there doesn't seem to be any regular assessments for the children's levels and it just depends on what teacher you get if they get moved up or not.
Creche hours have decreased over the years too, used to have someone there for the mornings and afternoons, then it went to just mornings and now even thoses hours have decreased.

After all this today we get an email to advise us of price increases!
I understand prices need to go up occasionally but as a crossfit member our fees went up $20 compared to the city health's $4 increase. This is after we have already had 2 classes cut in the last couple of months. Its no secret the centre management have no interest in the crossfit section of the centre, even though we have the most expensive membership price we are treated like an inconvenience. We are never advertised on the parkinson page, new members are never advised of our existence when they enquire/sign up to the centre and then management wonder why we dont get many new members, which is a shame because we have 2 amazing, qualified crossfit coaches who work with all fitness levels and all the members there are very welcoming and supportive.
showerReviews.author: Danielle Friday

showerReviews.reviewText:
After reading other reviews about rude staff, it reminded me of our own experience over the two years my son attended swimming lessons here, so I felt it was worth leaving a review.

We attended Langlands weekly for swimming lessons. The younger staff members were generally lovely, but there are a few senior staff members who are consistently rude and dismissive, particularly an older female staff member at reception.

I had twin girls who were two years old at the time, and we often had to wait for their four year old brother to finish his lesson. There is a large play area for children, but it was always closed. Every week, without fail, my toddlers would be told off or shouted at for even touching the toys through the small plastic fence. When I once asked when the play area would be open, the staff member snapped at me, ‚ÄúIt says closed. That means it‚Äôs closed.‚Äù This wasn‚Äôt an isolated incident. It was the same ongoing rudeness, week after week, from the same person, who still works there.

Another incident that still stands out was finding a large piece of human faeces in the middle of the girls‚Äô change rooms. I reported it to staff, expecting it to be cleaned up promptly. Instead, it was left there with only a yellow warning sign placed over it. No one removed it for a significant amount of time, which was both unhygienic and shocking in a children‚Äôs facility.

The final incident that made us leave involved a senior staff member who interfered with my parenting. My son had two minutes left of his final lesson and said he was bored and wanted to get out. I calmly told him to finish the last two minutes. The owner stepped in and repeatedly told him he didn‚Äôt have to go back in, directly contradicting me in front of my child. Each time I said he needed to finish the lesson, she told him the opposite. My son was left confused and upset, not knowing who to listen to. It was an extremely uncomfortable and bizarre situation.

Overall, it‚Äôs a shame, because the lessons themselves were fine and some staff were genuinely kind. Unfortunately, the attitude of a few senior staff members completely ruins the atmosphere of the swim school.
showerReviews.author: Super Party Heroes

showerReviews.reviewText: I‚Äôm swimming here at the moment while Jindalee Pool undergoes maintenance for the next month. This pool looks fantastic, the facilities are very clean and the water is a great temp (I‚Äôm amazed the heater held up with the 10 degree weather this morning), my only issue is that there seems to be no order with regards to lane availability. The website says there‚Äôs 4 lap swimming lanes available most mornings from 5am, but when I swam on Tuesday and Thursday this week, there was barely even one lane available with the squad/program swimmers taking over the designated lap lanes. At one point there were 9 people in a laps lane and approximately 5 of them were squad swimmers, as a total amateur it was a bit stressful to keep up with them so as not to slow them down! I could even see one of them getting a bit annoyed that they couldn‚Äôt overtake due to the number of people in the lane. I‚Äôm wondering if the website/lane designation is inaccurate or if this is normal pool etiquette for Dunlop? Either way I am keen for Jindalee Pool to reopen.
showerReviews.author: Hannah Campbell

showerReviews.reviewText:
I took my daughter out of the swimming classes in this swimming pool. My daughter was stuck in a level for 2 years and every time that I asked the pool manager to upgrade my daughter she was just saying it is not the time yet!!! Two years and my daughter was literally lost her interest in coming to the classes as she didn't see any improvement in her class.
The teachers were changing every time so kids couldn't make really a good connections with their teachers as of these chainging.
The manager is a very grumpy character and when I pulled out my daughter from the swimming class, no one of the swimming pool followed us to ask the reason and try to resolve the issue!!!

NEVER RECOMMEND AS YOUR KIDS WILL LOSE THEIR SWIMMING LEARNING INTEREST IN THIS SWIMMING CLASSES

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our children have had swimming lessons at Dunlop Park Pool for several years. The whole staff have been exceptionally welcoming and accommodating. The whole family loves swimming at the pool. We appreciate the expanded kiosk. The change facilities are adequate but more family change facilities would be an improvement. The play pools are great fun and lap swimming is always catered for. In recent years the water quality has been great so whatever changes were made have been well worthwhile.

We have really appreciated the lessons. Our main instructor has been Kayla who has been brilliant. The other instructors have also proven great when filling in.
showerReviews.author: Calum Johnston

locations.title: Goodlife Health Clubs Queen Street
locations.address: ÓÉàG08/209 Queen St, Brisbane City QLD 4000

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am writing to express my disappointment regarding a very unpleasant experience I had yesterday at your gym.

I had the opportunity to join a one-day trial arranged through my school, and my friends and I were escorted to the gym by two trainers who introduced themselves as Sophie and Amy (although I may not remember their names perfectly). After arriving, we were given a brief tour of the facilities, followed by a membership sales explanation. Up to this point, everything seemed fine.

However, when my friends and I expressed that we were not currently interested in signing up for a membership, their attitude toward us noticeably changed. They became dismissive and unprofessional, and as a result, we were not allowed to proceed with the workout experience we had been promised.

We were clearly informed beforehand that we would be able to participate in a one-day workout trial, and we were instructed to bring water bottles and towels ‚Äî so we all came fully prepared. Yet, simply because we were not ready to register for a membership on the spot, we were effectively sent out without being able to use any facilities.

This was extremely disappointing. We did not even have the chance to experience the gym before being asked to consider membership, which goes against the basic expectation of a trial session. Trying the facilities first is a reasonable step for any potential client.

While I may not recall their names precisely, both staff members behaved in a manner that felt disrespectful and far from professional. This experience has made us feel uncomfortable, and we would not consider training with them based on how we were treated. Staff members should not react emotionally or treat guests differently simply because they choose not to register immediately.

We did not receive the service we were promised, and I strongly believe that these trainers should receive further guidance on professional conduct and customer service.

I hope the gym will look into this matter seriously.
showerReviews.author: ÍπÄÏ£ºÏó∞

locations.title: Streets Beach
locations.address: ÓÉàStanley St Plaza, South Brisbane QLD 4101

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very much a below par experience here. Perfectly located overlooking Streets Beach and a prime tourist location in Brisbane.
We were looking forward to ordering a Byrons Bay draft beer but they were sold out ... So had to order our second choice, Noosa Heads, which was good but not a local drink.
Next, no WiFi. Why??
We ordered the drinks and food on the QR code on the table and can honestly say, I have never known such a long wait to get a drink. They weren't even busy. So can't imagine what it must be like when busy!
Ordered the calamari and garlic prawn linguine, allegedly with parsley and chives. The parsley was sparse and limp and you'd need a microscope to see any chives. The linguine was swimming in fat and really cool. Would not have eaten but I was very hungry so managed to.
It was a great location and we were happy to pay a premium price for where we were but will not return.
We were given a warm welcome from a friendly guy and saw him again briefly at the end but that was the best bit of this visit.
showerReviews.author: Lesley Johnson

locations.title: Colmslie Beach Reserve
locations.address: ÓÉà152 Colmslie Rd, Murarrie QLD 4172

showerReviews.reviewText: Wat an awsum park it is huge,  it keeps going n going. It is a water themed park n it looks like it would be so much fun, there is a "creek" with turtles n fish in it, then a school of fish swimming along, there is a treasure chest, an anchor ‚öìÔ∏è,  a half sunken ships steering wheel, there was only one sprinkler working unfortunately. Up the top there are baby swings n toddler swings, n bigger kids swings all set in a "circle" so u can watch each other swing,  a couple of üõù n also a fully covered bright coloured slide. There is also a big blue octopus you can walk into with plaques from different schools in the area. The toilet facilities are a decent size and also have a disabled stall. There is a big sandpit area with a shipwreck and a giant yellow fish n a bench n sinks for water play. Then there is a big giant red ü¶Ä, a lilac octopus üêô  a yellow submarine which has tape around it so not meant to be used, this area is for water play n the ground is made to be like rolling waves, but unfortunately there were rocks thrown around n was very messy n unsafe looking n the water wasn't working. Then there is the climbing frame playground which has something for everybody n seems to all interconnect plus a couple more swings. There is so much seating n footpaths for scootering or biking or skating. The ground is uneven, as in going up n down hills n flat ground different types of pathways. The gardens are well developed but need some TLC. There is plenty of parking plenty of tables n chairs n covered area, there is a track leading down to the Brisbane River which has a flat beach like edging.  This place has so much imagination put into it I hope it gets fixed up n used properly again . Oh and a flying fox n heaps n heaps of shade from some beautiful old trees. Plenty of parking
showerReviews.author: Kim Hanrahan

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠êÔ∏è 1 Star Review ‚≠êÔ∏è

Absolutely disappointed with the food at Point Lookout Surf Life Saving Club. We spent $70 and honestly feel like it was completely wasted.

The lasagna was absolutely disgusting ‚Äî it tasted like a watered-down, cheap supermarket lasagna with no flavour and no care put into it. The garlic bread was dry as anything and just tasted plain gross. To make it worse, the prawns were served with no sauce at all and not even water provided to wash your hands afterward.

For the price, this was a huge letdown. Poor quality, poor presentation, and zero attention to basic details. Definitely won‚Äôt be eating here again.
showerReviews.author: Jeff and Angie

showerReviews.reviewText: This is our second time at Seaworld Resort and we love staying here. Very convenient, they have choices of restaurants inside the resort, walking distance to Seaworld theme park, and the facility is clean. We are happy with the service from cleaners, concierge, and reception. Receptionist named Rain was very helpful everytime we have questions or concerns. There was a time when we can‚Äôt connect our phone to chrome cast in our tele and they sent and IT to get our connection fixed. They have available towels near the pool that you can borrow which is very convenient. Lots of activities for kids. We lot the appearance of Spongebob and watching a movie in their theatre room. It was a very nice experience and we will be coming back again for sure.

locations.title: Brisbane Holiday Village
locations.address: ÓÉà10 Holmead Rd, Eight Mile Plains QLD 4113

showerReviews.reviewText:
As we needed to be based near Brisbane CBD, we chose this caravan park/holiday village due to the excellent reviews and we were not disappointed! We had a powered caravan site surrounded by palm trees and sub-tropical gardens. The lawned areas are lush & green. Amenities are spotlessly clean and modern. Laundry facilities were ample with large washing lines adjacent. Pool is clean and well maintained. The park is 1.2km from
Westfield Mount Gravatt (previously known as Garden City). There are bus stops just outside the park entrance. We stayed for 9 nights and really enjoyed the vibe of the park - beautiful gardens and quite peaceful considering the location near main road. Highly recommend this place.
showerReviews.author: Sue Woods

showerReviews.reviewText:

Completely unhelpful, disorganised and money ripping caravan park not only can u only stay for a month u have to go through a tenancy application which is ridiculous considering ur hiring a concrete pad. Bond of 200 per week on top of site fees what are people going to destroy? also no leniency for someone who is trying to get back on their feet. If u have only just started work and u are homeless don't go looking here you will get no help. Also told can't reapply wtaf? Happy to rip u off and tell u one thing but allow different rules for others... hrmmm second guess ur stay here..
Ladies windows always seem to be open in shower blocks? Have had to close them several times. No communal kitchen and very old outdated facilities would not recommend to anyone.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The cabin is clean, furnished, and air conditioned with one in the lounge room and one in the bedroom.
The kitchen has an electric stove, oven, and a microwave, and all the plates, pots and utensils we needed.
The bathroom is basic but clean and functional with a shower and gas water heater. The gas and water are included in the rent while you pay about ten bucks for electricity.
The grounds are lush with trees and lots of wild birds, and includes a swimming pool, showers, toilets, and a laundry that takes tokens.
There are one or two derelict cabins visible with external mold and disrepair but didn't really bother us.
The staff are really friendly.
Overall, a pleasant place to stay.
showerReviews.author: Zac Congo

showerReviews.reviewText:
I can‚Äôt praise the new managers, Jodie and John, enough.  They work tirelessly to ensure the caravan park is a great community to be part of, albeit temporarily.

We left our van for two nights while we enjoyed McLeay island and everything was secure etc when we returned.   We stayed a total of 2 weeks, through the giant hail storms in late Nov 25.  The community spirit really showed when the vans/vehicles were damaged.

Amenities are spotlessly clean.

Don‚Äôt be put off by the ratio of permanents to touring sites - this is a really friendly, caring community that is very well run.

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed in cabin 52 for 7 days - visiting my son & young granddaugters. The cabin was clean & tidy. The bed was comfortable. I found it great having a washing machine to use in the cabin (that was a bonus) I found the long lost remote control cover for the kitchen light/fan when I moved the lounge to sweep the floor. The only gripe I have is that the air conditioning is inadequate for hot weather, the cabin is blasted by the full sun for most of the day. I had to hang two towels in the kitchen window to try & stop some of the heat from coming in. Luckily I was able to borrow a pedestal fan from my son to place in the doorway from the bedroom (where the air conditioner is located) blowing cool air into the living area to help alleviate the heat. It only just made the living area bearable on hot days.
showerReviews.author: LJ G (Bittern)

showerReviews.reviewText:
After being told from a friend about the location and quietness of the park itself, I booked in for our winter getaway.
After checking the park location and site map online I asked for a site away from the main road. The staff granted my request and allocated a site at the quieter end of the park which backs on to a park/ sporting fields.
My husband and I did a pre-arrival check and I was pleased with the site allocated.
Our stay was enjoyable in the peaceful surrounds, close to the beautiful bay and conveniences.
The amenities are cleaned daily, the staff very friendly and obliging.

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a perfectly fine park to stay at. Granted the amenities are old but they were always clean, more so than most places we have encountered in our year on the road.
The place has a lot of permanents but they were always friendly and nice so not sure what others got all twisted up about. Site we were given was large and spacious and considering you are less than 30mins to downtown Brisbane this is a good place to pull up to explore Brisbane. Supermarket, gym etc are a short walk away as is public transport.

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights in sept school holidays 2025 in the holiday stays lower section and after reading many questionable and negative reviews, we were pleasantly surprised üòä We stayed with our two young daughters and puppy. The amenities were clean, smelled clean and were cleaned every day. The key code to get into the shower/toilet block was working during our stay which was a plus. It wasn‚Äôt as loud or unpleasant as we‚Äôd read (and heard about) and the pool area was also nicer than we‚Äôd expected. Having dogs allowed was a bonus and the locals who lived there seemed nice enough too. I‚Äôm sure there are peaks and troughs of unpleasant times but for our long weekend stay we didn‚Äôt experience anything negative. The only downside was that we did ask to check in early as we also had family staying there for a short holiday in the site next to ours - they checked in the day before us - also but we're told we couldn't check in early. We assumed it was because the  site was still being used but our family said it was vacant so it left us confused - especially when we noticed many others checking into their site before 2pm. But otherwise it was a pleasant stay. Thanks
showerReviews.author: Leigh Jansen

showerReviews.reviewText: If I could give less than a 1 star I would. My partner booked over the phone all was very easy and staff were accommodation, when it came to arriving we were sent an email the day before with out site number and the codes for the amenities so we thought all very easy, efficient, this will be fine‚Ä¶ how wrong we were. We turned up, no gates on the park so anyone could come in and out as they pleased. We drove past the pool and thought wow this park looks fine but followed the map to our site and realised that was not the case. We were put on site T25 so the furthest right you could get of the main entrance, we pulled up past a few caravans with no wheels on, on cinder blocks, mould going down them and thought oh must just be one or two that are run down but when we took the hill down to our area it seems to be a running theme, already people shouting at each other and their kids, kids running free, partners arguing with each other. Now we didn‚Äôt want to judge those there but clearly a few of them were drug users and of the heavy drug variety, now I wouldn‚Äôt jump to conclusions if I hadn‚Äôt have used our closest amenities block which had the strongest smell of weed coming from it with people smoking outside. Myself and my partner slowly realised we cannot stay here! Now going off the photos online you would think this is a nice up to date looking park but I‚Äôm not sure when those photos were taken or if they were even of this park! Myself and my partner slowly looked over the reviews (something he should‚Äôve done before hand, but that was the first and last time he was in charge of booking a site for us) we realised that this clearly was a running theme with most reviews before us! Luckily we were able to get into another holiday park which was stunning and very accommodating (Brisbane holiday village - for anyone needing a recommendation close to the city!). My three words of advice I would give to anyone looking to stay here‚Ä¶ 1. Don‚Äôt put your partner in charge of the booking! 2. If you do allow him/her to book make sure they check the reviews and 3. Don‚Äôt book here at all!
showerReviews.author: Mia Shaw

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here for one night because we couldn‚Äôt check in to pine rivers Showgrounds on Sunday. The site (191) was too small for our caravan, had two sewerage holes that emitted bad smells, and the site is not level. The neighbour here was very tolerant. I felt bad as we parked way too close because we had to! The amenities were disgusting: old and wrecked. We walked around one evening and we both felt very sorry for people living here. Very happy to leave very early the next day and forfeit our second night. Please improve this place for the permanent residents and if you have a caravan do not stay here!!
Go to Pine Rivers Showgrounds - much much better or go further away from North Brisbane.
showerReviews.author: Lisa Hooyer

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here for one night because we couldn‚Äôt check in to pine rivers Showgrounds on Sunday. The site (191) was too small for our caravan, had two sewerage holes that emitted bad smells, and the site is not level. The neighbour here was very tolerant. I felt bad as we parked way too close because we had to! The amenities were disgusting: old and wrecked. We walked around one evening and we both felt very sorry for people living here. Very happy to leave very early the next day and forfeit our second night. Please improve this place for the permanent residents and if you have a caravan do not stay here!!
Go to Pine Rivers Showgrounds - much much better or go further away from North Brisbane.
showerReviews.author: Lisa Hooyer

showerReviews.reviewText:
AVOID THIS PARK AT ALL COSTS. This is by far the worst park we have stayed in during our 6 months of travelling - starting with the very rude staff at reception on arrival.  The site we were allocated was right beside the amenities and in amongst permanent residents whose sites were dirty and the residents ‚Äúsketchy‚Äù to say the least.  We felt like we were under surveillance by the permanent residents.  There was yelling & swearing & arguments at all hours of the day & night, people smoking in the laundry & amenities block - cigarette butts on the floors. - management don‚Äôt appear to care.

The amenities were dirty, air driers ‚Äúout of order‚Äù but no paper dispenser to dry hands with.  There are tiles missing of the floors & walls of the showers, the cubicles are filthy and the laundry appliances are also filthy.

As it was school holidays we were unable to find alternate accommodation- otherwise we would have driven straight back out.
showerReviews.author: Gail Pye

showerReviews.reviewText:
I don't ever write reviews, but this experience was so poor I had to.

Firstly, the hygiene was appalling. We had the distinct pleasure of grey water from long-term residents actually running through our site. Yes, you read that right. It was disgusting, and the smell was worse.

Adding to the delightful ambiance was the constant barrage of loud fighting and swearing coming from permanent residents camped right behind us. Not to mention the rubbish left on and around the site.

If you thought escaping to the amenities would offer respite, think again. They reeked of stale cigarettes, urine,  mould, and at one time illicit substances. Honestly, I felt cleaner before attempting to use them.

Beyond the general unpleasantness, there was an underlying feeling of being unsafe. The combination of the environment and the constant noise was unsettling, to say the least.

To top it all off, they charge a fortune for this "experience." I've stayed in far cleaner, quieter, and safer places for a fraction of the cost.

Do yourself a favour and steer well clear of this caravan park. It's overpriced, unhygienic, noisy, and frankly, a dreadful place to be. You'd have a more relaxing time in a bin.
showerReviews.author: Joshua Hancock

showerReviews.reviewText:
After reading reviews thought this park was a holiday village, On arrival after payment, which they wanted up front! Our designated spot was a piece of concrete with little grass nil shade! And No beach view. wouldn‚Äôt swim in the beach due to sludge and mud from city storm water pipes.
When questioned camp kitchen, informed that there was a barbecue area with sinks , nil plugs no bin, attempted to cook there 1 barbecue working, unable to use power point as a caravan was parked in barbecue area using the only power point.
Showering if you like a shower of an evening then with no screens you will have heaps of flying insects in with you!
If you have children please do not go to this place, No pool, no jumping pillow, no play area.
This park should be called the retirement village not Holiday!
We left with still having 3 weeks paid for and we don‚Äôt even have children!
Very disappointed!
Management were not very nice when challenged.
showerReviews.author: Warren Edge

locations.title: Arabella Motor Inn
locations.address: ÓÉà9 Minjungbal Dr, Tweed Heads South NSW 2486

showerReviews.reviewText: My partner and I stayed at Arabella Motor Inn for one night over the recent long weekend and were extremely disappointed in the room that was allocated to us. We paid a decent price and expected to have a room that was of a reasonable standard. At check-in, the owner said the eftpos machine was down so she could only take cash. We thought that was odd as you can still pay with card details. The hairdryer was cracked and broken and didn't work. A couple of the lights were faulty and also didn't work. The interior was old and the carpet was stained. The owner mentioned that there was no allocated car space for each unit so, first in first served! As it was a long weekend, all accommodation was "no vacancy". The owner definitely needs some customer service lessons. I would not recommend Arabella Motor Inn.
showerReviews.author: Debra Mullins

locations.title: BIG4 Sandstone Point Holiday Resort
locations.address: ÓÉà1820 Bribie Island Rd, Sandstone Point QLD 4511

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had such a wonderful experience at Sandstone Point Big4. From the moment we arrived, the cleanliness of the entire park was outstanding ‚Äî everything from the amenities to the grounds was spotless and clearly well cared for.
The location is perfect, offering a peaceful coastal atmosphere while still being close to shops, cafes, and the beautiful waterfront. It‚Äôs incredibly convenient without ever feeling busy or crowded.
The facilities were impressive and thoughtfully designed for families. The pools, playgrounds, and recreational areas were modern, well maintained, and easily accessible. There‚Äôs truly something for everyone.
We were pleasantly surprised by how quiet and relaxing the park was, even during busier periods. The noise levels were minimal, allowing for a restful stay and a great night‚Äôs sleep.
Access in and out of the park was simple, with well-signed roads and plenty of parking, making the whole stay smooth and stress-free.
Overall, Sandstone Point Big4 offers fantastic value for money. With its beautiful location, top-notch facilities, and exceptional cleanliness, it exceeded our expectations. We‚Äôll definitely be returning and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quality getaway!
showerReviews.author: Emily

showerReviews.reviewText: We absolutely loved our stay at BIG4 Sandstone Point on our van site! The park is beautifully maintained, with spacious, level sites and lush landscaping that makes it feel like a tropical escape. The amenities are spotless and modern ‚Äî great showers, laundry, and kitchen facilities. There‚Äôs so much to do, from the amazing pool and water park to the games room and playgrounds, perfect for both kids and adults. The staff were friendly, helpful, and made check-in a breeze. We also loved being so close to the Sandstone Point Hotel. It‚Äôs the perfect mix of relaxation and fun, and we can‚Äôt wait to return. One of the best BIG4s we‚Äôve stayed at, we will definitely be back.

locations.title: Ipswich Caravan Village
locations.address: ÓÉà95 Mount Crosby Rd, Tivoli QLD 4305

showerReviews.reviewText:
POSITIVES
1. Nice clean pool area
2. Tidy amenities
3. Male staff are friendly
4. Cheap, affordable
5. Pool man was kind enough to open the pool gates early.

NEGATIVES
1. When calling the office number, you have to try several times before anyone answers. If the female answers, she sounds very bored and bothered to help or answer questions.
2. Manageress that lives onsite in Ring crt 2 is very rude, has no people skills. Yes we made the mistake of parking on the grass area near the pool/amenities but she was very rude and approached us with an angry face.
3. Mostly permanent residents - not friendly. You'll get the odd few that were.
4. Office hours - open from 3pm to 6pm
5. Roads are uneven/damaged - like 4WD in a hatchback
6. Lights in cabins aren't working
7. Gas stove - weren't advised prior
8. Pool hours - 11am to 8pm - went to the pool at 7pm on our first day and it was locked.
9. 1 toilet hadn't been cleaned before our arrival and still wasn't when we left. We stayed 4 days.
10. Website is very misleading. The pictures are nowhere near what the place looks. Yes, maybe the picture of the pool, but that's about all. Understandable why there's only 8 pictures on their website
showerReviews.author: Theresita Namoa (Marie-Therese)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Loved this little quiet hidden campsite in a place you would never expect to find. üòÅ Check in was super easy. All is gated and they send you all the codes to get in and wifi password ahead of time. The man who greeted us was super nice and used his leaf blower to tidy up the 2 Bay area's for us. TY!

Nothing like I have ever been too and I would totally stay here again. Was 20 mins by Uber to downtown, has power, water, bathrooms, showers, pin long, tv, full kitchen. Super clean and tidy. Very eclectic and different vibe. Love it!!

Would def stay here again. For those who need a dump station, do it before you come as hey don't have one. (We didn't need it so all good with us) üòÑ

showerReviews.reviewText: At first glance, it appears to be a site in an industrial area. Upon closer inspection, it's a truly enchanting place (truly enchanting!), full of bold colors and small decorative details that you often only notice at second glance. The site isn't cheap (but it's still affordable for Brisbane) and is equipped with absolutely everything you need: clean toilets and showers, Wi-Fi, a fully equipped catering kitchen, and a huge common room that presumably hosts music events? Everything is online and superbly organized. We only had trouble getting in and out with the door code twice, but the vehicle gate code always worked from outside. Also very important was the good public transport connection to the city center, which worked really well with the bus (approx. 40 minutes, depending on the connection). Beautiful place with all the amenities!
showerReviews.author: Alexandra Brunner

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awesome camp-site, amenities are excellent not sure why people are complaining about them.
Toilets, hot showers with good pressure.
Well maintained grounds with fires permitted off ground and contained only.
Powered sites with water available.
Caretakers are amazing, friendly and very  accommodating!
This camp-site is very quiet and peaceful which is awesome as you can actually relax here and it's affordable at $20 per person per night (14 day max continuous stay, 48hr cooldown before returning and 100 nights max per 12 month period) with a one off $20 annual fee for scouts supporter but note on your second booking you have the option to remove the annual fee from the booking so you don't pay for it twice in a 12 month period.
Will be back as this is such a great place to be with the main town only a 10 min walk and plenty to do.
showerReviews.author: Tucker Husky

showerReviews.reviewText:
My 1 year old border collie was attacked by the dogs residing in the pictured caravan.
I found out these people have been there since December.

The men who raced to save my dogs life where then threatened to be beaten by the owner of this caravan.

I know for a fact these rigs have been on site since December.

The two week rule doesn't apply to close chums of the caretaker, Basil.

Who is thankfully being replaced in May.
Hopefully the new mob will keep the grass down, amenities clean and take the trash out.

This is one of my top 3 WORST campsites of QLD

Scouts honour.
showerReviews.author: Luna Trick

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic camping spot - flat, grassy area. 4WD access only. Was great to see a good number of families there with their kids. Quick walk to the beach (landside).  Must have beach & camping permits - Rangers patrol regularly. The area is respected by visitors & kept clean... take all rubbish with you. Fire pits available - BYO wood. Cold showers available - bore/brackish water. Toilets are fitted with a timed push-button light, stinky but relatively clean & surprisingly clear of creepy crawlies! Plenty of wildlife roaming - kangaroos, goannas, kookaburras, mozzies on steroids and sandflies; a quick spray of repellant kept them at bay.
showerReviews.author: Adelynne

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic camping spot - flat, grassy area. 4WD access only. Was great to see a good number of families there with their kids. Quick walk to the beach (landside).  Must have beach & camping permits - Rangers patrol regularly. The area is respected by visitors & kept clean... take all rubbish with you. Fire pits available - BYO wood. Cold showers available - bore/brackish water. Toilets are fitted with a timed push-button light, stinky but relatively clean & surprisingly clear of creepy crawlies! Plenty of wildlife roaming - kangaroos, goannas, kookaburras, mozzies on steroids and sandflies; a quick spray of repellant kept them at bay.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We camped between Christmas and New years 2019.  The campground is split into 2 sections. One is an open camping area without numbered sites suitable for camper trailers, and the other side has 14 numbered sites each with a car park which could accommodate 1-2 vehicles.
We stayed on tent site #13 which seemed to have one of the larger spaces.
The tent section despite being fully booked out was only around half full, where as the open camping area was very tightly packed.  There were some huge groups that looked to be around 20+ people.

Facilities are average quality with 2 cold, salt water showers with little more than a dribble.  There are only 3 toilets which are a "hybrid" system.  They were reasonably clean but smelly.  Unfortunately with such large numbers of people on site the toilets were often queued up for.

Access to the beach area is great and you're able to walk around on the sand to some smaller more secluded mangrove sections.
Swimming is possible but only when the tide is high.  There's about a 30mt walk to where the water drops off which is knee to waist height.
Fishing looked to be successful for most people giving it a go.

Ocean beach is a nice day trip which took us around 40 minutes north through the inland sand track.  Driving conditions are slow (speed limit is only 30 kph ?!?) and the sand can be really soft and heavy going through some sections.  We didn't get stuck but if you happened to there would always be someone coming past soon enough to give you a hand.

The rangers turned up every day at around 9am which is nice to see.  We've stayed in almost every national park campground in SEQ and they've never been this consistent.   We saw people get asked to leave due to not having bookings or vehicle passes.  Good to see the rules were being enforced and these guys don't mess around.  So do the right thing and get your bookings in order.

Overall we were very happy with the site.  The location is great but these days every bogan and his dog have a 4WD vehicle so it's not exactly a hidden gem.
We'll be coming back but more likely to be in the lower season.  Mozzies and Midgies galore around summer so expect to come home with few dozen bites.
showerReviews.author: Luke Wiggins

showerReviews.reviewText: If you are thinking of camping here, be prepared you will need a 4x4  with reasonable clearance as the sand is quite soft ( lower pressures to 20 psi) before you start, make sure you have Maxtrax, and a shovel ideally recovery points if bogged. Then pack the insect repellent  tropical strength) the mozzies are every where. You need to be fully  self sufficient  while camping. The toilet is clean and the shower is cold and the mozzies make sure its a quick shower. Don't forget the permits there is camera monitoring of number plates, print out your permits and leave were the rangers can see, they monitor closely.
showerReviews.author: Glenn Mackenzie

showerReviews.reviewText:
Neurum Creek Retreat surprised me in all the best ways. For someone scarred by a history of camping trips that were more ordeal than escape, I came in skeptical, but I left wishing I could stay longer.

The sprawling 312-acre site offers plenty of breathing room, even on a busy long weekend. The spaces are so well spread out that we could talk loudly around our campfire and blast our favourite tunes without triggering the ire of a neighbouring campsite. Shade is plentiful throughout the grounds, but if you're looking for particularly shady spots within the campgrounds, sites D19-22 are worth checking out.

We had a big group - ten adults and eleven kids, ranging from 3 to 16 - a loud, chaotic crew with endless energy. But the grounds handled us with no trouble at all. There were bike tracks for the kids who couldn‚Äôt sit still, hiking trails for the adventurous, and 1.5 kilometers of creek frontage for anyone needing to cool off or just relax by the water.

The creek became our oasis, perfect for setting up eskies and coolcabanas while we swam and unwound for hours. Nearby, just a short drive away, Rocky Hole adds to the experience - a beautiful swimming spot carved into the granite gullies of Mount Mee. With cool water and spots for rock-jumping, it‚Äôs a favorite for good reason. The off-road track to get there can be a bit tricky - we managed in a Honda CRV by taking it slow, but in wet or muddy conditions, you‚Äôll definitely need a 4WD.

There are plenty of campfire spots scattered across the Neurum Creek grounds, ensuring most campers can enjoy this essential part of the experience. The site is dog-friendly and well-maintained, with showers and toilets that were impressively clean (even the long drops).

Neurum Creek isn‚Äôt just a campsite; it‚Äôs a sanctuary to escape from the grind, unplug, hang out with friends and family, and enjoy the outdoors.
showerReviews.author: Chris Owen

Tracey and her crew are super helpful, they put on some great events (which can get overly busy), but having just camped in my favourite site (to remain a secret üòÇ) it‚Äôs always the most beautiful room in the house.

Great little shop for firewood, ice and essentials, with showers and drop toilets.

showerReviews.reviewText:
A recreational and conservation campground with facilities to experience camping, hiking, bird watching, cycling and horse riding.
There's a toilet and camp kitchen with camp sites and a large dam all surrounded by natural bushland.
Recently revisited this site after weather damage and closures of walking trails.
Experienced "Culture on Country" as part of Galvanised Festival produced by the Ipswich City Council.
A day of learning and reconnection.
Let's all get educated and acknowledge traditional indigenous ownership of this country Ipswich region, Yuggera, Jagera & Ugarapul people.‚ù§üíõüñ§
Beautiful surrounds so close to Ipswich.
Check the council website for campground bookings, rules and conditions including providing your own water and fire wood.
No dogs allowed to protect the integrity of the native flora and fauna. I was disappointed to see that the council had let a member of the public blatantly bring a dog into this native reserve during the event.
showerReviews.author: Miss N

BUT the Public Toilets are really disgusting... dirty and smelly... there was hardly any water to wash your hands after you had finished... Ipswich City Council need to get someone in regularly to keep these toilets clean or to get rid of the cleaners you have now cause they are not doing their job.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hidden Gem in Mount Crosby ‚Äì A True Local Treasure

Tyalgum Scout Camp is one of those rare places you almost don‚Äôt want to share‚Äîbecause it‚Äôs just that special. Tucked away in peaceful Mount Crosby, it's humble but full of heart. With most central Brisbane campsites now gone, this is one of the last truly accessible options close to the city.

The site itself is beautiful, well-kept, and offers a genuine outdoor experience without being far from amenities‚Äîjust minutes from shops and only about an hour from the Gold Coast or Brisbane CBD. The local community and neighbors are incredibly supportive and welcoming too.

This place deserves all the support it can get. By booking or spreading the word, you're helping keep this valuable community space alive. Highly recommend for anyone wanting an authentic, close-to-home camping experience.
showerReviews.author: Gregory K

showerReviews.reviewText:
Tyamolum camp site overall was pleasant, a nice campground close enough to Brisbane and yet feels much further disconnected to the city with beautiful surrounds in a quiet area, I would love to come back if it were not for the bathroom....

I have been travelling around Australia for a while now and consider myself to be pretty tolerant and used to bathrooms of all sorts, this was on another level. The bathroom resembles that of a horror movie, I honestly felt unsafe being there at night time and it felt like Jason from Friday the 13th was going to come visit me. The smell of urine is so bad your nostrils flare up and you can literally taste the it, I would be surprised if the toilets have been cleaned within the year. There is urine stained all over the toilet seats, the sinks are filthy, my partner refused to go in there any time due to the condition. There is also no hot water, this is fine for me as I usually have cold showers, but after about 2 minutes of using the shower and water slows down to the pace of a tortoise and you are forced to endure quiet possibly the worst shower ever.

Like I said overall the horrible bathroom does not ruin the beautiful and well located camp ground. But paying $35 a night I would hope some of that money would go towards cleaning the dirtiest bathroom I have ever encountered. I hope to christ I never find a bathroom dirtier.
showerReviews.author: Rhys Bower

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fun! Water play wasn't on when we went there, just the little rock pools but we still had a great time. There is a beautiful huge tree with a large canopy and a deck below with seats where you can have lunch or dry off after swim. The play ground is geared to older kids, over 5 because of the height of some of the drops but there is also a little kids playground which is totally shaded by trees!
The park is expansive and we barely scratched the surface so we'll be back for sure.

locations.address: ÓÉà167-171 Sheridan St, Cairns North QLD 4870

showerReviews.reviewText: Very tiny room. Mini mini fridge with no shelves so can barely hold anything (see pic). Probably why they gave us this small milk for 6 days. Peeling paint in the shower (see pic) so each time you wash yourself, you end up with paint on your feet. Exhaust not working so make sure you do number 2 when your partner is not here. The management is aware so they ask you to close the door while showering so the alarm is not activated (see photo). Smallest tv in the world (see pic) and remote shows Netflix and all but it's not true, there are only regular chanels. BBQ present but you have to pay $2 per 5mins (forgot to take pic). Requested and paid for queen bed but they attached 2 single beds to each other (really uncomfortable/inconvenient). If you lock yourself out after hours, they charge $100 even if someone is on the premises to open for you. Swimming pool is disgusting, million of whitish stuff floating in it that you don't see at first. It's at the bottom of the pool. Start walking/swimming and all comes up. Definitely don't put your head under water! I think I should stop there, you get it, very disappointed and do not recommend! The only positive thing is the staff been friendly.
showerReviews.author: Sarah Oliny

locations.title: Palm Hamilton Backpackers
locations.address: ÓÉà506 Kingsford Smith Dr, Hamilton QLD 4007

showerReviews.reviewText:
Without a doubt, the worst place I‚Äôve ever stayed. I‚Äôve had better nights‚Äô sleep on airport benches.

You can hear every single car from the street and every passionate debate happening outside at 3 a.m. Who needs white noise when you have that soundtrack?

At one point, a staff member entered our room unannounced to show it to a potential guest (poor soul). They even had a nice little chat inside the room while everyone was sleeping. Not that it made any difference ‚Äî with those paper-thin walls, privacy is just a myth anyway. Oh, and did I mention the ‚Äúkitchen‚Äù inside the room? Plates with leftover food were scattered around, giving the room a‚Ä¶ unique aroma.

The front door doesn‚Äôt seem to close properly, so if you‚Äôre looking for a free night, just show up late ‚Äî apparently, everyone‚Äôs welcome!

Some beds had curtains, some didn‚Äôt. Honestly, the ones that did were probably better off without them ‚Äî they didn‚Äôt block light, sound, or disappointment. If I tried to list everything that didn‚Äôt work, this review would be endless.

The bathroom deserves a special mention. I didn‚Äôt know it was possible to feel dirtier after taking a shower, but this hostel made it happen. Bravo.

And yes, there were cockroaches and mystery creatures everywhere ‚Äî but to be fair, they were less unsettling than some of the long-term ‚Äúresidents.‚Äù I think I met about four actual backpackers; the rest looked like they‚Äôd been living there since the building was constructed.

And here‚Äôs the best part: I had barely finished paying for my stay when the guy at reception smiled and said, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt forget to leave us a review!‚Äù
I hadn‚Äôt even seen the hostel yet. Well‚Ä¶ now I have.

So here‚Äôs your review.
showerReviews.author: Ibrahim Darwich

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a cheap and nasty place.
The ‚Äúguests‚Äù are almost all men who spend the day smoking, vaping and drinking beer - a few metres from the rooms.

One complaint is you will be charged more than what you paid online. There is NO city tax in Brisbane but they charge it anyway!

Apart from one room, the rooms on the ground floor have no windows and are small and narrow. You are basically sleeping in a cupboard with 2 double bunks.

Upstairs has a very small air conditioner that cools one bed only, so the 7 other beds upstairs are hot. Don‚Äôt stay in these beds in summer . Also the beds upstairs are in the same room as the kitchen so it‚Äôs noisy and smelly.

The bathroom downstairs has flying insects and the toilet is gross. The toilet upstairs doesn‚Äôt seem to be cleaned regularly.

The traffic noise is bad as this place is on a six-lane road.

There is a TV but there‚Äôs just one sofa in front of it and men sit on it smoking and drinking so you can‚Äôt say this place has a lounge area.

There‚Äôs a grubby ‚Äúlaundry‚Äù area but I wouldn‚Äôt wash my dog in it. I hung a linen shirt there to dry but I saw the manager take the coathanger and just leave my shirt hanging over the line!

Also note the top bunks have ladders made from pieces of roughly cut timber screwed together. There are no grab rails so expect difficulty. My bed had a screw protruding into the bunk area!

Needless to say, cheap sheets and worn out towels - beware they are washed on site and not by a proper laundry. I imagine the washing machines are never cleaned.

The manager is belligerent and unpleasant. While I was there, he was drunk for 3 days and I found him lying on a bunk without a sheet.  If you insist on staying, buy a can of disinfectant to sanitise your area.

The ‚Äúcupboards‚Äù in the rooms downstairs are just timber sheets nailed together - not proper lockers and there aren‚Äôt enough for everyone. Upstairs, there are only two cupboards with doors that didn‚Äôt reach all the way to the top so not secure. People just left their stuff on the floor in the kitchen. One night I could hardly enter the area as cans of beer blocked the passageway.

I wouldn‚Äôt use the kitchen and the fridge upstairs smelt badly - uncovered food on the shelves .

Our room had a woman whose odour was worse than I have ever experienced. Another person in our room screamed at snorers and had such a menacing fight with another in our room, that the rest of us ran outside in pyjamas. Then we were locked out of the room by one of those fighting.

The ineffectual manager of course nothing.  Neither did the owner.

The manager also has no respect for privacy - he enters rooms at random, even late at night, without knocking. They can also move you from room to room without asking.

I has several things stolen so be aware.

A garden runs alongside the ‚Äúoutdoors‚Äù area and some people reported seeing rats but luckily I didn‚Äôt see any evidence.

The only good thing is there a supermarket across the road, a few takeaway shops nearby - and there‚Äôs a car park on a vacant lot next door (charges apply). Public transport is handy but it‚Äôs about 25 minutes to the CBD.

DO NOT STAY HERE
showerReviews.author: JAB F

The place could be decent but is bad managed

locations.title: City Backpackers HQ
locations.address: ÓÉà380 Roma St, Brisbane City QLD 4000

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place wasn‚Äôt the worst hostel we‚Äôve been to in Australia, but it wasn‚Äôt that far off to be completely honest‚Ä¶

The staff were really nice and helpful, definitely dont have a bad word to say about them. It was nice to have bathroom towels in the room, and our room in general was fine. Whilst the room didnt have it‚Äôs own aircon control, it was a comfortable temperature. The location of the place is also pretty convenient if you want to get to Roma Street station or surrounding areas.

However, I think we were abit unlucky with our room. We had some sort of generator outside our door. We thought it was a big washing machine or something when we arrived, but it continued constantly throughout our stay. There was also quite abit of noise from the bathroom which was opposite too. It felt like the majority of residents didnt respect the quiet hours of the hostel - there was loads of people shouting and running up and down the halls until way past midnight.

By the end of the night, the kitchen was a bit of a dump and people definitely did not clean up after themselves. It did feel like there was quite a few people living at the hostel, which does affect the feeling of the place.

Overall, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to people for a long period of time, but for a short stay it‚Äôs acceptable.
showerReviews.author: Harry Bateman

I had a private en suite room for one night, then a couple nights in a girls dorm. Both were absolutely immaculate and clean. The communal bathroom / showers were clean all times of the day. The rooftop is a great place to hang out any time of day too, and the kitchen has everything you need.
Super quick walk into the city and good transport links nearby.

showerReviews.reviewText: Spent two nights in this ho(s)tel. It contains individual rooms as well as the classical hostel rooms. I had an individual room. Otherwise the staff was very correct, friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good, we enjoyed it.

locations.title: Summer House Brisbane
locations.address: ÓÉà350 Roma St, Brisbane City QLD 4000

showerReviews.reviewText:
I LOVED it here! The team were so friendly and as a solo traveller the events made it so easy to meet new people and make friends! I loved the pancakes morning before going for a little run across the bridge, and it‚Äôs a short walk from the city centre too so very easy to see the city!

They have a team that keep all the facilities looking sparkling and the female bathrooms were always very clean with plugs for hairdryers and straighteners so perfect place to get ready!

I loved the dining space as you had the chance to chat to people over a shared meal, one night we made a big pasta dish and shared it between everyone which made it feel like a family so far from home!

Would definitely recommend and i will certainly be back next time i‚Äôm in brisbane!
showerReviews.author: Bella

locations.title: Bunk Brisbane
locations.address: ÓÉà21 Gipps St, Fortitude Valley QLD 4006

showerReviews.reviewText: Ok so I stayed in this hostel for a few months and here‚Äôs an honest break down. The location of this place is amazing, right in the centre, close to the nightlife and shops Aswell as the metro which is very convenient. Here‚Äôs the downsides, the kitchen is disgusting, people don‚Äôt seem to know how to clean pans and plates and the cleaners do nothing about it also the opening times of the kitchen are inconvenient if you work nights. The staff for the most part are pretty friendly and pretty chatty. There is not really any social life in this hostel, if you‚Äôre travelling and wanting to meet people, this is absolutely NOT the place. Every room I was in had cockroaches in the toilet and shower. The WiFi literally never works and it seemed to be a dead zone for my mobile data, I‚Äôd get like 2 bars of signal maximum. The biggest killer about this hostel is how much they jack up the rent, at the end of my stay I was paying around $420 a week and they were trying to increase it to $500! to stay in an 8 person dorm which is absolute insanity!!! If you work full time on a casual contract it‚Äôs around half of your weekly paycheck! If you‚Äôre a traveller coming to Brisbane looking for a job like I did, do NOT stay here, your money will go insanely fast at this place, there are much cheaper alternatives that offer the same services. All in all, I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôd recommend this place to anyone, it has a special place in my heart cause I stayed here for months with my friends as we were trying to save every penny we could to move out, however the price can NOT be justified and it‚Äôs not a social place at all, so do what you will with this infomation‚Ä¶
showerReviews.author: J V S

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve traveled all around Australia and this is one of the best hostels I‚Äôve stayed in!
Great price, air conditioning, unlimited hot water with good pressure. The cleaning staff do an excellent job.
The menu prices for guests are amazing (only $13). I‚Äôve never eaten so cheap, so tasty and well served in Australia, and they even give you complimentary wine/beer with your meal!!!

The receptionist from Colombia was very kind, with great customer service skills and excellent English and Spanish.
I will definitely stay here again!
showerReviews.author: nicolle acosta

locations.title: O'Shea's Crossing Rest Area
locations.address: ÓÉà1343 Esk Kilcoy Rd, Caboonbah QLD 4311

showerReviews.reviewText: A truly relaxing and surprising gem of a rest area that we'd driven past many times. There are several covered picnic areas and an electric BBQ. The toilet amenities are excellent with disable access. There is a lot of grassed area to utilise and the whole park is very spacious. Ample parking and room to let the kids run. The water views are serene with various fauna abundant throughout. There is no playground equipment and the area overall is very tidy with little litter or graffiti to be seen. Also located a bit further back from the highway so your cuppa and break isn't disturbed by highway traffic.
showerReviews.author: Troy and Kerri Simpson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Toilets can be displeasing at times,  however overall , tolerable... significant contributing factor could be that when the cleaner that comes early morning, just sits in her van for over 20mins, takes in a roll & toilet brush & literally walks bk out again...?
... wish I could land a job thats paid to simply "appear" productive .... ! Lol
If she did her job perhaps amenities could be slightly improved ?
Lazy and careless, selfish visitors don't help in the slightest... im placing bets they don't treat their loo @home the way I've witnessed many people disregard the facilities here...
Council mow & employ cleaners, that do attend 3-4 times throughout the day that ive seen.
But the entitled & more wealthy travellers be far too superior of such budget run areas...
The resident homesless are naturally guarded towards the judgment of the visiting touring blow ins... who with their  large & cumbersome & visually awkward  manoeuving vehicles around occasionally a very densly populated area.. one can't help but wonder if they may be more comfortable suituating at a paid caravan park facility ... rather than looking down their noses, gazing across the now quite dated location, with a derogatorive deminor & stereotypical assumptions... remembering that the site has been completely submerged in several flood events over the years & still holds a sentimental history for many that frequent regularly üôÇ

locations.title: Urban Xtreme
locations.address: ÓÉà4/370 Nudgee Rd, Hendra QLD 4011

showerReviews.reviewText:
Urban Xtreme in Brisbane feels completely neglected when it comes to the under-fives area. What‚Äôs meant to be a space for little ones is rundown, poorly maintained, and clearly an afterthought. Several parts of the play area are broken, and there‚Äôs next to nothing that actually entertains or engages children in this age range. It gives the impression that it hasn‚Äôt been properly cared for or updated in a long time.

What‚Äôs worse, there‚Äôs an emergency exit with a low handle that opens straight into the car park ‚Äî a serious safety hazard for toddlers. It‚Äôs shocking that this hasn‚Äôt been addressed.

The bathroom facilities were also in poor condition ‚Äî unclean, and out of five women‚Äôs toilets, only one had toilet paper. It really summed up the overall lack of attention and care across the venue.

The staff seem undertrained and unable to manage even simple requests without waiting for a manager to step in, and the caf√© food is inconsistent and low quality. The overall vibe is one of neglect and disorganisation rather than fun and family-friendly.

And while the height limit may technically allow kids 7-10 yrs on the Ninja course, the reality is that most can‚Äôt even reach the equipment, making it more frustrating than enjoyable.

For families with younger children, I strongly recommend choosing another venue. There are far better-maintained and genuinely child-friendly places in Brisbane that care about safety, hygiene, and engagement ‚Äî all things Urban Xtreme seems to have forgotten.
showerReviews.author: jasmine Craven

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pools: no catering for anyone with a physical impairment. Highly disappointing.

Life Guards: seem to watch their step counts than watch safety. At other Rackley pools life guards stop kids pushing each other in the pool and bomb diving especially in the shallow parts of the pool.

Families: there is a kids pool and a water slide. Lots and lots of kids screaming and yelling. So if your kid screams, don‚Äôt worry- it‚Äôs not unusual.

Mullets: ive never seen so many mullets in my life.

Cleanliness: there was a storm yesterday late arvo/early evening. But the pool was filthy.

Parking: lots available.

Bring sunscreen and cold drinks. Whilst there are undercover areas, there‚Äôs lots of sun.

Brisbane City Council $2 pool admission in summer is highly commendable. Lots of families.

Bathrooms: Horrid! In need of major renovations and putrid! I wish i had water shoes to wear. Showerhead had green build up that limited water coming out. Worst bathrooms in brisbane pool centres.

Overall: im never coming back

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôm not sure if it was because it rained in the morning, but the bottom of the pool was covered with leaves and the water visibility was very poor, probably less than five metres.

The pool was also very crowded, with many people just holding onto the lane ropes and playing in the water. If you come here for serious lap swimming, I would strongly not recommend it.

The pool itself is not a standard size lap pool, with only six lanes. The changing room is also quite limited, with only two shower cubicles, so you need to queue when it gets busy.

At the current $2 entry price it‚Äôs acceptable, but at the normal full price, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it at all.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Update 23/12/23: the bathrooms have been renovated! They now have a beautifully clean bathroom and change room area. There are a couple toilets, but only two showers so that is the only downside- you may have to wait a bit for the showers. But other than that, love it!

My go to pool since moving here. It is a decent sized pool with good amounts of parking and good seating areas too. The place is currently under construction so there is no outdoor water bubbler or clock, and the change rooms, toilets and showers are makeshift ones (which are sometimes not very well cared for or maintained by the patrons). Overall, however, the pool is great. I use the outdoor one, which is 25m. It is not heated, but has about 6 lanes for swimming or playing. Depending on the time you come, there may be squad swimming or training, so just keep that in mind. There is an indoor, heated 14m pool that the children generally play in.

The staff/ service here is up and down. Some of the staff are great, friendly and hardworking. Others seem to just stand around and don‚Äôt even really bother to greet you.
showerReviews.author: Jenny

showerReviews.reviewText: I've been coming to this place since my children were infants, for the swimming lessons. Sixteen years later, both my sons work here as Lifeguards, and the rest of my family still attend regularly weekly. Runcorn Pool is an extension of our families' healthy living in Brisbane. The sense of community and diversity of clients is absolutely beautiful. Well done for bringing the same into your workforce.
showerReviews.author: Naseema Mustapha

showerReviews.reviewText: Pools for adults were clean but the kids play pool looked filthy.  The facilities are disgracefuly dirty and the manager at the entry doesn‚Äôt deserve his job, rude horrible man.  The many huge council bins were full to capacity at just 1pm and stank.  At back of entry between there and the change rooms is apparently where all the food stuff is kept fruit and veg included.  Those change rooms are also public toilets so what you‚Äôre eating from the ‚Äòdirty looking cafe‚Äô is stored between there and the filthy change rooms which look like they‚Äôve been neglected since 1975!  I remember this centre from a very long time ago being beautiful l will be complaining to the health department because this is just one of many council pools I‚Äôve tried in the last few years and I am disgusted.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Yeronga Swimming Complex, located just off Ipswich Road in Yeronga, offers a comprehensive aquatic facility including an outdoor kiddie pool, a 25-meter pool, a 50-meter pool, and an undercover pool designated for learn-to-swim classes. The complex features a large area for picnics and tables, with options to book spaces for special occasions.

Upon arrival, visitors can explore the swim shop that stocks a wide variety of swimming accessories, followed by well-maintained changerooms and toilets. To the right of the main area, there‚Äôs a cafe offering hot and cold foods and beverages to refresh yourself.

On the day of my visit, there were two lifeguards on duty overseeing the pool areas, a staff member in the cafe/kiosk, and three staff members in the swim shop. The changerooms are aging but remain functional. A delightful highlight was observing the family of ducks calling Yeronga Pool home, including their adorable ducklings‚Äîsee the photo attached. Overall, it‚Äôs an ideal spot for a quick and enjoyable way to cool down.
showerReviews.author: Jess Happy
