showerReviews.reviewText:
If you‚Äôre looking for a place where you can swim laps and pretend you‚Äôre training for the Olympics (without anyone timing you), Yeronga Swimming Pool is the spot.

- üèä Pools for every mood: Whether you‚Äôre chasing glory in the 50‚Äëmeter pool, keeping it casual in the 25‚Äëmeter, splashing with the kids, or hiding from the sun in the indoor pool, Yeronga has you covered. Basically, it‚Äôs like a choose‚Äëyour‚Äëown‚Äëadventure book, but wetter.

- üå≥ Garden vibes: The outdoor sitting areas are perfect for lunch, coffee, or just pretending you‚Äôre in a tropical resort. The garden setting makes you feel like you‚Äôve stumbled into a secret oasis‚Äîminus the cocktails with umbrellas.

- ‚òï Coffee check: The coffee is genuinely good, though it could be a touch hotter. Let‚Äôs just say it‚Äôs ‚Äúwarm enough to sip, but not hot enough to make you regret your life choices.‚Äù

- üòé Overall: Great for recreational swimmers, lap swimmers, and anyone who enjoys combining exercise with a relaxed garden caf√© vibe. Bonus points for the fact that you can swim, eat, and caffeinate all in one place.
showerReviews.author: Paul Paping

Still, a nice place to splash about and relax without too much hassle. Definitely convenient for Yeronga locals.

locations.title: Ithaca Swimming Pool
locations.address: ÓÉà14 Caroline St, Paddington QLD 4064

showerReviews.reviewText:
A wonderful place to swim. This pool has a special place in my heart. Great atmosphere, family friendly, it‚Äôs a joy to visit.

Swimming laps under an open sky surrounded by big beautiful trees and tropical plants feels like a dream.

The pool is mostly salt water, with the minimum chlorine required. I can tell a lot of care goes into adjusting the levels and it‚Äôs really appreciated. The water feels lovely and soft on my hair and skin, and I don‚Äôt get dry and itchy like in other highly chlorinated pools.
showerReviews.author: Chay-Ya Clancy

showerReviews.reviewText: Located across Suncorp Stadium, next to the tennis courts and skate park, Ithaca is a public swimming pool for all: the casual swimmer, the teens looking for a splash, master and competitive swimmer, aquaaerobic fitness, tanning enthusiast, family gatherings, toddlers water initiation and more. You can pay just per visit ($6 and change), or buy a 10 or 20 visits card and save some bucks. Huge dressing rooms with showers and toilets (male and female). They got a nice resting area where you can sit and relax with a warm cup from the coffee shop. Overall, a lovely place to spend your time in.

I went mid week around 3pm during school holidays and it thankfully wasn‚Äôt crowded. The facilities are nice with plenty of shaded grass areas as well as tables and chairs for those not swimming. Just outside there is also a skate park, public park, and a playground with a picnic/ electric bbq area.

The only downside to the pool was there is no lockers in the women‚Äôs changing rooms.
Over all I‚Äôm very impressed as it‚Äôs a lovely pool, I will certainly be back!

showerReviews.reviewText: It's a nice little hideaway place located underground floor of the Hotel Diana. It has a party room for only your guests however the bathhouse, sauna, showers are shared with the public. We had wine and platters which was nice and the host Helen has been wonderful!

showerReviews.reviewText: I paid $95 for a massage that was very bad. I asked for pressure to be more but nothing was changed. The whole time it felt like she was just rubbing oil all over me with no purpose. The place was very unorganised. You have to pay for towels, water, everything on top of the massage/spa. I paid to use a towel and wasn‚Äôt even given one. When I asked she insisted she already gave me one until she finally remembered she hadn‚Äôt. Then she insisted that I give her back the locker key that she never gave me before realising again that she never gave me one. I had to sit up during the massage at one point which was very strange especially as I have done studies in remedial massage and this is not generally normal. Overall so disappointed and am expect  to receive money back because of this.
showerReviews.author: emma prosper

showerReviews.reviewText: Got a parking spot right in the plaza - don't worry, parking is validated! Was shown into the facility by the lovely lady on the front desk. There is a hot pool and a cool pool (not freezing like some spas but believe me it feels plenty cold enough after the hot pool or sauna) as well as shower facilities, a lovely bathroom with hair dryer and big well lit mirrors, and lockers. Everything is clean and tidy and the facilities are obviously well looked after. There is also a coffee machine and a little relaxing room with some bean bags. There is no time limit, I stayed about an hour but will come again and relax a little longer. had a tight neck and shoulder when I went in - felt much better after! My only con would be the lighting, it's such a lovely relaxing atmosphere and nice music softly playing but the lights are just those harsh led ceiling lights. Would love to see those turned off and just some floor lamps or something easier on the eyes. But perhaps it's a safety requirements? Anyway absolutely loved it, wonderful value for money, and it's right in the little shopping corner there so even got myself a little snack after. Lovely way to start my day and will absolutely be back.
showerReviews.author: Rebecca

Please note majority of people that attend clothes are optional. Over all expensive for what you receive.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The shower/sauna/spa area is nice enough and definitely had a relaxing atmosphere. However, the rest of the experience is probably below the standard I would have expected. The locker/relaxation area isn't kept super clean, with dirt, hair and hair ties on the floor, in lockers and in the sink. We were told to bring towels and our bath products, but not a bathrobe - which would have been handy given there are no specific instructions on what attire is required outside of the spa area: are you required to sit on a towel on the chairs, or can you sit on it whilst nude and the chair unprotected?

Lastly, the staff members I dealt with were really not great. Poor customer service, confusing, bordering on rude. I was treated like an idiot or difficult, while the staff member tried to up-sell another client on a massage while in the middle of getting us checked in. If you can deal with all that, it's a nice enough place to relax.
showerReviews.author: Melissa Figueroa

showerReviews.reviewText: I booked a winter pamper package for $150. Relaxation massage, body scrub and face mask. Worst experience ever. Constant interruptions and changing of masseuses. I think I had 3 by the end. At one point there was a loud argument  in the room about who should massage a client with swollen ankles. I also had to remind them that it was meant to be a 90 min session not 60. The face mask is given to you at reception to put on yourself. Shower curtains covered in mound. I unfortunately paid upfront. Went in for a relaxation massage and came out with a headache.
showerReviews.author: Angela Edwards

locations.title: Somnia Beauty and Head Spa
locations.address: ÓÉà12 Bailey St, West End QLD 4101

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited Somnia for my first head spa today and had such a lovely experience. I definitely recommend the Healing package for anyone considering.

I called up the morning of looking for an appointment as I was passing through Brisbane for a couple of days, and the team fit me in.

The spa itself is very contemporary, peaceful and is decorated well.

The two therapists who served me were incredibly polite, attentive, and asked all of the right questions. I felt very welcome from the outset.

I was impressed by the attention to the details throughout the service from end to end. The robes and blankets were silky soft. The products smelt and felt amazing. The heat pack was such a nice touch, particularly in winter.

With regard to the service itself, the massage and wash both were equally enjoyable and relaxing. I was pleasantly surprised at how long the head, neck and shoulder massage went for. Perfect pressure for the massage and a range of tools and techniques were used throughout the wash. Afterwards, my hair was blow dried straight and felt smooth and shiny. I am heading out for date night tonight and won‚Äôt need to touch my hair!

10/10!
showerReviews.author: Layne O‚ÄôReilly

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a horrible time here. Definitely inexperienced and disrespectful service. The masseuse had poor technique, the room was brightly lit with fluorescent lighting. The masseuse left to take a call a quarter way through and was visibly on her phone on instagram while only barely massaging me with one hand! She also put weird fragrances oil all over my face and through my hair. So if you‚Äôre Sensitive to breakouts or have recently washed your hair BEWARE.
She wiped off the oil she used on me with a cold damp cloth which she left the room AGAIN to get; and constantly yelled to her colleagues outside of the room, an extremely un-relaxing and unprofessional experience. When I attempted to resolve this matter by calling the salon afterwards she told me she would call me back and then has screened my calls since. Only answering when I called from a private number or using someone else‚Äôs phone! This is so disappointing and unfortunate as I really would have preferred to settle this with constructive criticism instead of having to leave a bad review. This was made impossible so in short NEVER GO HERE!
showerReviews.author: Josie Orchard

showerReviews.reviewText:
PBAC has truly raised the bar with its amazing new facilities. The indoor heated pool is a standout feature‚Äîperfectly maintained and ideal for year-round use. What makes the experience even better is the thoughtful addition of air heaters around the pool area, keeping the surrounding air warm and comfortable. This creates a cozy and inviting environment for my kids, especially during cooler months.
Whether you're there for fitness, relaxation, or family fun, the upgraded amenities make every visit enjoyable. The attention to detail in both water and air temperature control shows a real commitment to comfort and quality.
Highly recommended for anyone looking for a top-tier aquatic experience!

Told to leave the kids‚Äô pool at Palm Beach Swimming Pool for breastfeeding my baby while watching my older children. Staff claimed all Qld pools ban breastfeeding ‚Äî completely false. There‚Äôs no such law, and under the Queensland Anti-Discrimination Act, this is unlawful. Lifeguards were overbearing and strict, making the visit stressful. showerReviews.reviewText: This place is getting pretty ridiculous. As a "Council" pool the costs to go here are way too high.  My kids are members here as they have swimming lessons here, but it's a nice hot day so we thought we'd take them there to cool off, only to find out they charge $3.70 per adult to supervise, but won't let the kids swim without supervision. What kind of bullshit scam is that? You're kids can't swim without being supervised and you can't supervise without bring charged to do so. Absolutely piss poor Gold Coast City Council.
showerReviews.author: Dan East

showerReviews.reviewText:
In the last 3 months, the pool and splash pad areas are going downhill due to zero rules and zrro basic hygiene being enforced.
Group of 6 , 4 adults and 2 small kids:
- only paid 2 entrances saying that the 3 other adults and the toddler weren't going to swim.
- the adults (older women) literally entered the kiddi pool fully clothed with the same street clothes they had when they said they weren't going to swim
- they put the toddler in the kiddi pool without a swimming diaper
- one of the women (fully clothed) was exfoliating her feet in the steps of the kiddi pool
-same woman  was fully blowing her nose in the water
- she couldn't swim, was spitting water constantly
- large group of men, no shower, bad smell of cheap perfume, the entire indoor  pool smelled as bad as them
- lifeguards ignoring adults doing dangerous stuff in the kiddi pool ( launching the kids cannonball style , in the kidi pool, large groups of adults,  using abusive language,  hanging out in the kiddi pool...
- a total mess. We pay rates and taxes all for what? Using the public services shouldn't be a nightmare
Please, enforce basic hygiene,  make sure that people pay for their entrance like everyone else
Ask for people to wear appropriate clothing,  please get the adults without kids out of the kiddi pool
-stop  people from abusing the facilities , no spitting,  no exfoliating , I mean , how low are we gonna get in order to avoid offending people that have no consideration for others using the facilities?

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have 2 kids that do swimming lessons here. Been going for over a year now.
We have had only one teacher who was great, interacting with the kids and truly was so lovely. Rest of them seem to be not so interested and lively.
Not sure who designed the facilities in there but for goodness sake. There are only 2 showers for female where you can properly wash yourself and your toddler after the swim. 2?! The other 2 are in an open space where you can‚Äôt take your swim suit off. Why do we need 12 toilets there? The place is always busy especially on the weekends. Just makes no sense.
Otherwise all good.

locations.address: ÓÉàMarine Parade, Southport QLD 4210

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lots of fun for wide range of ages. There is a separate area for smaller kids and toddlers.  You willneed to be mindful that there are sessions that are about 50min each. You will need rubber grip socks which you can purchase at the venue. You will also be fitted with a life jacket.
For the parents there is a coffee station with snacks.
Lifesavers are present. There are also lockers available for your valuables.
Please also be aware that you need to sign a waiver for any participants.  Can be done online from website.
Use sunblock on arms and face, it gets hot out there.
showerReviews.author: Colin Prinsloo

showerReviews.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean pool & facilities. The outdoor pool is partially shaded which is great, and 25m which is good for someone like me who‚Äôs getting back into swimming :)

showerReviews.reviewText:
My son and I joined swimming lessons in April 2023 at Mudgeeraba Aquatic Centre when he turned 2 years old. We chose this place not just because we live in the neighborhood, but also because of its cozy environment, the water playground where kids can play after the lesson, and the great playground outside the pool. My older daughter, who is 9, learned how to swim here when she was little, and I remembered how friendly the staff were. However, this time, the experience was completely different.

After a year of swimming lessons, we decided to stop because my son had completely lost interest. Throughout the year, the lessons were taught by the same instructor, with exactly the same activities in the exact same order, which didn't engage my son. Additionally, we had a total of four makeup lessons that needed to be scheduled before our contract ended. When I called the reception, the lady informed me that I had to book all my makeup lessons before my contract ended, which was within two weeks. However, when I tried to make the bookings, she said the classes were all full. She suggested I call at 7 am that morning to check for any cancellations. Despite another lady already booking me a lesson, she later said my son couldn't attend because it was outside of our contract date, and we weren't covered by their insurance anymore. Essentially, one of the booked makeup lessons had to be canceled by her. So makeup lessons needed to be booked before our contract ended because we weren't covered by insurance, but if the classes were full, we couldn't attend. She kept repeating that this was in the contract.

This left me thinking about their customer service experience and their policies buried in the fine print. They didn't offer me a solution, and their "this is what it is" attitude was frustrating. I even considered calling to offer to cover the insurance for us to continue using the pool after our contract ended if that was their concern. However, in the end, I didn't bother to call as I found it too frustrating.
showerReviews.author: yichuan liu

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been going to Sharks Fitness for a while now, and it's easily one of the best fitness facilities in the area! The equipment is top-notch, always clean, and well-maintained. The staff are incredibly friendly and always ready to help.
The atmosphere is motivating, with a great mix of people at all fitness levels. The group classes are fantastic. I also appreciate the cleanliness of the gym, especially in the locker rooms and common areas.
If you're looking for a gym with great energy, solid equipment, and a supportive community, I highly recommend!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Joined this gym a while back and have been going here ever since. The owner is incredibly nice, friendly, motivating and very dedicated to running a fantastic gym.

The place is exceptionally tidy, equipment is new and well maintained and plenty of options to choose from. The amenities are very clean and even include an infrared sauna - highly recommend!

The owner also gives you the option to tailor a work put plan to your needs and desires, regularly going through measurements and check ups. Also incredibly involved and caring, where he will check in on you personally to make sure everything is going smoothly. Great to go to for nutritional advice to achieve the results you want, too.

All in all, it is one of the best, if not the best gym I joined, and one can tell that the owner really cares about and for this place and it shows through the energy levels and motivation he exudes.

As a great bonus - the gym is never crowded, even during peak hours!

locations.title: Surfers Paradise Beach
locations.address: ÓÉàQueensland

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚ÄúSurfers Paradise Beach is absolutely stunning and a must-visit on the Gold Coast. The golden sand stretches for miles, always clean and well maintained, with plenty of space whether you want to swim, walk, or just relax in the sun. The water is crystal clear and perfect for swimming or surfing, with lifeguards on duty and flagged areas for safety.

The location is unbeatable ‚Äì right next to Cavill Ave, so you‚Äôre only a short walk to shops, cafes, and restaurants. There are great facilities nearby including showers, toilets, and shaded areas, and it‚Äôs beautiful both day and night. Sunrise and sunset here are incredible, and the vibe is always welcoming, whether it‚Äôs families, tourists, or locals enjoying the coast.

Perfect for a beach day, a morning jog, or just sitting back and taking in the view. Definitely one of the highlights of the Gold Coast.
showerReviews.author: William Murphy

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is truly one of those spots you could visit every day and never get tired of.

There are so many great places to eat nearby, and just walking around the area is a visual delight.

As someone who loves watching sunsets, I honestly think this spot offers one of the best views.
The waves and the sky look different every single day ‚Äî it is the perfect place to soak in the beauty of nature.

There are so many great photo spots, and it is also a place where you could just sit for hours and enjoy the view.

The long stretch of smooth pavement along the beach makes it ideal for roller skating, which I personally love.

There are also clean showers and restrooms placed at regular intervals, which makes it even more convenient.

If you ever visit the Gold Coast, this is definitely a must-see destination!
showerReviews.author: Happy J

locations.title: Tugun Surf Life Saving Club
locations.address: ÓÉà29 Oconnor St, Tugun QLD 4224

showerReviews.reviewText: On this section of the coast you are spoilt for choice when looking for somewhere convivial. Had never tried Tugan Surf club before, and as we have many visitors we decided to give this venue a go for future reference.  Location, superb, amenities and decor OK.  It was lunch, and there were only 3 other tables occupied when we arrived.  Ordered meal, bought drinks and enjoyed the view.  After approx 35minutes and watching later arrivals receive their order's, a polite request was made as to where in the cue were we.  Meal turned up 5 minutes later which to say the least, was average, however you don't expect cordon bleu for $22.50 small plate.  On our way out met the manager and expressed our disappointment  about our experience in his club, which he swatted off with an off the cuff remark.  I think we'll stick to some tastier options, one of which is about 2km north.
showerReviews.author: Malcolm Patterson

locations.title: City Lights Motel
locations.address: ÓÉà35 Minjungbal Dr, Tweed Heads South NSW 2486

showerReviews.reviewText:
Look at Motel Before booking in as nothing like the pictures ..
NO POOL
Major Renovations happening outside in car park and painting
Rooms smell and carpets thread bearing and stained.
Hot water takes 5 minutes to get hot.
Manager sitting around drinking in garage with tradies mid afternoon
Definitely need to update there web page re room photos as they look 20 years old

Checked in on Wednesday afternoon and was informed there would be a cement truck coming at 1 pm on Thursday . 7 am Thursday morning was rudely awaked to workers using a small excavator to remove pavers which was not informed of and as i had spent 7 hrs in hospital on Wednesday having medical treatment was hoping to be able to sleep and rest.  Then since was awake went and out only to return after 1pm to rest and found driveway blocked by cement truck and concrete pumping truck  forcing us to park  on the side of busy road instead of under unit in covered safe area. Upon return we approached lady in office about a refund as it was conducive to a healthy rest environment after hospital stay. Once manager finally returned 2 hours latter he informed us he was only a manager and owner said if we were unsatisfied should have checked out in the morning and we would not get a refund for Thursday as it was afternoon and too late in the day . As we left spoke to a worker on site a said it was a joke and he politely said he told owner to close during renovations as it would be very disruptive to guests but money hungry owner kept renting rooms with zero regards for guest safety or pleasure of stay
showerReviews.author: Zoe Hull

We stayed in the wheelchair room and whenever we needed extra towels we got and not always we got the breakfast cause we usually cooked our own in the little kitchenette. The only issue was the wheelchair shower it wasn't big enough once the shower chair was in and my partner had to squeeze in to wash my hair all the time. The sink needs to be moved to another area and the wall needs to be removed but everything else was good. There was a few owners over that time and the cleaners did their jobs well.

locations.title: Broadwater Tourist Park
locations.address: ÓÉà169 Marine Parade, Southport QLD 4215

showerReviews.reviewText:
10 days here with the family - 7 of us on all over the Christmas New Year break.
Could not have been happier with the park and the managers especially Matt and his team. Their dedication to service and making everything easy has made our stay here memorable.
Christmas Day storm which resulted in evacuation- could not have been better managed.  Information was constantly forthcoming and staff were kind and very considerate. Perfect clean amenities camp kitchen were great and the park organised activities well received!  Two thumbs up!!!
showerReviews.author: Angela McGrath

showerReviews.reviewText:
Thank you to the amazing team at Kirra Beach tourist Park for an awesome weekend away. The amenities are extremely clean and regularly cleaned. The location is just an easy walk to the beach and cafes in kirra or Coolangatta. The team at the park are the friendliest people going around, they seem to love what they do and they absolutely adore dogs! My dogs were so spoilt with treats and pats. There are lots of very well thoughtful touches for our furry friends. The pool was heated and the food van, that varied each night, was a superb idea.
Such a great find and we will definitely be back for longer than a weekend.
Cheers, Lizzy

the bad: large gaps in shower doors, shower benches too small for belongings, showers go cold/hot randomly for long periods, divider between shower and dry area tiny so all your stuff gets wet, no larger showers for families, no walkways through sites from back of park to get to amenities, kids playground very basic (no slide or swings, pool table ripped and cue tips broken (still costs money to play though), smallest washing machines I‚Äôve ever seen and not enough of them for size of park, dryer costs $9 an hour, our site was not mowed in the 26 days we stayed, became very overgrown, poor drainage in park and roads become flooded, 1 female staff member in office is very rude (unsure of name), no light at dump point

showerReviews.reviewText: We recently stayed at NRMA Treasure Island in Biggera Waters on a powered caravan site near the amenities block and absolutely loved it. The park has so much to offer. Three beautiful pools, two hot tubs, and a fun water park for the kids. There is also putt putt and plenty of entertainment to keep the little ones busy. The amenities were clean, the shower heads were fantastic, a real step above most parks, and the camp kitchen looked amazing. The onsite bistro and bar were great and the staff were friendly and very accommodating. I absolutely loved this place and cannot wait to return.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We drove up from Victoria for our first family getaway with our 11 month old baby.
We got a studio room (room 9) and our expectations were exceeded. For the cheapest accommodation offered, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was spotless and had everything we needed for the 3 night/2 day stay. Amenities were amazing and so much offered for kids and parents.
We will DEFINITELY be coming back here when the little one is older.
We would HIGHLY reccomend any families to stay here, even a couple or young adults would thrive! Absolutely amazing experience!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great holiday park with plenty of amenities, activities and events. Great for both the big kids and the littlies

The family studio cabin was incredibly welcoming upon arrival. It's beautifully styled and seemed almost brand new. The bedding configuration was a bit strange however. The bunks are located next to the door and on the event you use the trundle you would be unable to use the door unless you're climbing over/on top of whoever is asleep on it as it pulls out across the access.

There are multiple playgrounds with a specific toddler dedicated one which was great. The water park was closed for maintenance which was a little disappointing. However, there were many other water play options such as the 3 different pools you can choose from.

I would have liked there to be information easily found for things like the pedal go karts, mini golf etc as there is nothing in the welcome check in brochure or near the activity themselves that explains if they cost money , how long you can use them etc.

All in all the NRMA treasure island resort was well worth the visit. Will be back again!
showerReviews.author: Bianca Lee

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not impressed what so ever. Got the studio for my partner and I. One roll of toilet paper for 7 nights stay, never offered fresh towels, tiny shower with a curtain that sticks to you no matter what, splashes everywhere outside it. Absolutely no privacy if you're put near tents. Couldn't have the curtain open at all or door open for a breeze, tents pitched basically at the doorstep. Not the best location, Had to uber everywhere with the light rail not running.
Not worth the money for us

Wish there was salt and pepper in addition to the tea bags and instant coffee in the kitchen, but that‚Äôs a small thing. The staff were very helpful and gave us a free membership to the nearby surf club. Would return in a heartbeat!

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked the clamping tents.
.
Lovely  drive up to Lamington. Besides a O'Reillys  branded car was sitting up our cars bumpa, as soon as there was a pull off we did, yet no need for the aggressive driver prior.
.
Check into the clamping tents was easy.
.
Camp kitchen
Lovely large area, well stocked with cooking equipment and washing up spong detergent  etc.
The tablesvand chairs need a goodvscrub, lots of grim build up.
The shade cloth near ceiling was filthy, also needs a good clean (nothing a good High Pressure hose could not fix)
Great out door bench seats to watch sunset.
Noise travels so it was hard yo get to sleep whilst people enjoying themselves after 10pm.

Toilets/ Showers.
Shower heads great water pressure.
Great hot water
Flushing toilets.
Good size.
The room need a good clean over the three days we watched them being cleaned i kid you not the cleaners spent less than 3 minutes in each cubicle.
The mould and grim build up is not hygienic. Glad I bought rubber shoes to shower with.
The doors slam shut so every time during the night they are used all campers hear them open and close.
.
Tents
Nice size.
Great location tent 2 in corner looking into rainforest.
Our tent was very dirty, needed a good sweep under the bed and floors had a fine layer of rocks, most likely from the path.
The doubled bed in the bunks mattress had a sticky substance on it.
The tents are great however if you are a light sleeper maybe not for you, you can hear people talking three and four tent away at night..

Lamington  NP
Super 100% fantastic.
We are birders so managed to tick a few birds of my lists.
.
All in all I would be back yet ill stay in the hotel or villas.
.
showerReviews.author: Corinne Parnell

locations.title: Turtle Beach Resort
locations.address: ÓÉà2346 Gold Coast Hwy, Mermaid Beach QLD 4218

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently stayed at Turtle Beach Resort and left feeling disappointed. While the pools were enjoyable and the kids had a great time, several issues overshadowed these positives.
During our week-long stay with five people, we quickly ran out of washing detergent by Day 4. When I approached the front desk for more, the lady at the front was not helpful and insisted that we pay $2 for each additional detergent. If this is the resort‚Äôs policy, that‚Äôs fine‚Äîbut it should be clearly stated upfront or build into the extra dollar or two into the  price. Charging extra for such basic items is not worth the reputational damage and leaves guests feeling nickel-and-dimed.

Another serious concern was the ensuite bathroom door in our room (Room 104). When closed, the door could not be opened from the inside, which is a safety issue and still needs to be fixed. This was extremely unsettling (as you can't get out from the inside) and should be addressed immediately.

To be fair, the staff were friendly, but these issues really detracted from the overall experience. The resort has potential, but policies like charging for basic supplies, lack of replenishment, and maintenance problems need attention. I hope management takes these concerns seriously for the benefit of future guests.

Cheers
Kell
showerReviews.author: Kell Tremayne

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a lovely week at Turtle Beach.
Reading some of the reviews (after I booked) I was a little bit nervous but I shouldn't have been.
It is conveniently located on the Gold Coast Highway and not too long a drive to all the theme parks / attractions. (The tram works at present make it slightly overwhelming when you first arrive but you adjust quickly)
The staff from the Maintenance/cleaning crews to the restaurant staff to the administration staff were ALL fabulous. They go above and beyond and truly lovely.
The pool, splash pads etc are wonderful we swam every day.
The restaurant/Cafe is so convenient and serves amazing coffee and lovely food - their pizza is delicious.
We stayed in a 2 bedroom family suite that had some minor imperfections (could use some touch up paint) but overall was clean and very comfortable. We loved having a large space to relax, full kitchen and a laundry means we dont have a huge pile of washing when we get home.
We had a ground floor apartment that opened up on to the restaurant and pool area - it was fabulous.
The beds were really comfortable but if you are a light sleeper you can occasionally hear the people above you moving their chairs (but not talking/constant noise).
As mentioned in owners other comments these are self contained so bring some extra toilet paper, garbage bags, dishwasher tablets and laundry powder (they comp a couple of sachets) - there is a woolworths conveniently located a few doors down you can walk to.
Overall we had fantastic time and we will definitely visit again!
showerReviews.author: Amy Burch

locations.title: Paradise Country Farmstay
locations.address: ÓÉàProduction Dr, Oxenford QLD 4210

showerReviews.reviewText:
First of all, the roads here are absolutely terrible‚Äîcompletely unsuitable for travelers with luggage. And despite there being two of us, they initially provided only one set of amenities. Even in the following days, they kept giving us the wrong amount. I honestly don‚Äôt understand how such a simple task can be done so badly. We even had to walk to the front desk every day to pick things up, which takes about six minutes round-trip‚Äîfar, inconvenient, and ridiculous.

Next, we kept getting woken up every morning by the heat and constant noise. There were loud wild animals everywhere and aggressive birds. The room only had one standing fan, and the actual conditions were nothing like the photos on their website.

But the most outrageous part happened on our checkout day. They refused to help us transport our luggage from the campsite to the pickup area. They told us to drag our bags across that horrible road that would definitely ruin the wheels. We had already asked in advance if they could help, and they said OK, yet on the morning of 26 Nov, Michelle simply said no. This was a task that would‚Äôve taken them less than a minute, but they still refused. We ended up calling a taxi and asking the driver to drive into the campsite just to help us load our luggage.

Then, as soon as the car went up, they blocked the road to move sheep. When we came back down, they blocked it again‚Äîthis time for only three sheep‚Äîand told us to wait five minutes. By then it was already past the checkout time, and we had to pay extra to the taxi driver for the delay. If this is how your lousy company treats guests, it‚Äôs no surprise if you go out of business. Absolutely not recommended. If you don‚Äôt have a car, you‚Äôre basically screwed.

Also, the farm claims to have many activities, but most of them require extra fees and the facilities are extremely run-down. In short, don‚Äôt come here‚Äîever.
showerReviews.author: Nova

Room was quite out dated and could have been cleaner. The was a red back spider living on the bathroom window seal. Hot water didn‚Äôt last long. Bed was comfy so that was a good thing. Washing machines and dryers only took coins, and all our clothes were still damp after using the dryer twice.
showerReviews.author: Jess

showerReviews.reviewText: My interactions with the staff were very professional and lovely and the shared spaces were well maintained. The room was much much smaller than advertised and some maintenance needs to be done as my shower head wouldn‚Äôt stay up at all and the locks were very old and barely screwed in. The locks on the doors were sketchy and at night you could hear people arguing out the front and near by people screaming which was very unsettling. They cannot help the location but if the rooms were better maintained and the locks were replaced with sturdier ones then the overall experience wouldn‚Äôt of been that bad.
showerReviews.author: Bonnie Neil

showerReviews.reviewText: Very dissapointing stay. The apartment had a funky smell and our friends apartment smelt like stale pee and had stains on the cushions and walls. The showers are very average with no water pressure and limited hot water. The units are next to a very noisy road. The TV is small and has no features so you're stuck watching free tv. Two people barely fit in the apartment. They also require a deposit for the key and ask to take your card details or bank details. Our deposit has been returned but I'd suggest bringing cash so they don't have your details on file. Will not be staying there again.

locations.title: Chateau Beachside
locations.address: ÓÉà52 Esplanade, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
Older building and rooms dated, but clean.
You cannot get a better location though! Directly in front of beach, and walking distance to so many shops and restaurants.
You can even request a smoking room, which is almost unheard of now!
Has secure parking.
Rooms only serviced after 7 days and only 1 towel given per person, you need to hire more for $3 each if they are required. Best to bring your own beach towel and additional bath towels- no beach/pool towels offered.
Pool and spas are lovely, as are sauna and steamrooms. Tge pool is really big and there are 3 spas to choose from, meaning you dont usually have to share with other guests.
Has a large kids games room (costs to play) and a paid laundry to do a load.
Besic, but affordable & convenient location.
showerReviews.author: Lou Lou

locations.title: Mt Nimmel Lodge Campground
locations.address: ÓÉà271 Austinville Rd, Austinville QLD 4213

showerReviews.reviewText:
Paradise. A hidden sanctuary of peace just 30 minutes from the Gold Coast and close to gorgeous rainforest waterfall circuits. It has everything you need: powered sites, full bathrooms with hot showers, a laundry room, and a fully equipped kitchen. There are outdoor dining tables with spectacular views and visiting wildlife, plus a lovely bar area that's great for groups. They even offer car pickup for nights out, including New Year's Eve.

Virginia, the owner, is incredibly fun and helpful. She even gives guests handwritten guides with local tips on markets, nature spots, and restaurants. She also has lovely dogs and birds that add so much charm to the place.

I originally planned to stay just 1-2 nights and ended up extending to a full week. They're even hosting a New Year's Eve party. Such a warm, memorable experience, far beyond expectations. Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Miss Petitpas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ocean Beach Tourist Park
We stayed on sites 15 and 16, and they were easily the best in the whole park. The back gate leads straight to a great little coffee shop, and from there it‚Äôs only a short stroll to the beach. The water stays shallow for several metres, perfect for kids, and the patrolled area between the yellow flags made it feel even safer. The amount of shells along the shore was incredible.

Pam was wonderful to deal with when booking‚Äîso helpful and friendly‚Äîand the couple who checked us in were just as lovely. The amenities were clean and well maintained.

There‚Äôs no pool or kids‚Äô activities, but honestly, you don‚Äôt need them with the beach right there. Our kids had a ball riding around on their scooters.

We‚Äôd happily stay here again and again. An awesome spot for a relaxed family getaway.
showerReviews.author: Ruth Kardell

locations.title: Advancetown Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉà376 Nerang Murwillumbah Rd, Advancetown QLD 4211

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights from Thursday to Monday. Thursday and Sunday nights were $65 each and Friday and Saturday were $85 each, so $300 for 4 nights. A lot more than we would normally pay however the amenities, the BBQ area and pool were all spotless. The on-site managers Sharon and Chris were welcoming and personally maintained the amenities to a very high standard. The park backs onto the Beechmont Hotel where we had lunch with friends on both Saturday and Sunday. It is a 1 hour walk or 5 minute drive to Hinze Dam. Whilst the park is mainly permanents they were very friendly and even invited us to Happy Hour. Very close to the Gold Coast if you want to stay somewhere less‚Äùtouristy‚Äù
showerReviews.author: Cameron Wood

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed on an unpowered site in this wonderful caravan park. It‚Äôs small, unbelievably clean and the host is lovely. Never seen a caravan park so well maintained, even the trim of the grass is perfect. As for the amenities, we have never seen such clean amenities in any campsite, not even a bug in sight!!!

Great location, no horrible bugs flying around even in the heat, just a few bush turkeys here and there.

Couldn‚Äôt fault this place ‚úÖ

showerReviews.reviewText: We arrived late Afternoon on a public holiday, later than scheduled and discussed over the phone earlier in the day. The caretaker wasn't happy and a bit grumpy. After all, we were not as well organized as expected! I can understand this response since this place is immaculately organized! The grass is kept short, the facilities are spotlessly clean and tidy. The showers are spacious, and every day, new floor towels are provided! The same caretaker (owner?) who first showed some grumpiness turned out to be very kind and helpful. She noticed that I love photography and turned up the following morning with a large cup filled with seeds for me to use, to attract birds to facilitate my attempts to take bird photos! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this quiet and safe place. The only thing I missed were dedicated recycling bins. We ended up taking our rubbish with us to recycle most of it at our business (we have separate recycling bins for cardboard and aluminum cans/glass/plastic). Perhaps this is the last step to organizational perfection for this lovely caravan park!
showerReviews.author: Dietrich Lasa

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for 5 days while visiting friends.  You have to book in advance as it is a small  CP but well worth the stay. It has been family owned for over 20 years, the grounds are manicured and landscaped  into pleasant gardens. The facilities are scrupulously clean. There is a big swimming pool and a BBQ area available.  There are several permanent residents there that make you feel most welcome so it is more like joining in with a community. Just walking our old dog round the park resulted in many people stopping and chatting.
The staff there are very friendly and always busy round the park, cleaning, gardening and doing maintenance.
The pictures  show a view of the park down one road, and a shot of my caravan as we were getting ready to hitch up an leave.
My wife and I have been caravanning for over 30 years in all states and territories of Australia and the Advancetown Caravan Park has to be one of the best we have seen. If there is a down side, then some big rigs would have difficulty in parking on some of the sites. My 6 metre van went on easily.
There is a pub a short walk away and the Nerang Shops a short drive away.
Great Caravan Park, good staff, welcoming community and marvellous facilities.
showerReviews.author: Keith Millington

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment I drove my 21‚Äô motor home in I could see this would be an enjoyable experience.. Elizabeth is the boss and walked me to my spot and guided me in ..
The ablutions block is impeccably clean and the showers are a pleasure to stand under with lovely free flowing instant hot water.
The grounds are very well maintained and you can tell that the care takers are not lazy!!
Elizabeth is friendly and co-operative and will help you if you need assistance ..
I will definately book there again .. I was only there for 3 x nites but felt relaxed and comfortable the entire time !!
Congratulations Elizabeth and team .. I will see you again .. Al Gordon (BLI BLI - Sunshine Coast)

locations.title: North Currigee Campground
locations.address: ÓÉàCurrigee Rd, South Stradbroke QLD 4216

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a great time over here, we stayed a weekend in November and had the whole campsite to ourselves. Perfect sitting around the fire pits looking over the water. There's lots of friendly wildlife especially the wallabies (make sure you lock up your food at night). One downside was there wasn't enough water for us all to have a shower but hey you can just jump in the sea! You must take a walk over to the surf on the other side of the island it was peaceful and not a person around!
showerReviews.author: Matt Pyle

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is a scam. Do not stay here!!! We paid $250 for this so called ‚ÄúDeluxe Villa‚Äù that was covered in large dead ants and a few that were still moving. Not only that, this place was absolutely filthy, dust everywhere, stench filled, and the sheets are in the state of unwash for ages, covered in dust (and ants of course). Our findings shocked us and we were afraid to inspect under the sheets.

We tried cleaning up so that we‚Äôd feel more comfortable staying here but it wasn‚Äôt enough for us. Especially with the man in the unit opposite ours, doing drugs. We left after an hour and sent an email requesting a refund but we‚Äôve been ignored. How can anyone offer such a place, call it a ‚ÄúDeluxe Villa‚Äù and charge $250 a night. We won‚Äôt even stay here for free. This place is a scam and based on the other reviews too, Southport Tourist Park should be investigated and shut down. This place shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to stay open.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! You‚Äôre way better off sleeping in the car like we did after we left or find another place to spend the night. Just not here! The pictures on this and the website are heavily edited and fake. If the owner dares to challenge our claims, please visit this place and witness the disgust, drug use, and the utter sham of this establishment yourself. Please refer to the images we‚Äôve attached, showing our horrid experience at Southport Tourist Park. Here are the real pictures and state of Southport Tourist Park. (We have videos too but we can only attach photos).

locations.title: YHA Coolangatta
locations.address: ÓÉà230 Coolangatta Rd, Bilinga QLD 4225

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a great YHA to stay if you need to get to the airport early, you can walk there in 10 minutes. It's a pretty decent hostel, I have dorms and private rooms, a small pool, large communal areas and a kitchen. I usually stay in a private room, they are small but comfortable with everything you need, single bed, lamp and small desk.and chair. The only reason im not giving it 4 stars is because the last few times I've stayed there the showers in the main downstairs facility are always cold. Not a huge issue but its nice to have a choice of temperature.
I will be back to stay regardless as I fly out early for work and the convenience of locations is ideal.

locations.title: Surf Inn Boutique Backpackers
locations.address: ÓÉà26-28 Peninsular Dr, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
I arrived today, and from the very first moment I felt disappointed and poorly treated.

When I tried to check in, I was told that I had to download their app, even though I did not want to share my personal data. When I asked for a normal key card instead, the staff told me that if I didn‚Äôt want to use the app, I could leave and find another place. The attitude was rude and unhelpful.

I had also informed them in advance about which bed and which area I preferred, but when I arrived the staff simply said that I had to take the bed they assigned me. This felt very unprofessional and disrespectful.

I also find it strange that you have to pay an extra 10 AUD for a towel. That should be included when you pay for accommodation. The room I received is not quiet, and the bed is uncomfortable.

I will be staying here for two days, but my experience from the beginning has been very negative. The only positive thing is that the pool looks nice, but unfortunately that is not enough to make up for the rest.
showerReviews.author: Khair Habibi

Nice modern hostel, seems to have been recently renovated or at least kept very clean.

Toilets and showers were good. Kitchen area was clean and had everything you need.

Was woken up at 3am by some people coming back loudly but part and parcel of staying in a hostel.
showerReviews.author: Oscar Briscall-Harvey

showerReviews.reviewText:
To start, when booking this capsule hostel it was not our first choice but we had no other affordable options in the Gold Coast. We were apprehensive before arriving at this hostel and after staying 4 nights (too long) it was not for us, we would never do it again. Hated it.

To sum up its pros:
- Breakfast included + occasional free dinner
- Plenty of bathrooms and showers to use, the kitchen was also big and easy to work around others when cooking.
- Location was decent, close to the tram.

However we specifically didn't like the following:
- Not couple friendly.
- The showers have flies, disgusting.
- The room for two people was tiny, there was barely any room to move or organise your belongings at the same time without hitting each other.
- There is barely any storage spaces in the "private" room, they give you two pull out boxes under the bed. But no real room to house your suitcases or backpacks. Their suggestions is to leave it in a storage luggage area (a disorderly "pile") under CCTV, that is next to the 130 person pod. We didn't feel comfortable doing so.
- Sleeping was challenging, I still feel tired writing this review. It's important to note, the private rooms you can book are joined next to the 130 capsules, which we didn't realise until we paid and arrived. People are very inconsiderate, taking phone calls in the corridor, watching videos without headphones after 10pm. As well as this, as you're practically in one massive room (separated by plywood walls) you share a floor and can hear everyone stomping past, causing the bunk beds to shake.
- Once again as you're in a massive room, the lights in the day are dim and we couldn't see anything even with the tiny clip on lights provided in the bunk beds. At night the lights remained on and our bunks lacked curtains so it was very hard to sleep without lights shining in our faces.
- There's no aircon, just several massive fans in the massive room of 130 pods. Weirdly I woke up freezing in Australia... in summer. They gave us no blankets just a sheet and around 3-5am I would consistently wake up shaking from being so cold.
- As short stay travellers it was hard to gauge who was staff and who was there as a guest. Multiple people we thought were like us just staying for a short time, we ended up seeing cleaning around the hostel. It didn't feel like a traveller hostel.
- The long stay guests seem to treat the hostel like their own home, putting music videos like Ibiza Beats with an AI bunny on. a throne at 8am on the telly. Weird. It just didn't make you feel like you could sit down anywhere, instead more like you were in someone else's living room.
- I overheard an inappropriate, stereotypical "mens locker room chat" in the kitchen (a common room) by what I thought was a guest but turned out to be a member of staff. As a female traveller it made me feel quite icky that I was sleeping at this hostel.

Fundamentally, our main issue with this hostel is that we felt misled about the description of the room advertised. They stated it would be a private room with a shared bathroom, and our room had no ceiling. When you say a room is private the assumption is that the room is private in all 3 dimensions INCLUDING THE CEILING.

Minus the shackles this is what I imagine Swedish prison to be like, they even summon you on the tannoy for your dinner on Weds/Sat.

We do not understand how this hostel got a HOSCAR or a 4.8 google review. Either we must be snobs or everyone else is just delusional.
showerReviews.author: Yas A

locations.title: Maze Backpackers Gold Coast
locations.address: ÓÉà3282 Surfers Paradise Blvd, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here with my partner over New Year‚Äôs Eve and was very disappointed with the condition of the bathrooms and showers. While the staff were kind and attentive and the location was excellent, unfortunately those were the only real positives of our stay.

The showers were visibly dirty, with a strong unpleasant smell, and I felt compelled to shower as quickly as possible. The bed in our room was also extremely uncomfortable and hard, and the bedding felt rough and scratchy. At one point, the overall discomfort and lack of cleanliness caused me to have a panic attack, and my partner had to help calm me down.

I acknowledge that I may be more sensitive to cleanliness than some, and I understand that a hostel is not comparable to a hotel. However, this was genuinely my experience, and I believe these are areas management should address in order to improve guest comfort and overall experience.
showerReviews.author: Francesca N

locations.title: Bunk Surfers Paradise
locations.address: ÓÉà6 Beach Rd, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
When we first arrived at the hostel, I actually had high hopes. We had booked one of the Deluxe Rooms, and at first glance, it really did look nice ‚Äî spacious, modern, and with a private bathroom. The room itself was definitely the best part of our stay and probably the only thing that lived up to the photos online.

Unfortunately, that impression didn‚Äôt last long. The room hadn‚Äôt been cleaned before we arrived, and we could tell right away that the bathroom was in terrible condition. The sink and shower were dirty, and the toilet was honestly disgusting. I went to the reception to mention it, and while someone came up to ‚Äúclean,‚Äù it didn‚Äôt really make a difference ‚Äî it was just as gross afterward.

To make matters worse, the Deluxe Rooms are located directly above a bar that plays loud music until around 11:30 p.m. So if you‚Äôre a light sleeper or looking for a quiet night‚Äôs rest, this is definitely not the right place for you.

After spending some time in the room, we decided to check out the common areas ‚Äî and that‚Äôs when things got even more disappointing. The shared kitchen was in an awful state: dirty counters, unwashed dishes piled up, and a generally unpleasant smell. The communal toilets were no better ‚Äî they were filthy and really uncomfortable to use.

Overall, the hostel had potential, especially with the design and layout of the Deluxe Rooms, but the lack of cleanliness and poor maintenance ruined what could have been a great experience. It‚Äôs such a shame, because with proper cleaning and management, this place could actually be quite nice.
showerReviews.author: Aylin Pokorny

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed in a four bunks room for two nights. Before the second night there was a roach on my friend‚Äôs bed. We had to killed it and there was none in the reception to talk too. The bathroom needed maintenance since the shower head would not stay up splashing water outside of the shower making all of the floor wet. The bedsheets looked clean enough and the AC worked fine even though we could not find the controller.

With a realistic expectation of the place I would stay there again. It was a fair price and a good location.

locations.title: SOPO Backpackers
locations.address: ÓÉà146 Scarborough St, Southport QLD 4215

showerReviews.reviewText:
The whole experience was just a bit odd.

From check in, we waited at the bar downstairs for 10 minutes before the manager showed up to show us to our room. It felt a bit strange and as if the bartender was annoyed at the manager for keeping us waiting.

The check in process consists of a thorough explanation of facial recognition law as the front door is unlocked by scanning your face. The manager was nice and friendly.

The room was spacious and beds were comfortable. I don't think the bathroom had been cleaned as the toilet seat was up, there were a few hairs in the sink and the shower floor had rubbish on it. There was also a smell of vomit and bleach.

Some of the other clientele are... interesting. It was less a backpacker vibe and more halfway house. We were woken up very early by what sounded like a wild bore going ballistic down the corridor. I still don't know what it was, my guess would be someone rattling the metal shutters of the managers office.

Free breakfast was appreciated, it's mainly cereal packets and tea/coffee. There are also some deals on food downstairs at the bar.

Location is good as it's just down from the beach. We got a twin room which is advertised as having a parking space, but it's actually just parking at the bottle shop which is first come first serve. Luckily we were able to get a space after a few hours but would have been annoying to pay for on street parking.

Overall just a very strange vibe.
showerReviews.author: Oscar Briscall-Harvey

locations.title: Sleepy Hollow Rest Area Northbound
locations.address: ÓÉà489 Pottsville Rd, Sleepy Hollow NSW 2483

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the nicer rest spots however mobile reception is or was horrible. Using a Samsung note 9 the network service was woeful. Unfortunately I was broken down in sleepy hollow rest stop and was desperately trying to call NRMA and it was a rather stressful time.
I did notice that there was a drinking water tap for caravaners and traveler's to fill their drinking water supplies on the side of the Toilet shed.
Toilets were clean and I did see a council guy checking the amenities whilst I spent time there. Nice table n chairs for eating and resting although I noticed only 1 setting.
Sleepy hollow rest stop although a nice Lil spot, it is rather noisy if I could fault it in anyway.
Oh by the way.......
Look out for the headless horsemen. Lols

locations.address: ÓÉàShop 20, 2532/2540 Gold Coast Hwy, Mermaid Beach QLD 4218

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wonderful caring staff giving expert safety instruction and explaining what was on offer and what was the best way to use the facilities.
A wonderful experience with different temperature pools, 2 spa pools, a sauna and steam rooms. Outdoor showers for a quick wash down to use the ice pool after using the sauna or steam room to get.
There is also other facilities like massage rooms, Light type sauna etc that can be checked out and booked. Check out their website for more details.
I totally recommend this Bathhouse. Wish we had one in the Hunter/ Newcastle Area.

Tried out the spa and sauna at Soak Bathhouse Mermaid Beach for the first time and had such a great experience! Even though it was a sold-out session and quite busy, everything felt super clean and hygienic. The whole space is really well maintained, and everyone there was respectful and mindful of hygiene, which made it really relaxing.

I only used the spa and sauna this time but can already highly rate the overall experience.

Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the area. Bonus points for offering locals discount codes and gift vouchers‚Äîperfect if you want to treat yourself or someone else. Highly recommend! The staff were so friendly and polite, they have many great facilities and amenities.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely wonderful day spa. Would return again in a heartbeat. I did a combo 50 minute deep tissue massage with a 90 minute soak afterward and I felt the value for money as exceptional.

The massage was fantastic.

The facilities were squeaky clean.

The spa amenities were state of the art:

Two magnesium warm baths, two hot tubs, a true and proper cold plunge, a dry sauna, a eucalyptus steam room, as well as infrared saunas for an additional fee.

Clean shower and changing rooms are provided along with a complimentary assortment of teas and still and sparkling water on tap.

The staff was extremely friendly, and they were very liberal about the 90 minute time allotment especially towards the end of the day on a Saturday.

I‚Äôll definitely be back!

locations.address: ÓÉà1/18 Fern St, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
My sister, Mum & I were wanting some pampering during our holiday in the GC and found this gem üíé
We chose the Winter Warmer package which gave us 3hrs of bliss with Karli, Manuela & Yumi. Karli began with a full explanation about what was going to happen throughout the session which in our case was a Full body massage, facial, foot mud mask followed by a soak in the magnesium spa. The treatment room was large enough for the 3 of us to comfortably be in the 1 room, it was sparkly clean, perfectly heated and fresh robes and towels were supplied. We all loved the treatments, feeling relaxed and pampered before heading to the magnesium spa.. we're all over 60 and feel the achy muscles of age and having the soak in the spa was a perfect way to end the session.
We walked out feeling pampered, spoilt and relaxed. Will return here everytime I come to the GC. Thank you Karli for looking after us and spoiling us for the time we were at RejoovMe ‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good swimming complex. Great changing rooms, caters for everyone.  The indoor pool is a very good size and  is newly built. 25 meter pool needs a complete overhaul.  It's old and the shallow end is really shallow, not great for adults but good for little ones. 50m pool is good, excellent for lane swimming. There's fast, medium and slow lanes. In schools term the pool can be occupied so worth checking on lane availability.
50m pool outdoor area needs updating, it's adequate at best.
Some really good aspects of the complex but also some not so good.
showerReviews.author: joanne Fox

showerReviews.reviewText: My favourite pool on the Sunshine Coast, especially since the recent renovations! It's far less crowded than other pools, particularly between 7:30-9am, and they post their schedule weekly on their Facebook page (so helpful!). I've never had to share a lane. The 50m pool has such an open, airy and sunny vibe thanks to the green spaces and oval next door - it's really quite lovely! The pool is always spotless and clean, and the bathroom facilities are too. Plus, individual shower cubicles with consistent warm water is great. There is always a large amount of decent swimsuits for sale - I'm always tempted to buy something new when I go!
showerReviews.author: Carla Myers

showerReviews.reviewText: I swim there once or twice a month and love the heated pools. But I queried a yearly pass and was quoted $700+. Forget I'm a veteran, that is too expensive. And I'm very surprised at the substandard state of the ablutions, considering the active community & tourism we have. They're outdated, wet, smelly and even with my glasses on, I can't tell if the shower drains are mouldy or just old & worn. Not a good look Caloundra and frankly embarrassing.

showerReviews.reviewText: I recently visited Buderim swimming pool, and I was very impressed with the overall experience. The facility is well-maintained and a comfortable temperature that makes swimming enjoyable. All the staff were so helpful and very friendly. Definitely will be back.

showerReviews.reviewText:
5/5 ‚Äì Immaculately Maintained, Outstanding Staff

Having visited pools all around the country, I can confidently say the Buderim 25m pool stands out as the cleanest facility I‚Äôve experienced ‚Äî even more impressive considering it's one of the older pools. The care and attention the staff put into maintaining it is evident everywhere you look.

From regular water testing to spotless bathrooms and beautifully kept gardens, the staff here go above and beyond. They‚Äôre not only hardworking, but incredibly friendly, cheerful, and always happy to help. You genuinely feel welcomed every time you walk through the gate.

While there are a couple of minor signs of age ‚Äî such as a small corner with some black mould that seems impossible to clean and a few rusted fixtures on the pool floor ‚Äî these are tiny blemishes in what is otherwise an incredibly well-kept facility.

It‚Äôs a credit to the whole team who clearly take pride in keeping the place pristine and running smoothly. I‚Äôd recommend Buderim Pool to anyone looking for a clean, friendly, and well-managed swimming spot.
showerReviews.author: Dana Skornicki

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been training at Buderim Swimming Pool since 1995. My kids learnt to swim there in the 90s & 2000s. We have taken visitors to the pool and I still attend adult squad there. Coaches and staff come and go sadly, but the team there at present are pleasant, friendly and so very helpful. They work so well together. Special mention to current Coach Murphy and staff, who I generally see, doing the early morning squads. Professional, communicative and knowledgeable coaching often followed by very good coffee! It is also nice and reaffirming to have consistency in our coaching team! So give adult squad swimming a go early morning, mid-morning or evenings. Just check with the staff on times. Or if that is not your go, there are plenty of other activities to enjoy. At least wander in and try the coffee!
showerReviews.author: Michael Dwyer

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm compelled to respond to a previous review where allegations that an off duty staff member from Nambour Aquatic Centre was trying to remove any item from a patron's personal bag and then ran away.

I empathically and categorical state that this is a false accusation that has not a semblance of truth. I and others in the 25 metre pool where well aware of the circumstances of this incident both prior and after this event took place. At no stage was this off duty staff member attempting or had the intension to remove or steal any item from this patron's bag for personal gain.

For anyone to have the pertinacity to make such allegations without spending a minute or two to realise an honest mistake was made, is unfair. It is wrong to attempt to tarnish the reputation of another without taking the time to realise it was an honest mistake. It was easy to quickly ascertain that this patron's bag was picked up mistakenly, rather than that of another bag which was placed directly beside her bag. To then write a review making false allegations, is a result of haste and misrepresentation when describing the events.

I will outline with specificity what I witnessed and had occurred before and after this event took place. I requested the off duty staff member to do a favour by passing my swim gloves to me as I had left them in my swim bag. I had wished to show another patron what they looked like and how to use them to do shoulder and arm strengthening exercises. I pointed to my bag so the off duty staff member could remove my swimming gloves from my bag and pass them to me, however the patron's bag was directly beside my bag which contained my swim gloves and was picked up mistakenly instead of mine. I heard the patron call out to the off duty staff member, and I realised the wrong bag was picked up, and immediately let the off duty staff member know that my bag was the bag beside the one she had picked up. The off duty staff member apologised to the patron, removed the gloves from my bag and got back into the pool and handed the gloves to me. Unfortunately completely by accident the patron's bag was inadvertently picked up, as it was mistakenly deemed as belonging to me.

The accusation from the patron that a staff member said ''sort of sorry and ran away'', is blatantly false. There was a clear apology made for mistakenly picking up the wrong bag. There was certainly no running away, or moving away from the area, as the gloves were passed to me by the off duty staff member as she got into the 25 metre pool where the patron was also exercising.

I'm incensed that a false accusation of this nature appeared in a review on this platform. I would suggest this patron in future take the time to ascertain the circumstance of the event before making allegations, as stated there was no intension to remove or steal any item from her bag. It was a simple and honest mistake, after I requested this staff member who was not on duty, to assist me by removing my swimming gloves from my bag. There was no impropriety on the part of the off duty staff member at all, rather an honest mistake made when trying to do a favour for me. The staff member who was mentioned, had no bad intention whatsoever, there was no ''running away''. There certainly was an apology, and it was clearly evident to me and others that the patron's bag was picked up mistakenly for another bag. The truth of the situation should have been realised very quickly, as it was obviously an honest mistake.

I have been a patron of the Nambour Aquatic Centre for decades,  and I have known the staff member mentioned for at least 9 years. They have always been honest and kind in their dealings with other patrons when both on and off duty. As you would understand this has been very distressing for this staff member to have to now deal with a negative review such as this, and put under scrutiny, and for other people to possibly question her character and good intensions, is very saddening.
showerReviews.author: John Carroll

showerReviews.reviewText:
For a free public pool this one is great for young kids!

I actually didn't know that it was salt water so that was a nice surprise.

Our 2 year old daughter is not a confident swimmer so having the ramp and the ledge seat surrounding it was great for her to jump off into our arms.

It's not too deep either which is great for teaching how to swim.

It was busy on a Sunday but as the water was super choppy it was a welcome relief from the waves.

Not a whole lot of shade there as the umbrellas get taken so quickly.  We found a seat on the stairs and put a towel around us to have some morning tea.

The water feature was a great treat for our toddler to run in and out of safely.

There are surrounding cafes and we got some fish and chips and sat under a tree on the grass watching the ibis population.

A great family area, glad we visited.
showerReviews.author: Kylie F

locations.title: Goodlife Community Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà100 Buderim Pines Dr, Buderim QLD 4556

showerReviews.reviewText:
Tried out Goodlife Community Centre recently and it has a lot going for it. The location is great, the staff are genuinely friendly, and there‚Äôs plenty of parking. But there are a couple of things that would stop me from joining unless they change.

The afternoon/evening hours for the gym and pools are too limited for anyone who works a normal 9‚Äì5 job and wants to come in after work. Not everyone wants to train or swim in the morning before work. If both the pools and the gym were open until at least 8pm, people would be able to get in a workout and a swim after work.

The other issue is the undercover pool, which only seems to be available for classes (not general swimming or doing laps). This is especially an issue during the day, when the uncovered pool is fully exposed to the sun. Some people want shade so they don‚Äôt get fried while swimming.

If the centre extended its evening hours and opened up the undercover pool for general/lap swimming, it would be a much more practical option. Until then, I probably wouldn‚Äôt sign up.
showerReviews.author: Jamie Tennant

about this place !

locations.title: Goodlife Health Clubs Maroochydore
locations.address: ÓÉàLevel 1/55 Maroochy Blvd, Maroochydore QLD 4558

showerReviews.reviewText:
The group classes and the cardio area are great, but the weight area really needs attention. The equipment is very old, with poor ergonomics, rust, and an overall worn-out look that makes training less motivating. Compared to other gyms I‚Äôve been to, the facility is quite behind, and it might be time for a proper upgrade.

I used to train at ClubLime and only switched because this location is closer to my workplace, but honestly, I regret the change. Just check the photos and draw your own conclusion.

Another point is the check-in system. Having to open the app + turn on Bluetooth on my phone every single time isn‚Äôt practical. It would be much more efficient to use quick scan readers, similar to how many gyms use digital passes.

Also, the changing room is often dirty or wet.
showerReviews.author: Evander Girardi Cravo

showerReviews.reviewText:
GoodLife is like a church. You go when you‚Äôre vulnerable, they take as much money as they can from you, and you‚Äôre left feeling gross once you get out.

Pro‚Äôs
- I had a positive experience with Reform Pilates
- Staff mostly friendly

Con‚Äôs
- Male bathroom floor always dirty
- Lockers never got cleared/cleaned
- Showers not hot
- Steam room often smelly
- They‚Äôll continue to charge you for 30 days when you cancel even after the contract
- Getting receipts is like pulling teeth, at one point it took me 2 weeks to get a legal receipt showing GST with no portal to access them myself, so don‚Äôt use GoodLife if you need expense receipts
showerReviews.author: Owen Anderson

showerReviews.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I are travelling Australia, and like many doing the same, an anytime
Fitness membership has multiple benefits and is convenient. We have travelled along the east coast and visited dozens of AF gyms along the way. AF Maroochydore was our consistent gym for 5 months whilst we worked and unfortunately it was definitely the worst gym we‚Äôve visited. This gym doesn‚Äôt even come close to most of the other AF gyms we‚Äôve used along the east coast. There is a huge lack of staff presence and community that the other AF gyms seem to have as well as just a lack of equipment, space and positive atmosphere. The music system was out of use for the whole 5 months we used this gym and little details that ALL the other gyms provide such as free deodorant, period products, hair bands, body wash and access to hairdryers and hair straighteners were non existent here. The assumption I can make is that there is either a lack of regard for gym users here or this gym is under funded. One thing I would say is a unique benefit of this particular gym is the outdoor HIIT area and the bathrooms were for the most part kept clean.
showerReviews.author: Sophie Browning

locations.title: Impact Strength & Fitness | 24/7 Gym Warana
locations.address: ÓÉàshop 2/224 Nicklin Way, Warana QLD 4575

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been on a road trip passing through but spent a week in Sunshine coast. Welcomed with open arms. Able to buy day passes easily on site and no barriers to using the gym.

Very friendly staff and always cheerful when you arrive. They clearly care about their members.

Fantastic layout and equipment choice. Very clean (bring a towel) and great choice of music ( which you can even modify the playlists). Even though there are limited changing rooms they are all kitted out for a proper shower and clean.

There's also rehabilitation programme / trainers who often have people of older age attend and it's refreshing to see all ages in the gym working out.

Honestly one of the best gyms I've visited on my road trip.

Would definitely check this place out.
showerReviews.author: Shufty93

showerReviews.reviewText: Like I suppose they are clean and so forth. Bit of a weird place to review, right? One time I was using the shower part after swimming in the ocean and I heard a father talk to his son about the importance of regular bathing, which makes sense. Then he went on and on about the life cycle of turtles. Had they seen turtles? Were they going to see turtles later in the day? Did the little boy have an obsession with turtles? When I was a kid I briefly liked deep sea fish so I suppose I understand. Particularly krill, which whales just love

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful beach. Yes there's a safe and patrolled swimming area. However, I tend to walk along the beach to where it's less populated. Lots of space to sit, read a book, watch the surfers, explore the multitude of rock pools that expose themselves at low tide, close my eyes and listen to the ocean. Or grab an ice-cream or take-aways from one of the many restaurants and sit on the beach. Or watch an amazing sunset, moonrise, whatever! Love this beach!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Noosa Heads Main Beach is the kind of beach that makes you believe you‚Äôve accidentally wandered onto a postcard. Crystal-clear water, golden sand, and waves gentle enough that even the ocean seems to be in a good mood.

It‚Äôs perfect for literally everything ‚Äî tanning, swimming, floating around pretending you‚Äôre in a movie, or just sitting there staring at the view like it‚Äôs therapy (because honestly, it is). The vibe is relaxed, the people are lovely, and the whole place just radiates holiday energy.

Whether you‚Äôre grabbing a bite on Hastings Street between swims or watching the sun melt into the water, Main Beach always hits. It‚Äôs clean, beautiful, and somehow makes you forget every problem you‚Äôve ever had.

The only downside? The sheer volume of people. At peak times it feels like half of Australia had the exact same idea ‚Äî but honestly, when a beach is this stunning, can you even blame them?

If paradise had a postcode, it would be Noosa. üåûüèñÔ∏è
showerReviews.author: Tahlia Robb

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful, Relaxing, and Perfect for Everyone!

Noosa Main Beach is one of the best beaches I‚Äôve ever been to. The water is calm and crystal clear‚Äîperfect for swimming, even for kids. The sand is soft and clean, and the beach is very well-maintained. I also loved how close it is to Hastings Street, with so many cafes, restaurants, and shops just a short walk away.

It can get a bit crowded during peak times, and parking is limited, so come early if you can. But overall, it‚Äôs a stunning spot to relax, swim, surf, or just enjoy the sunshine. Highly recommended if you‚Äôre visiting the Sunshine Coast!

locations.title: Mooloolaba Beach Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉà100 Parkyn Parade, Mooloolaba QLD 4557

showerReviews.reviewText:
This park has a fantastic location near the beach accessed by 2 gates out the Beach.
It is a  lovely 60 site small park with excellent clean amenities however the Camp Kitchen is one of the worst kitchens around. There are 2 clear blinds on one side & both ends are open to windy conditions giving hardly any protection . There is  also no rubbish bin supplied, no cleaning cloths to wipe down no Television, no toaster or kettle or simple utensils to use.There are some old cookers and air fryers left by the campers. They have 2 BBQ hot plates BBQ, A fridge and a microwave that's it. A Very poor set-up for the rates they charge. Over $90 per night per site at present.
showerReviews.author: Greg Yarwood
