showerReviews.reviewText:
Highly recommended.

We visited the Mooloolaba Beach Holiday Park for 16 nights and were allocated a great corner van site on the southern side of the entrance. Note; no cabins there.

The park was refurbished not so long ago and was recommended by a neighbour, so we decided it was time to try it out.

Facilities are well designed  and maintained and each site has a good concrete slab. The location is terrific; close to the beach, patrolled swimming, the Mooloolaba Surf Life Saving Club, a good cluster of shops, cafes and restaurants, some with nice sea views. There is a Coles supermarket within a comfortable walking distance if you want to combine walks and light grocery shopping.

On some evenings, cafes provide local entertainment, adding a nice atmosphere to dining out. One evening, we discovered the Sunset Markets (5-9pm 1st and 3rd Saturdays each month). There are some great food stands and a mix of other temptations, including vinyl records.

So, all up, we had a pleasant holiday with few car trips.
showerReviews.author: Greg Tolcher

showerReviews.reviewText: A super fresh, well laid out and maintained park. Excellent amenities with reasonably sized spaces. A couple of minutes walk to the beach, via a locked gate and boardwalk. The boardwalk also leads to the Esplanade of cafe and shops. Across the road is the Wharf with many good dining options or causal drinks. Hard to imagine a better position if you want beach, dining, cafes and shopping. To get scenic views ... you only need to walk a couple of minutes. For all this value ... the cost is high but fair.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quite pricy for a caravan park (2 adults +one dog for a powered site for 3days is $262 for a shoulder period). No views from campsites. Many rules about how many nights you have to stay ( minimum 3 nights stay for ‚Äúcatholic shoulder‚Äù and we have to stay from 9-12/12 but not 10-13/12 because 13/12 become peak rate and it is minimum of 7 days‚Ä¶.).  And one vehicle per site, so you can‚Äôt have a car and a motorhome, even though there is enough space for it (as it is alright for caravans). No visitor vehicles. Some sites against the bush and road are pretty small, about the width of a footpath...mm.. I would say the least recommended site that in my own opinion and to remind myself of would be site 178 ‚Ä¶
On the good sides: Dog friendly sites available! Walking distance to the beach ( dog on leash allowed, life savers), shops and restaurants. No constant noise of campers come and go. Amenities seem pretty clean. Next to a skate park. 11am check in (10am check out).
showerReviews.author: MiaY LE

showerReviews.reviewText: We've stayed here a few times. The location is great to walk to the beach, some sites are lovely for a premium price, and it's neat and tidy. but that's all. I wouldn't recommend it if you've got kids, it's not very kid friendly - cars absolutely race through. Reception is not super friendly. Washing machines work 50% of the time, dryers don't dry properly 50% of the time.  At the price per night after travelling Australia, this is the highest we've ever paid p/n. We've stayed in epic beachfront places with waterparks, pools, amazing games and rec rooms, activities etc for  significantly less p/n. There's absolutely none of that here  - just the site & bathrooms and camp kitchen. Not even a tv room or anything. Honestly only worth about $35 per night if you're adults travelling and it would make sense.
showerReviews.author: Anne-Marie Curtis

showerReviews.reviewText:
BIG4 Caloundra Waterfront

We stayed on sites 18, 51, and 52. We didn‚Äôt realise our family would be split across different areas when we booked, which was a little inconvenient.

The pool and slide were great, and the amenities were clean. Being able to walk to the shops was a bonus. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Just a heads-up: our sites copped the hot afternoon sun, so it‚Äôs worth keeping that in mind when booking.

A nice park overall, but after staying at Sandstone Point, it‚Äôs hard not to compare ‚Äî Sandstone really is next level!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unforgettable Family Stay at BIG4 Caloundra Waterfront

We recently enjoyed a 3-night family getaway (2 adults, 2 young kids) at BIG4 Caloundra Waterfront Holiday Park, and it exceeded all expectations!
Our first night was in the premium Hibiscus cabin, which offered unbelievable waterfront views‚Äîa truly serene way to start the trip. For the next two nights, we stayed in the Greyvillea cabin, which was similar in size and amenities but without the views. That said, it was conveniently located near the pool and came at a significantly lower price (over $100/night cheaper), making it a great value option.
Both cabins were well-equipped with excellent kitchen facilities‚Äîdishwasher, microwave, full-sized fridge, and complimentary coffee and tea. Everything was clean, modern, and family-friendly.
The large pool was the highlight for our kids (and us!). With a gentle gradient depth perfect for little ones and super fun water slides that even adults can enjoy, it kept everyone entertained for hours. Plenty of sun loungers and pool towels made relaxing easy.
We loved grabbing our morning coffee from Tom and Andy‚Äôs coffee cart, which had lovely water views. The resto bar overlooking the pool was another great touch‚Äîyou can even order food and drinks poolside without leaving your lounger!
Our kids had an absolute blast, and we made some truly special family memories. Having visited several holiday parks up and down the east coast, this one stands out as the best we‚Äôve experienced so far.
We‚Äôll definitely be back‚Äîand next time, we‚Äôll be booking well in advance!
showerReviews.author: Mayur Gehi

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a great park! We'd stayed previously but never used all park facilities nor realised it is so close to downtown Caloundra (we'd been for specific purposes other than enjoying the park itself).
The sites are reasonable size, not large but very adequate.
The toilet/shower facilities are great.
Since we were last there they have added the bar/bistro adjacent to the pool. What a great spot that is!
Drinks & food were reasonably priced. Food was delicious & meals were served remarkably quickly (even though they appeared to be quite busy).
The coffee van is great to start the day
Caloundra, and all it has to offer, is literally outside the gate.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Big 4 Maroochy River is a great doggie friendly place to stay. We were camping and had a wonderful powered site to set up our tent, tables and relax.

Each site had its own water supply and grey wastewater drain too. No camping on someone else‚Äôs washing up or shower water üëç

Also available were campsites for caravans, camper trailers, and Winnebago type vehicles.

The staff were friendly, hardworking, really helpful and kept an eye on the park too.

The amenities block was in perfect condition, easy to turn on and off ceramic taps üëç, clean toilets, hot showers and an attached pay as you go  laundry. The dump point is well located at the rear of the amenities block.

The camp kitchen was also spotless, cleaned daily and had plenty of chairs and tables for guests.

My overall impression for the Big 4 Maroochy River is fantastic 10/10. I will be staying here again.

For the kids there was a jumping castle, swimming pool and some games to play.
showerReviews.author: Juliet George

They even had Pancake Wednesday for 45 minutes in the morning with gold coin donation to charity! Can't fault this place other than being close to the motorway, but having said that it didn't bother me and it made it easy to get to and leave. Highly recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We were fortunate that we were moved closer to the Amenities at check-in. Our site was nice, had enough space for Caravan, car and Annexe next to each other. My partner was guided in by the caravan manager when we arrived. Staff were professional when dealing with Customers.
Showers, need maintenance, they keep running even when turned off. Noticed that every second day the hand paper towel runs out,  but fortunate there is a hand dryer that works. Low pressure in shower, nice hot water. One out of two dryers out of order,  there are enough washing lines to dry clothing, 2 washing machines well priced. I am not sure if the drainage system is very old, it does have a waste water smell at times, this  has been mentioned in previous comment.
We extended from 2 to 4 nights. Nice walk to the beach front and the cafes and shops. Pool looked very nice, didn't use it. Can recommend this park.

showerReviews.reviewText: Can't really tell you much about this place as we decided not to stay. But we did look around and what we did see is this.   The location is beautiful of course as it is right on the beach.  The office staff very helpful and friendly. The park was fully booked except for one slab we saw that was right alongside the entrance driveway, so not great. More of a car park spot than a holiday spot. In fact most of the camping spots we saw were really small and everyone packed really tightly in side by side with no real privacy. I reckon you could easily hear your neighbours snore at night. We have been to lots of caravan parks, and this is one we will probably never choose because $80 a night is way too much for a plot size that would be the absolute minimum. Even for the very experienced, fitting a caravan into allocated spot would be almost impossible if the others were full around you. Did not check the shower blocks and laundry eymtc but no reason to think they would be bad. The park clean and tidy and well kept.
showerReviews.author: Merrily Willis

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful park, spacious, clean, shady and handy to everything you need for a relaxing stay.  Beach close by, cafes and restaurants only a short walk away.  Friendly staff, immaculate grounds and the cleanest amenities.  Well done to the management.

showerReviews.reviewText: The ladies at reception were awesome. We stayed for 3 nights in the pet free area. Sites were generous and well kept and a short stroll across the road to the beach, 400 metres from cafes and restaurants. Unfortunately the cleaning in the amenities block has let them down. For an expensive stay of $220 for 3 nights, the floor tiles need to be scrubbed as soap scum is building up. The hot water in the showers started off well then slowly cooled down - and I don't take a long shower! As it is a council operated park, probably nothing will come of the reviews but I don't feel there is value for money here.
showerReviews.author: Sue Gander

Stayed here 4 nights, a good clean park. Go for a fish up the end. I thought it might be loud being on a main road but it's been okay.(Stayed on the back fence).
Park doesn't have things like playground, games room or camp kitchen. We booked it knowing that as it was central to  key tourist destinations.
However I think the Wi-Fi systems need to be improved as often it wasn't good enough.
Very friendly management, clean amenities. And had a chat with some of the residents who also vouch for the parks improvement since about a year ago (change of management).

Great stuff. One thing I think should happen is to paint up two check in bags for caravans up the front as I found myself blocking the fuel station and upsetting the public.

locations.title: Noosa River Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉà4 Russell St, Noosaville QLD 4566

showerReviews.reviewText:
We were camping at Noosa River Holiday Park this past weekend. The location is excellent however there were definitely some things that were lacking. We would visit again for sure but some small improvements could make the experience much better.

This time of year the park is at capacity and consequently the toilet/shower blocks needed more attention than they were receiving. EG. the soap dispenser was empty, paper towels ran out and toilets needed cleaning.

The campsites by the river, whilst having a really beautiful outlook, are fairly poor in comparison to the many other camp sites we‚Äôve stayed at, including in the Noosa Shire. They are not on level ground so for those of us who camp a lot, we know how it is when you and your camp mattress keep slipping down a slope to the edge of the tent. Not ideal. There were also exposed trees roots which again make tenting a challenge (remember the fairytale of the princess and the pea - same principle with tree roots üòä). I think that these issues could be rectified fairly easily, perhaps with small timber retaining walls and sand to build up the sites. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

As I wrote above, we would definitely come back as the location is excellent and the river views beautiful. However feedback can be useful, especially if it is acted upon, so this feedback is offered in that spirit. üôè
showerReviews.author: Fi C

showerReviews.reviewText:
The nicest and most relaxed caravan park we stayed at during our trip from Cairns to Brisbane.

Check in quite easy, office open until 5pm, after which time the safe will hold your key and welcome pack with amenities codes.

There isn't a shop/bottle shop terribly nearby so would recommend stocking up before arriving, otherwise it is about a 20m walk to the nearest Dan Murphy's and perhaps 15m walk to a convenience store. Camp shop behind reception sells some things (e.g. Tim tams) in office hours.

Beautiful setting on the river. You can watch boats go by and there's a boat and jet ski hire place a short 10m walk away.

Bathroom and laundry facilities are good and there's plenty of 24 hour laundry hanging space. The laundry needs $5 in 1 and 2 dollar coins to operate. Dryer is $2.

Sites are good and spacious so plenty of room to park and spread out.

Kitchens are good though do not leave anything in the kitchen overnight not labelled, as it will be thrown out pretty sharpish even if it was by accident or to donate to other campers!

Very relaxed and communal layout and feel so we enjoyed the atmosphere and our stay here
showerReviews.author: David Wild

locations.title: Ingenia Holidays Noosa
locations.address: ÓÉà2/141 Cooroy Noosa Rd, Tewantin QLD 4565

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked a large ensuite site figuring it would be 'large' and maybe they are by caravan standards but we had four sites within arms reach around us. Small children about and with a big (friendly) dog we like to have enough space so that no one gets bumped or knocked over.

Explained this to friendly staff who quickly offered up a solution. Had a look at the alphabet named sites that were much longer with a nice garden like space out the back. This is the road side so a bit of traffic noise that did not bother us. No neighbours in front or back - still quite close on the side (for our liking) but everyone very friendly and respectful.
The place was fully booked and you could have heard a pin drop after 8pm. Amenities spotless and pretty much empty every time I went there.
Gardens well maintained, no litter and camp kitchen has everything you need.
Great family place. Basically in the suburbs of Noosa and we didn't find too many cool places in walking distance with the dog but a short drive to the marina and good fish and chips.
showerReviews.author: Meredith McMahon

showerReviews.reviewText:
This hotel has some things going for it and some things going against it. The rooms are clean in my experience, they have liquid soap (which is becoming increasingly standard, so that's good to see), and there's plenty of space for the number of people in each sized room.

That said, this is not a quiet hotel. The soundproofing will block quiet noise but does nothing against anything loud, so if you have a family next door you won't be sleeping. The tiling on the bathrooms is extremely slippery when wet, which concerned me when my wife almost fell in the shower. We found some of the electronics not working, like the bedside lamps, so those aren't checked frequently. There is also no drinkable water unless you upgrade to a Kitchenette, so you're given a single bottle of water as a "gift" (They really call it that). The Kitchenettes are ok if you do get one, but they're not equipped enough for anything special.

The staff are also not the best. They are approachable but clearly tired and not very competent, almost as if they have a script of pre-generated responses in their head and just cannot help you if you leave it. We left an item in the room, told them exactly what it is, what it looks like, where it would be, and that it was so recent the cleaners may have not even come yet, and you could see the confusion on their face as they asked what we mean at every single step. We weren't even speaking very fast, and they weren't typing anything either. We did not get the item back.

Overall I could see this being a good spot for a family if they need a decently cheap place, but this is nothing special and I would not call it 4 stars at all.
showerReviews.author: Jonathan Joestar

We had a wonderful time at Rivershore Camping Site. The location is secure and conveniently situated, making it easy to explore and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. The staff were friendly and helpful, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere throughout our stay.

The water park was a fantastic highlight ‚Äî fun for both kids and adults, and the caf√© served delicious food that we thoroughly enjoyed. We also spent time fishing by the lake and hired bikes to explore the area.

The shared cooking facilities were well-equipped, and the toilets and showers were always clean and well-maintained.

Overall, Rivershore Camping Site offers the perfect combination of comfort, convenience, and great hospitality. It‚Äôs a wonderful place to relax, have fun, and enjoy nature. Highly recommended! We'll be back.

locations.title: Novotel Sunshine Coast Resort
locations.address: ÓÉà270 Ocean Dr, Twin Waters QLD 4564

showerReviews.reviewText: I booked this resort through Jetstar holidays deal and had a very low expectations after reading a bunch of mixed reviews. However, I was pleasantly surprised as the resort was much more than I expected. It‚Äôs definitely not a brand new resort however quite well maintained. We had a garden view room with queen and single beds and it was specious, clean and comfortable with enough storage and comfy beds. Buffet breakfast was amazing with lots of choices. The other facilities included swimming pool (towels provided), spa, very well equipped gym, kayaks etc were also great. On-site food, drink and snack options were good as well. Additionally, resort grounds were amazing with variety of Australian wildlife like kangaroos and some exotic birds and a nice walking track around the lake. Overall resort staff was very attentive and super friendly. Definitely recommended!!
showerReviews.author: Alla Gliner

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a week recently at twin waters.  We have thee kids under 4 so we got a double interconnecting room.  We arrived and our room wasn‚Äôt ready - it was 3.30pm‚Ä¶. Check in is at 2pm.  Ok two drink vouchers given.  Our room wasn‚Äôt ready finally ready by 4.30pm.  Rooms were dated and old but mostly clean.  Buffet breakfast is good - good range and an omelette station which hit the spot.  Saturday and Sunday were extremely busy.  Our room didn‚Äôt get serviced on Sunday and even when they said they couldn‚Äôt accomodation our clean and asked for towels they didn‚Äôt deliver them.  Same with the next day, got to 2pm and I called again reminding them our room hadn‚Äôt been cleaned again.  They came at 4.45pm.  Resort is run down, pool is small.  Everyone and their kids were on the pool over the weekend and even when some teenagers were doing bomb dives off the deck into the pool no one stopped them.  We went a few years ago just as a couple and had a similar experience.  Sadly, not what it once was. Day trips to Ginger Factory, Australia Zoo and the Aquarian was what made the trip in the end.
showerReviews.author: krystlle senior

showerReviews.reviewText: Wonderful stay at Noosa North Shore! Sites were clean and spacious, amenities were very clean and seemed new. The beach was gorgeous and quiet. We saw lots of kangaroos! I would highly recommend staying here.

showerReviews.reviewText: Wonderful stay at Noosa North Shore! Sites were clean and spacious, amenities were very clean and seemed new. The beach was gorgeous and quiet. We saw lots of kangaroos! I would highly recommend staying here.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We didn‚Äôt realise at first that you need to catch a ferry to get to Noosa North Shore Beach Campground, but luckily it runs back and forth from early morning until evening, which made everything easier. Once we arrived, the campground was absolutely worth it.

The facilities were clean and well-kept ‚Äì kitchen, laundry, and bathrooms all tidy (a little sand left in the showers, but that‚Äôs totally expected being right by the beach). The location is stunning: peaceful bush sites, spectacular beach access, and incredible views. We enjoyed both sunset and sunrise right on the beach and even spotted a few kangaroos while heading down for sunrise in the morning.

Our powered site was tucked away in the bush, private and relaxing. The whole experience was restful, quiet, and everything we hoped for. No issues or concerns at all.

Highly recommend Noosa North Shore Beach Campground to anyone wanting to escape the crowds, connect with nature, and enjoy simple, relaxing, beachside camping.
showerReviews.author: Sei Leapai

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just spent the past two days at Noosa North Shore Campground and I‚Äôm already planning my return. This place is an absolute gem for anyone looking to unwind, reconnect with nature, and enjoy a true beachfront camping experience.

The location is unbeatable‚Äîright on the dunes with direct access to the beach. Waking up to the sound of the ocean and watching the sun rise over the waves was nothing short of magic. The sites are well maintained, spacious, and feel tucked away enough to enjoy some privacy while still being part of a friendly camping community.

Amenities were clean and reliable, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Whether you're into fishing, beach walks, or simply relaxing under the stars by the fire, this place delivers. It's also a great base to explore Noosa and the surrounding national parks.

Highly recommend for solo travellers, couples, and families. If you‚Äôre looking for peace, nature, and some of the best beach vibes in Queensland, Noosa North Shore is it.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ferry access is no problem, just a bit pricy for a car and caravan over $60 for a return trip.

Friendly, accommodating staff, easy booking process. If you download the park map, you can try and book a specific site.

Unpowered sites are tucked away in the bush, and if you're self contained, these are the pick of the park.

Powered sites are in a grassed, open section, no trees. Easy caravan parking/setup. Not many sites are drive through, if any.

Amenities are clean, contemporary and we'll maintained. Toilet/shower block, large camp kitchen with a microwave, electronic jugs, toasters, sinks, hot water and bbq hot plates. Many undercover tables and benches.

No fuel/portable gas available.
Grey water cannot be disposed of on ground, must use disposal point.
Fires permitted in your own or hired fire pits. Bring your wood. Very limited rubbish disposal points at camp kitchen.
No generators allowed and noise restrictions apply, which is great for such a peaceful spot. No pets.
Bring a bikes to make it quicker to get to amenities. Most tracks suitable.
Whole park is quite flat.

Plenty of wild life, big Roos and Goannas, heaps of birds, especially scrub turkey.

Very relaxing place to stay. Surf, walk, talk and eat.
showerReviews.author: Peter Lausberg

showerReviews.reviewText:
We really did enjoy this camping spot. Lovely lake, pretty good camp spots, excellent and clean facilities.  However‚Ä¶ upon check-in, we asked the check-in staff how to pronounce ‚ÄúLake Cootharaba‚Äù and she had no idea - so not a local. And within 12 hours of checking in we had an email stating ‚Äúno hanging things from trees and no grey water collecting‚Äù. Felt a bit overkill.   ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Anyway‚Ä¶ it was very windy (40 km/h) and we had a little rain, but this aided it to being a cool camping experience. We had a few times when we braved the wind and had fun swimming in the 1m depth water and catching a few fish in the Lake. Even with the wind, we managed to catch a few small bream and whiting - so definitely wet a line whilst there.

Can have own fire pits and dogs are able to attend (we loved meeting Doug the Dog) so all in all a great experience.

Would love to come back on a less windy weekend. Very good for families and kids - safe and friendly. Thanks!
showerReviews.author: My Life

Boreen Point Campground is an absolute gem! It‚Äôs the perfect spot for everyone‚Äîkids, adults, and even your furry friends. The campsites are generously sized, so you don‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre on top of your neighbours, which makes it even more relaxing.

The amenities are plentiful, well-maintained, and spotless‚Äîexactly what you want after a day of exploring. There‚Äôs a great bike track and a park that‚Äôs safe for the kids to roam and play, and the water is perfect for swimming, kayaking, or letting your pup splash around.

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visit, enjoyed a powered concrete slab site that was central to all amenities on offer and 50m stroll to the lake. (We had sites 10 & 11).
No water fill station for van water tanks available on site so we filled at Cooroy (require a 25 or 50mm camlock).
Potable drinking water tap for your day to day drinking is available on site.

Amenities block was cleaned routinely throughout day and was always well presented.  Camp kitchen clean and spacious with fridge, toaster, kettle and microwave available.   Waste dump point and coin operated laundry available on site.

Small reception open daily on site to check in and sells ice, icecreams and basic essentials.  Fires are permitted pending fire ban advice/ weather. During our stay firepits were permitted as long as off the ground and contained and small in size or for cooking. Reception will advise any regulations or rules around firepits upon check-in.  They also have braziers available for hire.

Pub short stroll away (dog friendly) and small walk along lake and you will find a cute hole in the wall cafe selling well made coffee and small food menu.

Lake is great for kids and dogs to play.  Knee deep at best so water is calm and warm perfect for floating, SUPing, kayaks etc.

Dog friendly as long keep on leash and clean up after your pets (just be a responsible pet owner).

Great combination of the lake set amongst the big leafy trees and roads around camp will permit majority of vans / camping set ups.   Will be back- was a great stay.
showerReviews.author: Sunset Paws & Vino

locations.title: Bluff Creek Campground Kenilworth
locations.address: ÓÉà44 Wilcox Rd, Kenilworth QLD 4574

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed at Bluff Creek Campground near Kenilworth, and it was simply amazing. The views are absolutely astounding, with rolling grassy sites, wide open skies, and an easy atmosphere that made it the kind of place you want to linger at just to soak it in.

The staff were incredibly warm and friendly. Check in was seamless and they seemed genuinely pleased to have campers around. There are lots of sites to choose from, and most are well spaced with a green, grassy feel. Amenities are great, with a couple of amenities blocks that have clean, coin operated hot water showers (one dollar coins). The amenities blocks were clean and everything was well maintained.

Location is excellent, only about 10 minutes drive into the town of Kenilworth, which is a beautiful little town well worth exploring. There is a nice atmosphere and plenty of cafes and shops to check out while camping nearby.

If you stay there, you should also check out Booloumba Falls in Conondale National Park (you need a four wheel drive to access Booloumba Falls, or Booloumba Creek is accessible for any car). It is a lovely waterfall and creek walk with swimming holes near Kenilworth. It is a great day trip from Bluff Creek.

Verdict: Definitely a recommended stay. Lovely setting, good amenities, very friendly hosts.
showerReviews.author: Michael D

locations.address: ÓÉà1 Leafy Ln, Chevallum QLD 4555

showerReviews.reviewText:
This campsite was such a hidden gem! I spent two nights here with friends and we had an amazing time. The atmosphere was super friendly and familiar‚Äîperfect for relaxing and enjoying nature together.

The facilities were great: clean toilets, hot showers (so good after a day out), and plenty of firewood for a cozy fire in the evening. The views were stunning, especially around the two beautiful lakes where we chilled out and took in the peaceful surroundings.

The location is also really convenient‚Äîjust a 20-minute drive to Mooloolaba, and really close to the TreeTop Challenge. Whether you‚Äôre into outdoor adventures or just want a quiet escape, this place has it all.

The owner was incredibly kind and welcoming too, which made the experience even better. Highly recommend‚Äîcan‚Äôt wait to come back!

Had an amazing stay at this very well maintained property where we parked our motorhome for what was going to be 1 night, but turned into an extra night as the tranquility was exceptional.
Overlooking the large lake, freshly mowed lawn, camp fire and peace and quiet amounts up to 20 other campers and is pet friendly.
It was so lovely to wake up and have the most beautiful water view out our bedroom window.
This park is only suitor those who are fully self contained as there are no toilets, showers, power or bins.
We really enjoyed this stop over and will most definitely come back.

locations.title: Pacific Paradise Motel
locations.address: ÓÉà612 David Low Way, Pacific Paradise QLD 4564

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not a bad place if on a budget. My main problem was the bed. Because they are on wheels, they roll around easily while you're in it if you turn over. Also it would be good if there was a door between the main room and the walk in. Otherwise you have to get dressed in the bathroom which has no where to put clothes if the towels are already up.
Decent size room considering the price.
Friendly staff.
showerReviews.author: Siel the snail

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed in room b, for about $250 for one night, which appears to be a converted garage. It was reasonably clean, beds ok but very cramped. Bathroom was recently renovated but had some issues with shower head spraying all through the bathroom when door was open to adjust water for kids. Bathroom flooded and they didn‚Äôt have a floor waste so only way to get rid of water was to mop up with towels. Called reception before 7pm to ask for a couple of towels but was told there was nothing they could do as they weren‚Äôt on site any longer. I should have let it flood. There was no tv reception in our room. Netflix was the only thing I could get working. There‚Äôs no lamps so the kids complained about the lights until we went to bed and turned the main ones off. No power next to bed either. Couldn‚Äôt charge phones. Assume because it used to be a garage and didn‚Äôt expect a bed there. Pool was dirty. No net to clean it. Pump wasn‚Äôt even turned on. No lighting in pool or bbq area at all.
Bar fridge has no door wires to hold in milk etc so, despite being a good size, all our bottles were lying down so no room for other stuff. Little wardrobe provided was water damaged because they don‚Äôt provide any hooks or hanging room so everyone puts their wet towels on doors. The only lock on our door was the sliding fly screen door. It‚Äôs actually very hard to see and get in when they don‚Äôt put the light on at this section. Everyone else had a light though. Our bathroom has a huge window which opens right in to the owners back yard. Thank god they don‚Äôt reside here. Or do they? The front door and full front of the room is glass sliding door and gets sun all afternoon. They put up some $10 drapes which do well at absorbing the heat and turning the garage in to a sauna. Can‚Äôt open them up because everyone driving past it or in the pool or walking outside has complete view in to your room through the 2m+ sliding glass doors. After reading the reviews that it‚Äôs pet friendly, I‚Äôm just praying we don‚Äôt wake up with flea bites‚Ä¶
Don‚Äôt stay here. Spend a few extra bucks and get something decent if you can.
I‚Äôd consider staying at $100 a night but 250 is extortion.
The restaurant down the road ‚Äòthe loose goose‚Äô was amazing! Get down there if you can. Amazing food and service. I‚Äôd stay in this shight room again if I knew it meant I could eat there again.
showerReviews.author: Peter Jodie Daly

showerReviews.reviewText: Great staff. Lovely park. Lee, Rob and the staff are wonderful. They are friendly and make your stay easy and enjoyable always on hand to help or have a chat. Rob is an expert in guiding you and your van into the perfect spot - thanks mate, makes for a stress free set up after a long drive. The amenities are always spotless and if there is anything extra you need, staff are always on hand. Great pool for lane swimming or just to have fun. Super location, bus stop right outside the park and only a 1.2 walk into Tewantin or turn right and you are at the Noosa Northshore ferry. Thanks everyone!

Camp kitchen was fully equipped.. shower & toilet amenities clean spacious and modern .  Thursday night we bought GF based pizza from the regular Thursday pizza van , which visits every Thursday at the caravan park front gateüëçüèª

showerReviews.reviewText:
Arrived just after 11am. Friendly informative receptionist. Met at site 47 to help park the van as it is notorious for being on the tight side.  Rob was great took the stress out of parking the van, spot on with his directions. He got us between the pad and a tree first time. He gets 5 stars for service. It probably would have taken us a few goes to get it right. Site 47 is opposite the ablutions and laundry with a dump point there as well. The first evening a couple of backpackers were emptying their toilet canister and either that or the dump point when open was rank. I was going for a shower and the ladies ablutions smelt of the dump point, disgusting!
Might be an idea to have that dump point a bit further away from vans and amenities or keep it smelling sweeter.
The ablutions were clean although old and well used. There is only the one lot of ablutions in the park with a couple of extra toilets by the pool.
The pool looked nice didn't use it a bit too cold for us. The games room was nice but the TV was out of order. I'm sure they make enough money to pop to The Good Guys and get a new one.
The grounds were well maintained and bins emptied regularly. It was pretty quiet except for evening roosting when the birds arrived and the noise they make is unreal. Didn't last too long though and luckily not noisy in the morning.
Other than for the smelly dump point on that first night it's been okay.
We could ride our bike to the marina little cafe there did excellent coffee and scones. There a fish and chips shop we might try before we leave. You can ride into noosa for the main beach, Hastings Street and coffee and cake at the surf club. Driving is a pain and parking is near impossible.
showerReviews.author: Pamela Rivers

showerReviews.reviewText: Ingenia Holidays Noosa North in Tewantin is a fantastic family-friendly holiday park, perfect for a Sunshine Coast getaway. Just a 15-minute drive from Noosa Main Beach and Hastings Street, it offers a range of accommodation options, from spacious villas to powered caravan sites and unique glamping Belle Tents. The park is well-maintained, with clean amenities, a heated swimming pool, kids‚Äô wading pool, playground, and a popular camp kitchen with a pizza oven. Staff are friendly and accommodating, often going the extra mile to ensure a great stay. The location is ideal, with easy access to Noosa‚Äôs attractions, including a bus stop right outside for hassle-free trips to the beach or nearby Noosa Marina. Some guests noted that the Belle Tents could use some maintenance due to mustiness, and the pool closes early at 5:30 PM, which might disappoint some. Overall, it‚Äôs a clean, fun, and convenient base for exploring Noosa, highly recommended for families or groups looking for a relaxed yet activity-packed holiday.
showerReviews.author: Paz Avalos

showerReviews.reviewText: The hostel is poorly managed, messy and disorganized. Long-term stayers have taken over the spaces, leaving no room in lockers or fridges for short-term guests. Common areas are very limited and mostly outdoors, which isn‚Äôt usable in bad weather. The atmosphere is unwelcoming, with a cliquish vibe (mainly among French backpackers). The photos online are misleading, as the actual place is run-down with poor upkeep. Bedding was smelly and clearly not fresh. On top of that, there are no quiet hours at all ‚Äî backpackers were speaking loudly and blasting music late into the night, with no rules enforced by management. Overall, this hostel does not cater to short-term travelers and is one of the worst experiences I‚Äôve had.
showerReviews.author: Yuan Ting

showerReviews.reviewText:
I didnt expect alot being a backpackers (ive never stayed at one) but it was really good.

Staff were so friendly and welcoming.

showerReviews.author: Brooke Albon

showerReviews.reviewText:
A Hidden Gem: World-Class Service and the Best Shower on Earth!
I recently booked a one-night "sleep over" at Abode Mooloolaba and, to be honest, I wasn't expecting much. With the place described as a "backpackers" style accommodation, I was bracing myself for a simple, in-and-out experience. I couldn't have been more wrong. From the moment I stepped inside, the level of service completely blew me away.
The reception experience immediately set the tone. One of the young women greeted me with a genuine, welcoming smile. I had completely mucked up my ID, but the young lady handled the issue with incredible patience and professionalism, helping me through the process smoothly and efficiently. She got me checked in and even demonstrated their slick, modern key system‚Äîa new door key opening right on your phone via email (that‚Äôs fantastic technology!).
Getting to the room late that evening, the positive surprises continued. I have stayed in countless 5-star hotels around the world, but the shower at Abode Mooloolaba was, without exaggeration, the best flowing shower I have ever used. It was absolutely amazing! The bed was equally comfortable, ensuring I had a deep and restful night's sleep.
We were up and gone early, around 7 AM, and were greeted by another friendly staff member who ended our stay just as warmly as it began, wishing us an amazing day.
Abode Mooloolaba truly defies expectations. If you are looking for exceptional service, modern convenience, and the kind of comforts you'd expect from a luxury stay (like a phenomenal shower!), look no further. Highly, highly recommend!
showerReviews.author: jason holtham

showerReviews.reviewText:
Loved it! From the moment we arrived (four friends), we were greeted with a smile and warm welcome. Set in amongst a tropical rainforest, a few minutes drive from The Doonan, the Balinese style Spa, has a number of treatments and 'treats' to choose from.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had high hopes for this head spa after a truly exceptional experience at another location in Palmview. Unfortunately, this one didn‚Äôt live up to the same standard.

Most of the session felt more like a hair wash than a relaxing head massage, which was disappointing given what I was expecting. Toward the end of the treatment, a loud gurgling noise (the heat lamp I‚Äôm presuming) persisted for about 15 minutes ‚Äî it was so distracting I almost got up and left. A heads-up about this would have made a big difference.

To top it off, a foreign female voice began speaking over a loudspeaker right at the end, which completely broke any sense of calm or professionalism. Overall, it just didn‚Äôt feel like the relaxing, immersive experience I was hoping for.

showerReviews.reviewText: Unacceptable. To think it's 2025 and I can't feel safe to take my child to the pool. I walked my son into the bathrooms to let him wash the chlorine off before going home and a disgusting older man extend the shower stall opposite the entrance completely naked. When I noticed and gave a disgusted look he looks at me and my son touched himself and smiled. I had to cover my son's eyes and when I walked him to his own stall the older man had the gall to laugh at me when he passed. Absolutely disgusting and despicable behaviour being allowed at the pool. I myself felt violated I can imagine how embarrassed my son was. I will never be going back to this pool and I advise others to at the very least choose not to use the bathrooms.
showerReviews.author: Forgotten Fever

showerReviews.reviewText: Unacceptable. To think it's 2025 and I can't feel safe to take my child to the pool. I walked my son into the bathrooms to let him wash the chlorine off before going home and a disgusting older man extend the shower stall opposite the entrance completely naked. When I noticed and gave a disgusted look he looks at me and my son touched himself and smiled. I had to cover my son's eyes and when I walked him to his own stall the older man had the gall to laugh at me when he passed. Absolutely disgusting and despicable behaviour being allowed at the pool. I myself felt violated I can imagine how embarrassed my son was. I will never be going back to this pool and I advise others to at the very least choose not to use the bathrooms.
showerReviews.author: Forgotten Fever

showerReviews.reviewText:
My daughter has Austim and we have been through a lot. As her
mum I want her happy, content, comfortable and safe. Of course
sometimes what brings those joys to her one day may not the
next day.

Some days we nail it, some days we bail it.
Surprises aren‚Äôt our best friends and so planning becomes second nature. It works best for us if I can show Lilly what we are doing, where, when, what and how.

Enter C√©rge!

Being able to show Lilly the Tobruk Memorial Pool before we
arrived not only took some of my own mental load, it‚Äôs reduced
anxiety for us both.

We knew what the entrance looked like, we knew what the pool
areas look liked, even the change rooms and they aren‚Äôt ever
shown on websites.

We spoke through the noises, the possible smells and the feelings when going swimming. Lilly was excited and so was I so off we went for our adventure.

Using C√©rge is like meal prep.
It makes life so much easier for the rest of the day. My mental
load is less, I can be more present as a mum. One thing that is
hard in our situation is that I am in fight or flight and hyper alert, a lot. I worry about Lilly running off unexpectedly or what could
happen. What could make the day take a downward turn for us. I
feel guilty because I would love to be more ‚Äúpresent‚Äù or ‚Äúgo with
the flow‚Äù but that isn‚Äôt so easy for us. I must assess and plan for
us to be able to even remotely ‚Äúgo with the flow‚Äù.
Simple changes at places are massive changes for us. Tobruk pool adopting C√©rge means we have access to so much information which literally means a day out is possibly and a good day is more likely.

This is priceless.

The people at the pool may not even ever know we have done our
‚Äúhomework‚Äù because we do this before attending. For them, we
could be just another customer, for us they are a lifeline and so
much more.

I love that they have the C√©rge app, it meant I could let them
know we were coming and they welcomed us. The facilities are
great and very clean.

Lilly swam for much longer than expected and played with a blow
up croc for ages.
I felt my levels decrease. There was space between my breathing.
There was space.
There was a minute to watch my daughter
happily play in the pool and I could be present.
Presence, what a gift.
showerReviews.author: C√©rge Tech

locations.address: ÓÉà1 Pool Cl, Woree QLD 4868

showerReviews.reviewText: Our 3 year old son came here after learning at a private facility for about 18 months. Ms Isabella has been excellent and the improvement in his swimming was evident from the second lesson. Her gentle but firm guidance has really pushed him to stretch his water wings and, within a month, he is now swimming and diving down independently with confidence. Wish we had have come to a public pool for lessons sooner.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I love the Smithfield pool.
Easy parking.
There are 3 pools. One is a 25 metre pool and  undercover and heated, and is used for swim classes, and aqua zumba and therapy.  It is undercover, and nice and warm.
There are 2 outside pools as well, a large lap pool  plus a lagoon style pool for smaller children. There is plenty of undercover shelter and shade, as well as green grass.
The change rooms have lots of showers and toilets and a kept really clean and tidy.
Great experience.
Keep up the good work.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just signed up at the gym and I‚Äôm really disappointed.
People using the machines spend most of their time on their phones while others, like me, wait more than 20 minutes to use them very frustrating.
There is no Wi-Fi, no visible lockers in the gym area, and the water from the cooler is warm.
Me and my partner also asked if we could use the same account and card to save on the admin fee, but the girl at the reception said it‚Äôs not possible which doesn‚Äôt make any sense.
The extra $60 admin fee feels way too expensive.

showerReviews.reviewText:
First of all, I just want to say this is honestly one of the best gyms I‚Äôve ever been to ‚Äî if not the best. The environment is great, and I really don‚Äôt see myself switching gyms anytime soon. I‚Äôm very happy here!

I just wanted to raise one small point as a constructive suggestion. I‚Äôve noticed that some members tend to place multiple towels on different machines at once to ‚Äúreserve‚Äù them. I understand everyone has limited time to train and wants to make the most of it, but this practice can make it difficult for other members, especially those who don‚Äôt feel comfortable asking to jump in or take turns.

If possible, I‚Äôd like to kindly ask if the gym could address this with members so that everyone can enjoy the space more fairly. Of course, if this towel-reserving practice is officially allowed by the gym, no worries at all ‚Äî I‚Äôll simply try to adapt as best I can.

Thanks so much for your attention and support!
showerReviews.author: Matheus

showerReviews.reviewText:
Disappointing Experience at World Gym Cairns

I had high expectations for World Gym Cairns, but my experience was far from satisfactory. The gym is dirty, with broken equipment and poorly maintained facilities. Almost all machines have ripped or broken handles, and weights are scattered everywhere, making it difficult to find what you need.

It‚Äôs frustrating to see both members and even the personal trainer staff not wiping down equipment after use or using towels, which raises serious hygiene concerns. To top it off, gym attachments are carelessly shoved into boxes or left lying around on the floor.

I expected much better from a gym of this reputation. Until these issues are addressed, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this location to anyone.
showerReviews.author: Matt

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you‚Äôre looking for a top-notch fitness experience, Gold‚Äôs Gym in cairns city is the place to be! From the moment you step through the doors, you can tell that this gym is dedicated to providing its members with the best possible environment for achieving their fitness goals.

Location and Parking:
One of the standout features of this Gold's Gym is the exceptional parking situation. The gym boasts a spacious and well-maintained parking lot that makes it easy to find a spot, even during peak hours. No more circling around looking for a space; you can park with confidence and get right to your workout!

Equipment:
The equipment at Gold‚Äôs Gym is simply outstanding. With brand-new machines and free weights from top-tier brands, you‚Äôll find everything you need to tailor your workouts to your specific goals. The cardio machines are equipped with the latest technology, including personal screens for entertainment and built-in tracking features to keep an eye on your progress. The weightlifting area is equally impressive, offering a wide variety of strength training equipment that caters to all fitness levels.

Atmosphere:
The atmosphere inside the gym is motivating and invigorating. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to assist you or provide guidance on using the equipment. The gym is clean and well-organized, creating an inviting space that encourages you to push your limits.

Amenities:
In addition to the high-quality equipment, Gold‚Äôs Gym offers a variety of amenities that enhance your experience. From locker rooms with showers to group fitness classes that cater to all interests and skill levels, there‚Äôs something for everyone. The gym also features a smoothie bar where you can refuel after an intense workout.

Conclusion:
Overall, Gold's Gym in cairns city is a fantastic place to work on your fitness journey. With its prime parking, state-of-the-art equipment, and welcoming atmosphere, it has quickly become my go-to gym. Whether you're a seasoned athlete or just starting out, you‚Äôll find everything you need to succeed here. Highly recommend checking it out!

locations.title: QSC Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà358 Sheridan St, Cairns North QLD 4870

showerReviews.reviewText:
Smallest and most expensive gym I've been to, and I travel around the world as a tourist. I just needed to workout one time as I was passing thru Cairns, and booked this online. When I turned up, I realised that this gym is literally just a single room. It felt like someone's garage. There is no reception, no staff, no toilets, no changing rooms. I paid $22 for the privilege.

Edit: LOL! I see that the owner has written a butt-hurt rebuttal. Bro..... 1) I've reviewed gyms for 5+ years in cities that you've never even heard of - look at my review history. 2) you claim your gym has all sorts of facilities, but there is not a SINGLE photo on your web-site showing these -  maybe cos these exit only in your imagination. 3) I await a flurry of fake 5* reviews that you will now  create to counter my 1* review.

showerReviews.reviewText: A great place to visit and use free swimming  lagoon, barbecues, nice waterfront boardwalk. There are many restaurants, cafes and bars close by. There's a great kids playground with water park free to all. The beachfront is a bit ordinary when the tides out to expose the mudflats but this is a very important feeding and breeding grounds for all sorts of marine and bird life. A popular place for birdwatchers and can be good fishing when the tides in. Good prawn catches when they are running. YES, there are üêä Crocks about.

showerReviews.reviewText: I challenge anyone to find a better waterfront precinct in Australia. From Hemingway‚Äôs Brewery at the southern end to the fun ship playground in the North there‚Äôs more than 3km of top class facilities and parklands to explore. There‚Äôs three great playgrounds all unique, including muddy‚Äôs in the middle which is like a small kids theme park. Fantastic waterfront cafes like wharf one and muddy‚Äôs, a selection of great restaurants and bars. Heaps of fishing spots in the north and dedicated fishing wharves in the south. Very well appointed and sheltered BBQ areas scattered from one end to the other, as well as plenty of seating and picnic tables. There‚Äôs a very large free swimming pool in the shape of QLD. Exercise stations, a large well designed skate park, 1/2 a dozen tennis courts, beach volleyball courts. km‚Äôs of wide open park lands with shade trees , bike and walking tracks. A very well maintained, wide waterfront boardwalk runs the entire way with plenty of toilets facilities along the way.  The list goes on. It‚Äôs a very popular  spot with locals and tourists alike. Some half glass empty people might say ‚Äú what about the mud flats‚Äù. But it‚Äôs the mud flats give a world class waterfront precinct a world class migratory shore bird viewing area.
showerReviews.author: Jason Adams (Jase)

showerReviews.reviewText: BEWARE- If you are a G‚Äôday park member and want to book online, then use the G‚Äôday park site, to book through. DO NOT BOOK DIRECT THROUGH THE ACTUAL CRYSTAL CASCADES SITE.  As it does not say it is a G‚Äôday park. We booked through the actual park site, unaware they were a g‚Äôday park,   So we payed full price, there was no provision or indication that they were a member of g‚Äôday.  Upon looking up the park later to check facilities, I noticed it actually came up on the G‚Äôday park site, where the provision to put in your membership, was available, for the members price.  I explained this to the park, but they wouldn‚Äôt refund the difference as we had already made payment.  I have attached photos to explain what I mean.  In saying this, the park is nice, amenities clean and tidy, with a nice pool.  I found reception was a bit hit and miss in terms of opening hours.  Seemed to be all over the place.  It is about 25 minutes to cairns.  And is a nice quiet park.  We would stay again, but I will make sure I book through the correct site for the member discount next time.
showerReviews.author: Vicki Scott

showerReviews.reviewText:
We paid $62 per night for a drive through powered motorhome for 2 adults & 2 kids. Of the 6 caravan parks we stayed at during our 9 day trip, this was the most expensive, but the worst caravan park we stayed at (although this is not necessarily the fault of the park).

The location close to the centre of Cairns is convenient. The amenities are ok, and mostly clean. Our motorhome extension cord was not long enough to reach our power point, while still allowing us to get out of the van without hitting a bush, so it was great that we were able to borrow an extension cord from reception for the duration of our stay.

Bats nest in trees all over the park, but most of them are in a tree right above the camp kitchen. The stench is very strong. This is of course not the fault of the park, and the bats are actually awesome, and all over Cairns so it's to be expected, but is just something for guests to be aware of. I couldn't quite convince myself that it was the smell of the bats, not my food, when trying to eat haha.

The pool didn't seem to be clean, and made my kids' eyes very sore, so they weren't in for long & I didn't let them go back. It was also disconcerting to receive a text message from the park at 8:30pm about a large theft problem, reminding people to lock everything away. This would have been better to be told at check in.

This is a tricky one to rate, as it wasn't a bad stay, but wasn't overly enjoyable either.
showerReviews.author: Danielle Zimmermann

showerReviews.reviewText:
We paid $62 per night for a drive through powered motorhome for 2 adults & 2 kids. Of the 6 caravan parks we stayed at during our 9 day trip, this was the most expensive, but the worst caravan park we stayed at (although this is not necessarily the fault of the park).

The location close to the centre of Cairns is convenient. The amenities are ok, and mostly clean. Our motorhome extension cord was not long enough to reach our power point, while still allowing us to get out of the van without hitting a bush, so it was great that we were able to borrow an extension cord from reception for the duration of our stay.

Bats nest in trees all over the park, but most of them are in a tree right above the camp kitchen. The stench is very strong. This is of course not the fault of the park, and the bats are actually awesome, and all over Cairns so it's to be expected, but is just something for guests to be aware of. I couldn't quite convince myself that it was the smell of the bats, not my food, when trying to eat haha.

The pool didn't seem to be clean, and made my kids' eyes very sore, so they weren't in for long & I didn't let them go back. It was also disconcerting to receive a text message from the park at 8:30pm about a large theft problem, reminding people to lock everything away. This would have been better to be told at check in.

This is a tricky one to rate, as it wasn't a bad stay, but wasn't overly enjoyable either.
showerReviews.author: Danielle Zimmermann

My big issue with the place is the Bats very very noisy in the morning, but that's not really the parks fault. Bats will bat.

showerReviews.reviewText: This park is a conundrum to rate. It has the potential to be a beautiful park with the large trees, clean amenities and pleasant but simple pool area. It is quite central, a 10 min drive to most shopping and the foreshore. However the sites have been basically left unmaintained and some work is definitely needed - straggly long grass edged the slab and the rest of the site was weeds. And then there are the thefts - we had our bike locked but this was cut and stolen. And our neighbours also would have had theirs stolen too only they disturbed the thieves.  We were told after that this is a problem for this park. They do have a security man that goes thru the park but from what we witnessed this is a waste of time as a car driving around is no deterrent. The park did send a generic text message to say lock things up ( which we did) but it would have been more effective if the check in person had mentioned the issue on arrival and we would have left our bikes on our van.  Having said all this we never experienced any other issues and the park was really quiet.
showerReviews.author: Anne maree Quinlan

locations.title: Cairns Sunland Leisure Park
locations.address: ÓÉà49/61 Little Pease St, Manoora QLD 4870

showerReviews.reviewText:
It is what it is. For context, I had just moved up to Cairns for work, and needed a place to stay for a few weeks while found something long term. I just wanted something no-frills that was reasonably easy commute.

TL;DR: Cheap, mostly clean, poorly maintained. Lot of long term residents mostly OK, but you get some shouting/yelling. I didn't personally have any trouble. Area outside is really poor, pretty rough. Staff on the ground are decent, management seems apathetic.

The Good: They offer very well priced one week deals for cabins. Essentially at this price point you get a kitchenette cabin (no bathroom) to yourself for a price not much more than some backpacker dorms in town. On those terms, you can't fault it. It's a good price, and it's honest - that is what you get. The amenities blocks are clean and functional, and the showers have hot water and decent pressure. There's a laundry on-site accessible 24/7 and the washers are dryers both take card. $4 each for wash and dry. There's a shop in reception that sells the basics, including detergent sachets for the laundry. There's also a pool though I didn't try it so can't attest to the condition of it. Kitchenettes are suprisingly well appointed. You get a proper sized fridge-freezer (not those usual bar fridges with tiny freezer box) so you can get a load of meat and keep it in there. Kettle, toaster, plug in electric hob (bit shit tbqh - struggles to keep a good cast iron pot of pasta on the rolling boil), cutlery, cooking utensils, plates, bowels, mugs etc.

The Bad: The whole setup is very tired, and is showing it's age. Cabins look and feel early 80s. Mine had some dodgy floor sections. Furniture was old and tired. Clean enough but was in desperate need of a refresh. Air con did cool the cabin but was noisy. Little electric hob was very low qulaity. Rust on bed frames and even fridge door. The electrics shorted on my 2nd day. Reported to reception and caretaker twice. Caretaker got it on and we tested everything to locate the offending circuit (one of the lights), and he said he'd get some parts to fix, but despite him chasing managers a few times, it didn't get fixed during my stay (just didn't use the dodgy light). Bathroom block had a few toilets with missing locks or fittings that never seemed to get fixed. My cabin had a minor leak in severe rain.

The Ugly: Though there's an official rule of a max 28 day stay, it's clear as day a sizable number of people are de-facto tenants staying here permanently. Most are fine and decent people just trying to survive - by end of my 2nd week, we smiled and waved as we passed each other heading in and out (same with the staff), but there also a few shady figures and a few nights there was yelling and screaming. The area the park is in is at the cursed meeting point of the "Three Ms" suurbs, which are some of the poorest and most troubled suburbs in Cairns. The fence around the park has had barbed wire twisted around it, and that's no paranoia. There's a reason for it.  No one ever took anything from my car, not tried to get into my cabin. I only really once felt *unsafe* (two drunk people yelling in the laneway my cabin was on), but bascially, there are legitimate issues and the area outside is derro central.

Note on wifi: There's no wifi in the cabins. You can get it in reception, and there's a small seating area there. Good phone reception so I just tethered. There's a TV in the cabins with the usual channels
showerReviews.author: Syulang G

showerReviews.reviewText:
We are currently staying at Lake Placid Rainforest Retreat and I cannot speak highly enough of this park and its staff.

We first stayed here for a few nights on our way up to the cape. We were those disorganised travellers who arrive in town in peak season in the late afternoon with no accomodation booked. The staff in the park bent over backwards to move things around to fit us in.

This time around I was airlifted from cape York to cairns after experiencing a medical emergency. My mum had flown from Perth and my partner and friends needed a place to base themselves so they could be with me in hospital. Again, the staff went well out of their way to accomodate us. We have been here nearly 3 weeks this time and I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a nicer place to recover.

The staff have been so compassionate, generous and attentive.

The amenities cannot be faulted. There is a beautiful pool area with BBQs and a camp kitchen that is kept extremely clean.

The toilets and showers are beautifully clean with new upgrades to the showers.

My mum stayed in a bungalow cabin with all you need for a comfortable stay. Housekeeping was on point!

The park itself is lovely. Set below rainforest mountains across the road from a lovely running river. The caravan sites are grassy and spacious and gardens are kept beautifully. It even has a delightful little cafe that serves a mean smashed avo and great coffee!
With close access to shops, doctors and tourist attractions such as white water rafting, the skyrail, a scenic train through the mountains to the waterfalls and lovely walking trails it‚Äôs an ideal base to explore Cairns.

I honestly could not fault this place.

Thank you Lake Placid Rainforest Retreat ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π
showerReviews.author: Louisa Bauer

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fishery Falls Holiday Park is an EXCELLENT base to spend some time visiting various attractions or just chilling out. Shopping facilities are close by for those needing to stock up before hitting the road again.

Owned and run by Ann and Dave. They, and their staff, provide such a friendly service, clean facilities, beautiful shady or sunny sites, great laundry area and the camp kitchens are neat and tidy.

We had "the best seat in the house"! Dave located us right next to a beautiful garden with our own creek access. The sound of the birds and the flowing water was very relaxing. We intended staying for 3 nights and ended up staying for 13 nights. We would CERTAINLY  recommend a stay at Fishery Falls. We will be back. Thanks Ann, Dave and team.
Best regards Dee and Pete.
showerReviews.author: Peter Smith

showerReviews.reviewText: We can‚Äôt speak highly enough about the location, facilities and staff at NRMA Palm Cove. Firstly, Palm Cove is gorgeous and the main town is only a short walk away to everything you could need. My daughter is an ‚Äúamenities‚Äù queen and she was very impressed with the cleanliness, shower pressure and up to date facilities. But most importantly, the care and generosity of staff was unbelievable. Our little 3 year old man fell off his bike and broke his arm while we stayed. Paul and the beautiful ‚ÄúT‚Äù were so helpful and exceptionally caring. My husband wasn‚Äôt at the site when it happened, Paul helped with the ambulance call while I was with my son, and Tenielle helped my 6 year old daughter feel comfortable with colouring and even bringing down their daughter from upstairs to play with mine while the ambulance arrived and until my husband got there. Not only this, but they came and checked on us that afternoon and also gave both our son and daughter ‚Äúbrave‚Äù and ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù awards with a sweet Christmas lollie. They also gave us complimentary Powerade and water while we were navigating the ambulance in the aircon of their office. It was not what we were hoping for this part of the trip, but the genuine care and prompt response made us feel so well looked after at a home away from home. Thank you Paul, T, and the team at Palm Cove NRMA. Forever grateful.
showerReviews.author: Zara Howard

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would not recommend staying here. After checking in, we were told that guests are responsible for cleaning the apartment before departure, including taking out the bins and washing dishes (which felt unreasonable given the price we paid ($560AUD for 2 nights).

The check-in process was also inconvenient. Since we arrived after hours, we had to collect our key from a lockbox and then walk nearly 1km around to a different entrance just to access the complex.

Inside, the apartment was poorly maintained. Door handles were loose (I actually got stuck in the toilet), some switches didn‚Äôt work properly, and half the window shades on the balcony wouldn‚Äôt open. On top of that, as we carried luggage up the stairs, we were told by other residents to "be quiet," which made the stay feel unwelcoming. We got the same treatment coming down the stairs at 10am from another resident.

One of the biggest disappointments was the late check-out arrangement. Weeks in advance, I confirmed with staff that I could check out at 2pm (as I work from home). They assured me this would be fine so we booked the apartment. However, the day before check-out, we were told in an email they could no longer honor this and offered no solutions or alternative space for me to work. This created unnecessary stress and left a very poor impression of their customer service.

The only positives were the AC units & fans in the rooms and the outdoor area, the pools and palm trees are beautiful and well maintained (however a lot of construction around when we stayed) Unfortunately, that‚Äôs where the positives end.

Overall, while the exterior looks inviting, the service, apartment conditions, and lack of reliability from staff did not meet expectations. I would recommend looking elsewhere for accommodation that values its guests and delivers on its promises.
showerReviews.author: Shar Kra

showerReviews.reviewText:
BAD.BAD.BAD.
Room 1306.
We booked through a 3rd party. When we got there the underground parking is really hard to get in and out of with anything but a small car. The lift smelt terrible. Like wet dog and old food. The room its self also smelt bad. We had to go buy bicarb soda and place pots around the apartment to stop the smell. There are cockroaches! In our booking we paid for breakfast included, only to find that they no longer do this and if we wanted our money back we'd have to take it up with booking.com.
The washing machine didn't work. It just left our clothes soaking wet. We had to pay to go to a laundromat. The tv is NOT a smart tv. Its ancient. Some of the sockets in the kitchen dont work. There was also a sewerage smell in the bathroom when you flush the toilet. Don't waste your money here.

showerReviews.reviewText: What a fantastic free 72 hour campsite. Toilets and free cold showers, or $2 for 4 minutes of hot water. Facilities to wash dishes, a dump point and plenty of bins that are emptied daily. There are cctv cameras and the police regularly patrol through the campsite, so make sure you obey the rules, which are all very fair. There are some nice walks to do around the campsite and you can easily walk to the pubs and other services in Gordonvale, by following the concrete path across the creek at the back of the campsite. The hotels courtesy bus will also come and pick you up and take you back if you give them a ring. There is one small area next to the red topped bins which is day use only but plenty of campsites and even tents are well catered for. A very popular campsite and rightly so.
showerReviews.author: Henry Buttsworth

showerReviews.reviewText: What a fantastic free 72 hour campsite. Toilets and free cold showers, or $2 for 4 minutes of hot water. Facilities to wash dishes, a dump point and plenty of bins that are emptied daily. There are cctv cameras and the police regularly patrol through the campsite, so make sure you obey the rules, which are all very fair. There are some nice walks to do around the campsite and you can easily walk to the pubs and other services in Gordonvale, by following the concrete path across the creek at the back of the campsite. The hotels courtesy bus will also come and pick you up and take you back if you give them a ring. There is one small area next to the red topped bins which is day use only but plenty of campsites and even tents are well catered for. A very popular campsite and rightly so.
showerReviews.author: Henry Buttsworth

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location, walk to everything. Cheap secure parking which was a bonus being in the middle of the city. Huge kitchen with about 8 fridges, very well organised and plenty utensils, etc. Not a party hostel, we appreciated the quiet after 11pm.
We had a private room which was huge but weirdly had a small double bed and no wardrobe, there was nowhere to hang our clothes and nothing to sit on. Not even any hooks, you are not allowed to hang towels or anything on the railing outside, so where are you supposed to hang them up? Big blank walls, not one picture, felt rather prison like. You could fit a king bed, yet it's only a small double, our feet were touching the end. But it was clean, with nice towels provided.
Lovely pool and tropical feel outside. Overall, we recommend staying here.
showerReviews.author: Liza Carroll

showerReviews.reviewText:
Its not hard to say why Cairns YHA doesn't stand out. The bbq and some clothes dryers needed work and the one remaining room locker door hung sadly on a hinge. Surely it wouldn't have been too hard to have at least one stool or chair in our room?
The kitchen was fine though, as were the food storage lockers.  Arriving after hours left me in the street due to faulty key card storage module(s) but the night clerk was efficient. In fact she was worth five stars.

showerReviews.reviewText: Does what it says on the tin for a few nights and comfy beds guarantee a good sleep. Would definitely benefit from a reception that is open more hours. Also another sink in the kitchen, tea towels and more storage would be good, particularly fridges, as me and my boyfriend found the spaces we had to store our food there very small and crammed with other bags. The free pasta, rice etc was great though, an appreciated benefit.

locations.title: Mad Monkey Jungle
locations.address: ÓÉà117 Grafton St, Cairns City QLD 4870

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is going to be a long review so I'm just gonna start with the positive aspects.
The hostel location is very nice it's right in the town centre and you can reach everything in just a few minutes. The Hostel itself is mostly clean and the staff at the front desk are really helpful and friendly. Coming to the negative aspects. The hostel is a social/party hostel which in itself is not bad if that is your thing. Just be aware that it's never really quiet. The main problem I had during my stay were the people. I had a 10 bedroom dorm (which was fully booked) and I could not sleep one night because people were so loud during the night for example: playing music on the balcony at 1:00 AM, walking into the room and turning the light on and leaving it on, going into the bathroom that is connected to the room and puking, coughing or cleaning the dishes (dishes with food that of course attracted insects)in the bathroom sink without closing the door, people having sex in the hostel room during the night (there are no curtains on the bed so you are subjected to everything), having random people come into the room and stay the night, people slamming doors in the building and constantly screaming during night. The hostel kitchen was really dirty and you had to constantly wash the dishes before using them because no one cleaned their dishes properly or left them soaking wet and just put them on the shelf (they have signs there telling you do clean after yourself but everyone just ignored them). A lot of the ovens also didn't work which made baking stuff very difficult because the ones that did work were in constant use. What also happened a couple of times is that food got stolen out of the boxes that are used to store your food which is really annoying and disrespectful.
Needless to say I did not enjoy my stay at this hostel and would not recommend it to anyone who needs to rest sometimes because you won't get any.
showerReviews.author: Alisha 0206

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is going to be a long review so I'm just gonna start with the positive aspects.
The hostel location is very nice it's right in the town centre and you can reach everything in just a few minutes. The Hostel itself is mostly clean and the staff at the front desk are really helpful and friendly. Coming to the negative aspects. The hostel is a social/party hostel which in itself is not bad if that is your thing. Just be aware that it's never really quiet. The main problem I had during my stay were the people. I had a 10 bedroom dorm (which was fully booked) and I could not sleep one night because people were so loud during the night for example: playing music on the balcony at 1:00 AM, walking into the room and turning the light on and leaving it on, going into the bathroom that is connected to the room and puking, coughing or cleaning the dishes (dishes with food that of course attracted insects)in the bathroom sink without closing the door, people having sex in the hostel room during the night (there are no curtains on the bed so you are subjected to everything), having random people come into the room and stay the night, people slamming doors in the building and constantly screaming during night. The hostel kitchen was really dirty and you had to constantly wash the dishes before using them because no one cleaned their dishes properly or left them soaking wet and just put them on the shelf (they have signs there telling you do clean after yourself but everyone just ignored them). A lot of the ovens also didn't work which made baking stuff very difficult because the ones that did work were in constant use. What also happened a couple of times is that food got stolen out of the boxes that are used to store your food which is really annoying and disrespectful.
Needless to say I did not enjoy my stay at this hostel and would not recommend it to anyone who needs to rest sometimes because you won't get any.
showerReviews.author: Alisha 0206

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Strand Rockpool is such an interesting location along Townsville‚Äôs stunning foreshore. This man-made, stinger-resistant seawater lagoon offers a safe and refreshing swimming experience, making it an ideal spot for families. Both my children have been a little scared of the idea of stingers since we've been in Queensland but they both found the water easy to access and had heaps of fun during the stop.

What sets this spot apart is its thoughtful design and accessibility. I cant believe the Rockpool is free, it also is equipped with facilities like toilets, outdoor showers, and nearby barbecue and picnic areas. Plus, its proximity to local eateries means you can easily grab a refreshing drink or meal after your swim.

I would love to go back when the weathers warmer and the bar overlooking the water is open.
showerReviews.author: Michael Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is my local pool that I use regularly. The pool is fantastic and heated to just the right temperature to be used year round. The sheltered pool is great for kids and nice and warm in winter.

The way the pool is managed can be frustrating as it is frequently closed without warning, or opening hours will change. I've had swims interrupted due to the pool closing, which I wasn't told about when I started my swim. It's also a popular pool for school swimming events, which will close the pool to the public.

The pool is 50m but can be converted to a 25m pool. This can happen without warning. I, again, have had the pool change from 50m to 25m in the middle of a swim, which can be frustrating.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Glover

showerReviews.reviewText:
Highly recommend Seahorse Aquatic Centre to teach your kids to swim. The whole team are friendly, inviting, and engaging with both the children and parents. The facilities are great and perfect for those with multiple kids as there is a fence around the pool, meaning the kids that aren't swimming are safe from the water when you are in the pool. The lessons are fantastic with fun songs or games throughout the lesson with a focus on water safety at all times. The instructors regularly explain why they are teaching what they are teaching and provide feedback regularly.

I have always loved our lessons at Seahorse Aquatic Centre. However, due to relocating interstate, I had to find another swim school, and this has shown me just how amazing the team is.

Special shout out to Aline and Lauren for being awesome instructors!
showerReviews.author: Natacha REILLY
