locations.address: ÓÉàSir Leslie Thiess Dr, Townsville City QLD 4810

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Terrible service!!!! Went out all day and room was not serviced. Called reception and they told us the do not disturb was on the door - it was not - the clean my room was on. Told us they would send someone straight up. Went to the pool for 1.5 hours. No towels - went up to reception to ask for a towel, they said ask at the pool. Asked at the pool, they seemed uninterested and said it would be refilled eventually. After 1.5 hours in the pool, no towels arrived, so had to catch the lift back up to the room dripping wet. Get back to the room and of course had not been serviced. So we just got a couple of towels off someone close by. Then didn‚Äôt really want to face anyone else so just ordered room service. Tasted pretty awful and cost $250 for the family! The cr√®me br√ªl√©e  had a really weird taste, like it was full of alcohol (not mentioned on the menu). Both my wife and I were up all night sitting on the toilet, so in guessing something was wrong with it! Did win $300 at the casino, so I guess that‚Äôs something, but I‚Äôve never stayed at a casino with such terrible service! Usually with all the money they make the service is excellent. This is the second time we‚Äôve stayed here in a month and last time they also didn‚Äôt service the room! Gave them a second chance, but will not be back!

We truly appreciated our time and will be back again and again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Rackley Swimming has a particularly aggressive and abusive male individual in their employ. In our recent visit, he was swearing in childrens faces and making them cry, patrolling as if he was a beat cop and generally making our visit uncomfortable and unpleasant.

I will be submitting a formal complaint post this review and highly reccomend that the invividual concerned (He has also recieved verbal complaints by other patrons so the person should be known.) have a good hard look at himself and question if working with children is an appropriate role if he is unable to control his attitude in a child heavy industry.

Cowardly behaviour.

On a positive note, every time we've visited the facilities, they have been well kept and staffed sufficiently.

showerReviews.reviewText: A great place for a swim or to take the kids. They have 2 small waterslides which the kids loved and a great toddlers pool. There is also a closed in pool with seating on the sides.The big pool is pretty impressive. Having recently had a refurbishment the main pool has a ramp, stairs and plenty of shade sales to keep you cool. Lots of shade for seating for families with change rooms with showers and a tuckshop. $3 for kids entry and $5 for adults. They will charge you for entry even if you are not swimming. Overall a great facility and it makes another place that you can take the kids.
showerReviews.author: David Fogwill

showerReviews.reviewText: Don't have kids birthday parties here, go elsewhere. This place is disorganised, poorly run, and poorly maintained swimming pool. We planned a birthday weeks in advance, half a day before the party the slides we closed due to preventable maintenance and water quality. We were told we could reschedule, or they could setup an inflatable in the large pool. Party was to start at 0900. Were told that the inflatable wouldn't be setup till 1000. Paid to have a bbq, this was left filthy and not cleaned. Again, if you're thinking of have an event here, don't!

The staff is INCREDIBLY friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to offer assistance or answer questions. The atmosphere is motivating and welcoming, with a diverse range of members of all fitness levels, making it a comfortable place to train.

locations.title: Hammer Athletic
locations.address: ÓÉà659-661 Flinders St, Townsville City QLD 4810

showerReviews.reviewText:
Completely satisfied with my body transformation, my fitness improvement and the sense of community at this gym.

This is my first non-franchised gym, and I have been a member of this gym for over two years.

The trainers are knowledgeable, and will push you while keeping an eye on you for correct form. I attend the Strength sessions the most, and the Strength program has a new direction every few months; I ask questions about the benefits of each program, and I used to ask a lot of questions and request reaffirmation on the correct technique/form for each exercise.. it is great to not receive wishy washy answers.

I started my journey with a skinny physique, and I am a lot stronger and faster . I used to only do one exercise - running - but the gym has helped me to improve my fitness significantly, that I am able to do and enjoy other sports.

The community is great. Members attend regularly, are friendly, and I become acquainted with them over time. The trainers often crack jokes, and they usually remember the stuff that I mentioned in conversations, whether it is fitness related or not.

I would recommend this place to others.
showerReviews.author: Caleb

showerReviews.reviewText: Balgal Beach camp ground is small. It only accommodates about 8 to 10 camping bays. It is a beautiful location close to the beach and the mouth of the river. It has toilets but no showers. It is a free camp site but you have to book with the shire. There are shelters in the park with tables, chairs, and BBQ facilities.  But the midges are terrible so you need to protect yourself.

showerReviews.reviewText: Small and compact camp area with some sites under low hanging trees. Bigger rigs may have issues reverseing into sites, will depend on who is already camped. Nice playgrounds and BBQ facilities in park. Decent toilet facilities very close. Beach was closed and stinger net not deployed. Local fisho said there was a 3m croc in the creek, although not seen at time of posting. Was able to get normal TV reception and internet, although a tad slow. There is a bar/Cafe across the road. Beach is long with lots of washed up coral and shells, making it quite a gritty and coarse sand. Pretty good for a zero cost overnight stay, but wouldn't go out of way to return.
showerReviews.author: Peter Rigby

showerReviews.reviewText:
Receptionist was friendly and welcoming. That was the only positive. While I understand what you pay is what you get, we did have an affordable economy cabin for 1 night. It was the only accomodation left in Townsville for the Footy Game so it was nice to be accommodated for during a period of high occupancy. Upon check in we did overhear that they are fully booked as to why we didn‚Äôt come to the desk and report the issues. However I think despite what you are paying whether it‚Äôs a cheap rate or a high, standards should have been higher. It was clear the room wasn‚Äôt or was poorly inspected prior our check in. The aircon cover cover was hanging off and we were hit with a strong smell of mildew and mold. The sheets were covered in marks whilst I understand myself working in hotel industry, rejects are common in linen orders. It really made me question the way both sheets were marked and not replaced with a clean one. When I made the bed I discovered that the fleece blankets had multiple grubby marks and stains on them. The sheets were fine for 1 night.

However upon looking just casually around the room the walls were filthy and covered in stains. Something that would be very obvious to spot clean. The moldy aircon, marked sheets and dirty walls certainly made the cabin feel even more dirty and uncomfortable. The dated kitchen and other items are not an issue as we didn‚Äôt really care and understand. The air con made a noisy rattling sound all night, the mattresses did not have mattress protectors either. It was quite possibly the worst sleep I‚Äôve ever had. I also suffer from an auto-immune disease and if I were staying more than 1 night I certainly would have to leave.

The public amenities were quite unkept and very dirty, whilst we also understand this is a public area and couldn‚Äôt not be cleaned every hour of every day. It felt dirty enough that I did not want to step back inside.

We thank the staff for their friendliness and being able to accomodate us and hope some changes in the cleanliness of cabin 12 can be made for future guests.

Can‚Äôt say we would return but would recommend booking a higher rate room for your stay.
showerReviews.author: Danica Carson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Receptionist was friendly and welcoming. That was the only positive. While I understand what you pay is what you get, we did have an affordable economy cabin for 1 night. It was the only accomodation left in Townsville for the Footy Game so it was nice to be accommodated for during a period of high occupancy. Upon check in we did overhear that they are fully booked as to why we didn‚Äôt come to the desk and report the issues. However I think despite what you are paying whether it‚Äôs a cheap rate or a high, standards should have been higher. It was clear the room wasn‚Äôt or was poorly inspected prior our check in. The aircon cover cover was hanging off and we were hit with a strong smell of mildew and mold. The sheets were covered in marks whilst I understand myself working in hotel industry, rejects are common in linen orders. It really made me question the way both sheets were marked and not replaced with a clean one. When I made the bed I discovered that the fleece blankets had multiple grubby marks and stains on them. The sheets were fine for 1 night.

However upon looking just casually around the room the walls were filthy and covered in stains. Something that would be very obvious to spot clean. The moldy aircon, marked sheets and dirty walls certainly made the cabin feel even more dirty and uncomfortable. The dated kitchen and other items are not an issue as we didn‚Äôt really care and understand. The air con made a noisy rattling sound all night, the mattresses did not have mattress protectors either. It was quite possibly the worst sleep I‚Äôve ever had. I also suffer from an auto-immune disease and if I were staying more than 1 night I certainly would have to leave.

The public amenities were quite unkept and very dirty, whilst we also understand this is a public area and couldn‚Äôt not be cleaned every hour of every day. It felt dirty enough that I did not want to step back inside.

We thank the staff for their friendliness and being able to accomodate us and hope some changes in the cleanliness of cabin 12 can be made for future guests.

Can‚Äôt say we would return but would recommend booking a higher rate room for your stay.
showerReviews.author: Danica Carson

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed in the deluxe 2 Brm cabin. The state of the cabin was dreadful. The floors were filthy. The shower was so mouldy, the grout was disgusting and someone else‚Äôs hair present. Hole in the bedroom wall, the windows and sills were so dirty and dusty thick with grime. The mop and bucket provided smelt putrid and the mop was broken and the bucket filthy. Room where the bunks were, the walls were absolutely filthy, grimy and stained. Stains from unknown substances remained all down the walls. The fan in the bathroom made a horrendous noise and the aircons didn‚Äôt work efficiently and rattled all night. Plus the pool had been drained. I expressed my concerns at a staff member upon leaving and all she said was have a good trip home. What a terrible place to stay.
showerReviews.author: Sharee Beil

showerReviews.reviewText:
Townsville Lakes Holiday Park is a comfortable and convenient accommodation option for anyone visiting Townsville, whether for a short break, a family holiday, or an extended stay. The park offers a wide range of choices, from powered caravan and camping sites to self-contained cabins, making it suitable for all types of travelers. The cabins are simple yet clean and well-equipped with the essentials, and the outdoor sites provide plenty of space for caravans and tents.

One of the standout features of the park is its peaceful atmosphere. Despite being close to the city and major roads, it has a relaxed, laid-back feel with leafy surroundings and shaded areas that give you a break from the bustle of town. The swimming pool is a great addition, especially in the warmer months, and there are BBQ facilities available for families or groups who enjoy cooking outdoors.

The location is another positive‚Äîit‚Äôs not far from the city centre, making it easy to access shops, restaurants, and Townsville‚Äôs main attractions such as The Strand, Castle Hill, and local wildlife parks. Staff are generally friendly and helpful, ensuring guests feel welcome.

While the park is well-maintained overall, some of the facilities are a little dated and could benefit from upgrades, particularly the bathrooms and communal areas. However, for the price and the convenience offered, Townsville Lakes Holiday Park represents very good value. It‚Äôs a reliable choice for families, couples, and solo travelers
showerReviews.author: Nawid Noori

showerReviews.reviewText:
Feedback About Our Recent Stay at Tasman Holiday Park Townsville

We recently stayed on a Small Powered Campervan Site with our small dogs and overall had a very pleasant experience. The site itself was great and well-suited to our needs.

However, the toilet and shower block could benefit from some improvements. A new epoxy floor coating would greatly enhance hygiene, and several of the door locks and handles need attention. A fresh coat of paint would also help give the facilities a cleaner, more inviting appearance.

We also booked a Standard Cabin, and unfortunately this part of our stay was disappointing. The cabin was not clean and the air-conditioner was extremely loud, resulting in very little sleep for my wife and the kids. Considering the condition of the cabin, we felt the price was far too high for the standard provided.

We hope this feedback is helpful, as we would love to see these issues addressed for future guests.
showerReviews.author: Oskar Krobath

The guys at the front desk when we arrived are absolutely lovely and welcoming, more than happy to answer my random questions and have a laugh.
All the staff here are amazing, happy to help and nothing is ever a drama, the team are always around cleaning the park, amenities  were immaculate as was the pool and BBQ areas.
There is a well equipped little convenience shop  located at the office.

Amazing park, Amazing location and an Amazing team.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed 5 nights in a tent in this campsite and we had food and drinks stolen 2 nights in a row. A couple was forced into their motorhome during the night. The lady at the reception told me that it was surely homeless ppl who venture into the kitchens at night. There is CLEARLY a lack of security in this campsite.
The fridge is filled to the bord, difficult to find a place. However, the kitchen is very good, equipped with air conditioning, a TV, an oven, hobs and very clean. The showers were not really clean more precisely the floor of the showers but it was fine. A little unpleasant smell in the evening, we don't know what.
showerReviews.author: Maya Zewdu

showerReviews.reviewText:
It was a very bad experience.
I thought the price was very expensive for what they offer. The price varies depending on the day, and even they aren't clear about how much it costs.
The man at reception was very rude and even disrespectful.

The bathrooms were a disaster, usually dirty, and there was no hot water in the showers. They have very large bathrooms with many showers, but they are unusable because the water is cold. This didn't just happen to me; from shower to shower, we guests asked each other if we had hot water, and at different times of the day. I went at midday, in the afternoon and at night, and it was always the same problem. The only bathroom with hot water is the one next to the pool. It's the smallest and most neglected.
The toilet paper is of very poor quality.

The covered kitchen was generally dirty and full of flies. It is very small for the number of guests it has, and the refrigerator they have is not big enough; it does not even reach the temperature it should for the amount of food it holds. They should definitely add another refrigerator.
I have even had food go missing that I left in the refrigerator.
We have found people sleeping on the sofas in the kitchen.

The other outdoor kitchen is full of mosquitoes, and I had a terrible time. I had dinner there one night and woke up the next day covered in bites. They should fumigate more often or find a solution so that guests don't have this problem.

The place has poor security. The entrance gate hardly ever worked.

The site without electricity that they gave us was very uneven, it wasn't level, which made it very uncomfortable to be in a tent.

The water in the pool was very cold. You can't enjoy it.

The only good thing about it is the location.
showerReviews.author: Jesica Agostinelli

locations.title: BIG4 Eco Resort Townsville
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Muntalunga Dr, Townsville City QLD 4816

showerReviews.reviewText:
We loved our 2-night stay here! The bathrooms and showers were excellent, the facilities spotless, and the location very convenient. On our first night, our site was right next to the camp kitchen, which did get a bit noisy late into the evening. We asked if we could be moved for the second night, and the staff were more than happy to accommodate us‚Äîwhich we really appreciated!

The grounds are very well maintained, with one of the cleanest pool areas we‚Äôve seen on our trip. The hot tub was also a highlight! The camp kitchen stayed clean throughout our stay, and the park felt really secure with coded gate access.

The location is perfect for catching the ferry to Magnetic Island, and we even spotted turtles in the lake and wallabies in the park. Couldn‚Äôt recommend this place more!
showerReviews.author: Jennifer Gallagher

Look the pool was lovely and the actual site itself isn‚Äôt terrible but the amenities and camp kitchen were not maintained the whole time we were there. showerReviews.reviewText:
My suggestion would be to keep driving and find another accommodation. The camp grounds seemed adequate but if you're wanting a cabin I wouldn't advise booking here. I could've overlooked the the age and general disrepair of the cabin, but the cleanliness was also lacking.
Floor was dirty and sticky, and I even stood on small sharp objects in the dark in the middle of the night.
Strong sewerage smell coming from bathroom taps and shower.
Broken boom gate also left me with security concerns which did not aid my sleep. Neither did the old squeaky metal bedframe.
At $170/night it was definitely a let down, I wish I had kept going further into the city to find better accommodation.
showerReviews.author: Emily Naylor

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good value for money caravan park.  Generous sized sites.
Facilities are a bit tired but plenty of hot water and good pressure.  Big shopping centre just 5 minutes away in the car and town centre can be reached in just over 10 minutes.  Some sites are rather too close to the Bruce Highway and would be noisy but we were well away.  Staff are friendly and helpful and a big effort is made to keep sites green even during extended dry periods.  This is Townsville, so keeping the car and van secure, especially at night, is a must.  However, plenty of things to do and see around Townsville.
showerReviews.author: Kevin Walker

showerReviews.reviewText:
My hubby & I really enjoyed our stay here!

Thanks Rob & Jen for making us feel so welcome & being available to attend to any of our requests.   Whilst the rooms are a little tired they are so sooo clean & have everything you need including a well equipped kitchenette ( for those who want to cook ), fulfilled our needs perfectly & the location is close to cafes & restaurants, the Maggie Brewery & the bus stop is just around the corner ( 100 mts from the entrance ).  There is access to a lovely onsite swimming pool, BBQ area ( used this a few times ) & laundry with coin operated machine.   Made friends with some lovely guests who stay here every year for a couple of months.

locations.address: ÓÉà40371 Bruce Hwy, Deeragun QLD 4818

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful caravan park. We paid $42 for a powered drive through powered site. I booked over the phone on our way, and was sent all details via email immediately, to allow a smooth after-hours check in. We enjoyed the pool in the morning before we left, but didn't have time to play mini golf, although saw others enjoying the course. The bbq and camp kitchen area was clean and tidy, with everything we needed.

Half of the shower block was closed as they were replacing hot water systems on the other half. Unfortunately, the chippy didn't check to make sure no one was using the showers before turning off the water. After walking out in a towel, covered in shampoo and soap suds, I laughed it off after scaring one of the other workers to ask how long it would be off. The shower amenities themselves are great. They ensuite style layout is really good, with plenty of space and everything you need, cleaned and well maintained.
showerReviews.author: Danielle Zimmermann

showerReviews.reviewText: The park is huge with spacey powered sites, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The park has lots to offer. Swimming pools, mini putt putt, water parks with slides, outdoor cinema. The only issue I had was being placed near the septic outlets. I highly recommend you look into this outlet's and not placing anyone near them. They are a little smelly. But as a park, it was well maintained. I do recommend, just ask not to be near the smelly outlets.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recently stayed 4 nights at the resort, over all it was generally a good experience however we felt a few amenities were lacking.

The pool was relatively dirty most days and having the orange construction signs up around the place left it feeling tacky - the gym was not available to use, the restaurant was closed, the bar only open at limited hours and the breakfast was very basic.

The room was very comfortable however and we did like having a small balcony to sit on. It is a good place for families with young children however we would not stay again.

The room was very comfortable however and we did like having a small balcony to sit on. It is a good place for families with young children however we would not stay again.
showerReviews.author: Is Coops

locations.title: Aquarius on The Beach
locations.address: ÓÉà75 The Strand, North Ward QLD 4810

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location and large rooms makes this stay the perfect stay.  However there is so much more potential for this place to have a better rating.

Carpets were dirty and had nasty spots everywhere.  Instead of dish soap, I was given laundry detergent, even though there's no laundry machine for the room I booked.

Elevators were broken right after check in.  Called front desk about 4 times using their phone to let them know but nobody picked up so I just assumed they were really busy.  Walked down the stairs to reception only to find the reception just chillin.  Not sure if the phone in the room even worked.

The phone was filthy.  Dusty and sticky.  Kitchen knives were not washed properly and there was food bits scattered in the drawers.

Overall, so much potential but needs better management and leadership to make the stay comfortable and clean
showerReviews.author: T Duong

locations.title: Civic Guest House Backpackers Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà262 Walker St, Townsville City QLD 4810

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed at Civic Guest House for 5 nights with my son when we travelled in Townsville. I would highly recommend it for a budget traveller. Rooms were clean when we arrived and shared shower and toilet were kept clean. The kitchen was clean and well presented. The staff did a great job in keeping on top of cleanliness in the kitchen. As a backpackers the majority of other guests are polite and considerate. It is not a party destination backpackers. We were both happy and comfortable with the accommodation. The only thing be aware of is that the building is old and there is no insulation so noise travels. You can hear people if they are a bit noisy. Most of the time this was not an issue as I found most guests considerate. I would stay again if in Townsville.
showerReviews.author: Greg Keith

showerReviews.reviewText: I was seriously surprised by how great this hostel was, especially considering the price. I stayed in a seven bed dorm for two nights and very much enjoyed my stay. The dorm itself featured and own bathroom (toilet and showers which was very handy) as well as two fridges to store food. It was all quite clean and comfortable. You can tell someone actually puts some thought into designing and equipping the place, as it has a water fountain to fill up you bottle, a separate fridge if you check out late and want to store food, and an efficient stove which warms up quickly. I very much enjoyed my stay here and can definitely recommend it, especially considering the price one pays. Location wise it is also well located only a short walk to the CBD and on the foot of Castle Hill.
showerReviews.author: Jeremy

showerReviews.reviewText: I didn't have the best experience at this hostel...the rooms are extremely overpriced for what they are. They are basically an expensive shack with air conditioning & rusty bunkbeds üòÖ I was incredibly annoyed that when I had to extend my stay because I felt ill & couldn't travel to Cairns, Pascal was really rude & so unhelpful & charged me loads more for the next two nights because apparently the hostel was busier but it was during the week & not even the weekend! So i had no choice than to pay an extortionate price & have to swap rooms each day! The kitchen is tiny & the toilets & shower are dirty & everything is old here. Some of the staff were nice & helful & the view of the beach is nice but I much prefer Airlie beach Nomads & other Nomads I've stayed in in Australia & New Zealand. Staff are usually much nicer & extend stays for a reasonable price & facilities etc are better. The food at the hostel is very expensive & so are the drinks & they don't let anyone take their own alcohol in & they even charge guests for bingo & events there that should be free!! One of the worst backpackers i have stayed in so far & I've travelled up the entire East coast now & travelled New Zealand for 8 months before coming to Australia. It's not the staffs fault that it's run down, the company don't put enough money into this hostel
showerReviews.author: Rachel manya Cassini

Unfortunately we only stayed a month as job circumstances changed! However we will be back there for SURE whenever we pass through!!!
I didn‚Äôt get to try the mangos :( as we stayed in May. There are orange trees, herbs, tangerines and kumquats.
The house is at the base of castle hill, which provides a really nice safe feeling but the sun does shine down all day making the gardens beautiful to spend the day in! There is a free BBQ, toilet roll, washing up supplies. The cookers ARE induction so just beware of that. ALSO... if you are a none smoker, do say at the start for your room to be far from the communal smoking area (our room backed onto this area so we had that unpleasantness)
It‚Äôs SUPER CLEAN!
Bev the ‚Äòhouse organiser‚Äô is a super gentle kind loving lady.
Jane is hilarious, if you have the pleasure of getting to know her!
Give Momma Donna a hug from Nick and Emma if you do stay there too! :)
XXXXX

locations.title: Yongala Lodge by The Strand
locations.address: ÓÉà11 Fryer St, North Ward QLD 4810

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment I rang Yongala lodge to book my stay I felt like this place was going to be awesome from the positive warmth in Nicole's voice and I was not wrong.

The rooms are old fashioned but very comfortable, the service from Nicole who runs the place is 10/10.  She is friendly and has helped me out big time. It is awesome that you can have your pets here and is a god send in an accommodation world that is extremely anti-animals. The bed I had here is the comfiest I have slept in since my month long journey began and the rooms are very clean.  There is a pool for a swim and a laundry to wash your clothes. The old building at the front is beautiful and the hotel itself is situated within crawling distance to the "strand", a beach front precinct with parks, restaurants and of course plenty of sand. For a dog owner this is just awesome as I can just take my dogs for a walk in a nice spot at anytime.
The prices for the rooms are very reasonable and it seems very friendly people stay here unlike some other dodgy places I have stayed along the way! The only thing you need to be aware of is to take your key with you every time you leave the room as you cannot leave your room unlocked if you close the door...you do not want to get caught outside in your jocks and have to wake Nicole up to get you back in! All in all I enjoyed my stay here and want to stay longer. I highly recommend this place.
showerReviews.author: Ben Tree specialist

showerReviews.reviewText:
A wonderful  hotel with good prices and in a great location. We showed up past the hours of reception looking for a room after an issue with the hotel we were supposed to be staying in that night, and the gentlemen who helped me was very kind. A historic building and the rooms and furniture represent that, a hotel with some charm. The rooms aren‚Äôt anything special but they have super neat and comfortable beds  that you won‚Äôt see in many other hotels and the bedroom and bathroom are both are extremely spacious. Some might say that the style of the room could be a bit outdated but for a building like this it‚Äôs very fitting.  The rooms are also extremely clean, and have great aircon.

The one and only issue we had with the room was the pressure in the shower head was very harsh, but other than that not a single complaint.
showerReviews.author: Jillian Salwach

I was saying yum with every bite, no need to eat for the rest of the week now lol. Much better than a lot of cafes I‚Äôve been to, not just the size but the taste moisture quality texture yummm!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stopped for one night at this service station to sleep and take a shower. It‚Äôs actually a really useful and nice place, if it weren‚Äôt for the huge number of people sleeping in rooftop tents and taking up two parking spots (it is clearly forbidden to camp in rooftop tents in that area). Because of that, I had a hard time finding parking.

I still had a peaceful night, but in the morning I decided to take a shower, paying $5. The lady who served me wasn‚Äôt very polite‚Äîshe asked me to leave my phone with her and said I only had 15 minutes. Basically, I didn‚Äôt even have time to use the toilet, brush my teeth, and dry my hair. I just managed to take the shower, dry off quickly, and change clothes, and the 15 minutes were already over. The lady was very rude to me.

In the end, I had to go use the free toilet, where there are only two very dirty and damaged stalls. I had to wait 10 minutes for someone to come out, and then brush my teeth in a sink that hadn‚Äôt been cleaned in at least a week.

Worst experience I‚Äôve ever had in a service station.
showerReviews.author: Emanuele Caputo

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pretty great stop for trucks&campervans!

There are toilets (free) and showers (5$) inside the BP and they are really clean, 10/10!! *note that I only used the toilets but showers must be good too. There is also free Wifi inside the BP which is both a convenience store and a little sit down restaurant! And yes it is still open between 10pm-5pm, it‚Äôs just that there is only 1 door opened out of 3.

The overnight spot for campervans&caravans is separated from the one for the trucks which makes it more peaceful! There isn‚Äôt so much space and privacy though because the spots are close to one another. Note that there are also some rules to follow on site because, as they indicate, this isn‚Äôt a camping site: can‚Äôt cook in parking lot, can‚Äôt use fire, can‚Äôt wash dishes in the toilet‚Äôs sinks, can‚Äôt air out your laundry around outside, max 1 (or 2?) night stay, etc‚Ä¶. Think they just don‚Äôt want you to turn this place into your home;)

Overall clean and useful place to sleep&eat for a night!
showerReviews.author: Esp√©ranza Lalonde

locations.title: EMF Fitness Centre Surfers Paradise
locations.address: ÓÉà3184 Surfers Paradise Blvd, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is not an emf, at least it's not the same standard of gym. Granted it's in a great location, but this is truly a hotel gym with an EMF label. It's just not EMF material. The equipment is ancient, the treadmills are plonked right in the rising suns path so your morning run is literally a morning run as in you can't see anything because you're being blinded for 20 minutes, it's crowded and small, the showers don't have enough room for a duffle bag, and the changing area seats a total of two people when you add their belongings to the mix. There's only 2 hours parking which means your workout has to be 1.75 hours long, otherwise you have to pay another $5 on top of your already 26/week.

Not the EMF standard, not at all. The best part of the whole experience is the end team member, who tried to make this sardine can of a gym look as good as she could, and she did a great job with her customer service. But after seeing all the other gyms, it simply doesn't match the norm.
showerReviews.author: Raphael Stephan

locations.title: Q1 Gold Coast - Resort And Spa
locations.address: ÓÉà9 Hamilton Ave, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our stay was extremely disappointing and did not meet the expectations of a 4-star hotel.

When we arrived, the room was not clean. There was visible hair in the bathroom. When we asked about daily room cleaning, we were told that housekeeping comes at an additional cost. We were also informed that we are expected to empty our own rubbish bins and take the trash to the end of the corridor ourselves. This feels more like an Airbnb setup than a hotel.

When I raised this concern and mentioned that this does not align with a 4-star hotel experience, the response was simply ‚Äúthat‚Äôs how we operate.‚Äù

The elevators were another major issue. Only two elevators were working, and we waited up to 20 minutes on multiple occasions.

Basic amenities were lacking. Cutlery and glasses provided in the room were dirty. There were no toothbrushes/toothpaste available, and not even a glass in the bathroom to place toothbrushes or toothpaste.

Overall, the staff were not helpful, and there was no sense of service or hospitality you would expect from a 4- or 5-star hotel. I would not recommend staying here, as there are far better options available for the price. Very disappointing experience.
showerReviews.author: Samil

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed here for our family holiday, location was perfect and staff were very helpful and attentive during our stay, however we felt that for a 4.5 star property the rooms were not quite up to scratch. The views were beautiful and the apartments spacious but the bedding was below average and you‚Äôd probably find better in a 3 star property. Sheets of poor quality and barely fitted the beds and blankets were worn and had holes all through them. We had a rollaway for our teenage son and it was so uncomfortable he ended up on the floor as no other alternative.
Cost cutting was obvious throughout the room with limited supplies like dishwashing liquid/ extra teabags etc having to be paid for and the scourer to was dishes been cut in half. Extra tea towels etc also came at a charge. We were there for 5 days so amenities should have been given to accommodate this without extra charges. Utensils in room were very worn, tongs etc didn‚Äôt work and knives were blunt. Not even a chopping board was provided.
Toilet seat and showerheads in bathroom broken/loose and wouldn‚Äôt stay in place properly.
Lifts were a pain as under maintenance but would hope this was a short term issue.
For a supposed 4.5 star property and the price we expected more and felt that these little things and the obvious penny pinching really let the property down.
Not sure I would recommend this property if you are looking for luxury accommodation.
showerReviews.author: Vanessa & David Kirkman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Q1 resort and spa, in exquisite Gold Coast! We spend 4 days here and loved our time at this beautiful hotel.
We booked an ocean view one bedroom apartment and were upgraded to two bedrooms, it was huge like a 1000 sq feet, including a large living room ,kitchen ,2 dining rooms, 4 piece bathroom and two bedrooms.
Two zones of climate control, dishwasher, laundry and dryer, a safe,and full kitchen along with all cutlaries, pots and pans,dishes, tea coffee,sugar,milk, salt and pepper! Dish washer soap and laundry soap were provided.
Views from the living room dining room and bedroom were to die for!
Easy to communicate with the staff.
Public transport was the best part of the trip, all fares on any mode of state transport , be it a bus, tram, train or ferry is 50 cents and you just have to tap your credit or debit card, and we did a round day trip to Brisbane for $1.50 each!
Beautiful surfing beaches, delicious cuisines, shopping and blue sunny skies are right outside the door of the hotel!
Tram is like 12 steps away from the entrance.
Would love to stay here any time and highly recommend this place!
showerReviews.author: Bindia Malhotra

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our stay at Q1 was unpleasant. In addition to long waits to check in and long waits to check out, it was very inconvenient that the ground floor was being refurbished without enough signage. It was also not helpful having only one working lift for 74 floors; guests had to go up and down and even change lifts in between. It was extremely inconvenient.

I called the staff after extending our stay to request towels, and I was incorrectly told that it would cost $200 because towels were not included in our package. The next day, reception confirmed that this information was incorrect.
Overall, the building feels old. If you value good service, this is not the place; it is not well staffed during busy times.
The only positives are the warm pool during windy or rainy days, the large and spacious apartments with a kitchenette, and the warm spa next to the pool. That‚Äôs about it.
showerReviews.author: Nikki Mehr

locations.title: Club Lime Broadbeach
locations.address: ÓÉàLevel 2, Shop 27 Oasis Shopping Centre, Victoria Ave, Broadbeach QLD 4218

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member of this gym since April. Overall, it is not bad and I will keep going, but I think some areas could really be improved.

The main issue is the cleaning. They always remind members to wipe down the machines after use, which is fine, but I feel the staff should also pay more attention to the general hygiene of the place. For example, the mirrors have had the same marks for months, the toilets often have a strong smell of urine, and the showers get water buildup while using them, which is not very pleasant considering how many people pass through every day.

Another point is the staff‚Äôs attitude. Sometimes, when asking for help or information, instead of being welcoming, they look like you are bothering them. It has happened to me more than once.

If these things improved ‚Äî especially cleaning and customer service ‚Äî this gym would be perfect.
showerReviews.author: Valeria Cipilenco

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Anytime Fitness Southport is genuinely one of the best gyms I‚Äôve been to. The staff are always friendly, welcoming, and happy to help with anything you need.
Connor, who‚Äôs been there since before the renovation, really adds to that local, friendly, ‚Äúremember-your-name‚Äù kind of vibe that makes the place feel like home.

The trainers are all highly skilled, approachable and encouraging
whether you‚Äôre after one-on-one coaching, comp prep or a great group class, they‚Äôve got you covered.

The natural lighting makes working out here so much more enjoyable.

The recovery zone is a huge bonus, complete with a moon boot and Evolt body scan equipment, all free for members.

The extra touches like phone chargers, deodorant, hair straighteners and hair dryers show just how much thought they put into the member experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently updated a review I wrote five years ago. After returning to Australia after several years, I registered at the gym on the very day I arrived. The real-time consultation was incredibly detailed, allowing me to secure a great promotion and complete my re-registration without visiting in person.

The gym has transformed impressively! I especially love that all the carpets are gone‚Äîit feels so much better. The self-massage area after workouts is absolutely fantastic! Plus, the gym has all the equipment needed for weight training!

One minor downside is that the gym feels quite warm inside. Also, since all the restrooms are unisex, the toilets were very dirty. It would be great if there were a handheld spray next to the toilet or disinfectant wipes available. Having separate spaces for men and women would be the best improvement.

I‚Äôll definitely recommend this gym to many of my friends!
showerReviews.author: Happy J

I recently updated a review I wrote five years ago. After returning to Australia after several years, I registered at the gym on the very day I arrived. The real-time consultation was incredibly detailed, allowing me to secure a great promotion and complete my re-registration without visiting in person.

The gym has transformed impressively! I especially love that all the carpets are gone‚Äîit feels so much better. The self-massage area after workouts is absolutely fantastic! Plus, the gym has all the equipment needed for weight training!

One minor downside is that the gym feels quite warm inside. Also, since all the restrooms are unisex, the toilets were very dirty. It would be great if there were a handheld spray next to the toilet or disinfectant wipes available. Having separate spaces for men and women would be the best improvement.

I‚Äôll definitely recommend this gym to many of my friends!
showerReviews.author: Happy J

locations.title: Budds Beach
locations.address: ÓÉàSurfers Paradise QLD

showerReviews.reviewText:
Budds Beach is a hidden gem for the locals and backpackers in the area.

It's one of very few locations that is on the water, with sand and gets the afternoon and evening sunlight. The opposite of what you get at the beach at Surfers for example.

Budd's has open grass areas, playground for the kids, electric BBQ spots, picnic tables, and plenty of benches. Public toilets and outdoor shower too.

The smooth concrete foot path added about 5 years ago makes it nice for bike rides for the kids or skating.

You can certainly wade in the water here to cool down but personally I would not swim in the water with the amount of sting rays, bull sharks and water craft in the area.
showerReviews.author: Peter Bui

locations.title: Paradise Island Resort
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Paradise Island, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice room. 14B on the first floor.  But the air conditioner whines and screams keeping me awake.

Now I live in Perth but have come to the Gold Coast many times as I think the people here are the nicest in Australia.  So this is a first for me

I would have said something.  But the young lady at reception.  And if management wants to follow this up I stayed on the 2/3 of Jan 2026.  In fact I‚Äôm still here for another night.  But I‚Äôll bet they won‚Äôt follow this up.

Now, I chose not to say anything as this young lady on 2 encounters once at check in and once in the morning when I went and purchased some stuff the rooms didn‚Äôt have really did not want to be there.  I get like I was asking for a favour to get her attention.  She was. Miserable.

And what got me is that the room above me on the morning of the 3rd had something going on that involved some sort of domestic fight. There was screaming and loud and clear conversation can be heard.  And a few loud bangs with vibrations that woke me up several times.

When I brought this to the attention of this young lady.  And said I hope the people are ok, she said without looking at me that it was probably construction.

With that I just thanked her and left. I didn‚Äôt think she would be interested if I talked about the air conditioner.  It will keep me up tonight.

Another minor detail is that when we asked for new towels. We were told that this is a no service note unless we stay 8 nights or more.

That left me puzzled, but I didn‚Äôt want to. Other then any further as they obviously had more important things to do

So yeah‚Ä¶.   Stay somewhere else.

It‚Äôs a shame.  As it is a truly lovely place in a lovely location.

Too bad about the service.
showerReviews.author: Brendan Tsoi

showerReviews.reviewText:
Amazing location so central a 2 minute walk to the main strip and trams. Peaceful views and a great pool facility. We had no issues with staff and found them very helpful when needed.

However the room its self was very disappointing. It was dirty with black mould above the shower and shower door handle fell off and the sink faucet was hanging on for dear life.

The deck was disgusting to the point that we didn‚Äôt want to sit and relax on it. The carpet in the room also felt very damp to the point we just wore our shoes the whole time.

Would recommend for the location however not if you are wanting a clean relaxing place to stay. With some extra work and effort this could be an amazing place to stay.
showerReviews.author: Mia Faulkner

showerReviews.reviewText: Great location, free parking, laundry facilities for a small cost, great amenities, can walk to surfers paradise and all the spots, felt extremely safe, complimentary 50-50 wifi and great staff. The only downside is the room itself. We were given a room on the 4 th floor but was untidy, the carpets a bit questionable, unknown stains, maintenance may be skipped on the air con. We spoke with the reception who were extremely accommodating and moved us to another room which was reasonable compared to the first one. The general feeling is, you get what you paid for, however, claiming a 3 star facility would expect slightly better hygiene standards. There is no housekeeping for a week, which means no new towels and toiletries refilled. You can get replacement towels for a small fee and purchase detergent to do laundry if required. Overall a great stay but if you are travelling with young children and susceptible to respiratory problems and allergies, recommend to contact the hotel directly and be vocal on the expectations prior to reservation rather than going through third party booking websites!
showerReviews.author: Tejaswi Laveti

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here recently and the location was honestly the highlight ‚Äî beautiful views and just steps from the tram stop, which made getting around super easy. The room was surprisingly large with decent facilities, and there was plenty of space to spread out.

However, the kitchen and bathroom were extremely outdated, and it really showed. Even the hair dryer looked like it hadn‚Äôt been manufactured since the early 1990s, which kind of summed up the overall condition. The hallway outside my room also had a strong vomit smell during my stay, which wasn‚Äôt great to walk through.

Overall, the location and views are fantastic, but the hotel desperately needs some modernising (and better cleaning) to live up to its potential.

locations.title: Holiday Rentals Surfers Paradise
locations.address: ÓÉàShop 2/3142 Surfers Paradise Blvd, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending 7 glorious nights in apartment #22503. It was our first ‚Äò long holiday ‚Äò as a couple without our 5 children. I was sceptical looking through photos of the property but they were all spot on! We received great communication and instructions for the check in process, we retrieved our keys from the office lockbox that is located a short walk away from the property. As soon as we opened the door I knew we‚Äôd made the right decision, the ocean views just slap you in the face! We sat on the balcony of an evening after long, fun filled days and got to wake up and see the ocean from our bed. The facilities are wonderful and shared with the Hilton Hotel, we used the amazing pools to start the day after our morning beach walks, the apartment was very spacious and had everything we required, there was some complimentary tea/coffee, sugar, milk, dish washing tablet/liquid, clothes washing powder and toilet paper, soap, shampoo/ conditioner to get us started. Having worked in motel housekeeping previously for a number of years my expectations are high and the Orchid definitely exceeded this.the apartment was spotless, located right in the centre of Surfers Paradise you can enjoy the atmosphere and close to everything you could ever need,  I would not hesitate in recommending this property and we can‚Äôt wait to get the chance to visit again. Even though we were staying as a couple the apartment and facilities are very family friendly and the staff were all very helpful. The public transport system is great, 50c fairs on the tram and bus network, we used these to get around and to the theme parks.
showerReviews.author: Stacey Weir

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚ÄãOur stay at this hotel had a very mixed feel, starting with a clean and modern room upon arrival. While we had a few initial issues like a dirty blanket and a missing cooking bowl, the staff did address these the following day. The bed was comfy, and we found the on-site microwave in the kitchen very useful for preparing simple meals, though it was frustrating that a knife for chopping was not provided. The hotel's amenities, including the lovely pool, spa, and sauna, were fantastic, and the Malaysian restaurant was a definite highlight, though it's worth noting it's only open Friday through Sunday.
‚ÄãHowever, the biggest letdown and the primary reason we would not stay here again was the hotel's approach to service. For a seven-night stay, we were only provided with a two-day supply of shampoo, conditioner, and washing-up liquid. We were also surprised to find there was no housekeeping service at all during our week-long visit, and no cleaning equipment was available in the room.
‚ÄãAs a result, the floor became dirty and sandy, which was very unpleasant. Adding to our frustration, we discovered that fresh towels were a paid option, and a washing machine was not provided in the room. It seemed as though the hotel forces guests to either pay for extra housekeeping or accept staying in an unclean environment.
‚ÄãAdditionally, our room experienced a lot of road noise, making it unpleasant to sit on the balcony. I would recommend bringing earplugs if you are a light sleeper.
‚ÄãWhile the amenities were impressive, the lack of basic cleanliness services and the policy of charging for essentials left a very poor impression. We wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone planning a longer stay unless they are prepared to handle all cleaning themselves or pay extra for the basics. We felt we had paid a lot of money to stay here and should not have to pay even more for cleanliness. It's a real shame as it could of been great.
showerReviews.author: C W

showerReviews.reviewText:
The room was very small. It didn't even have a desk. All the appliances (microwave, toaster, coffee machine, etc) were in the wardrobe. The shower door was jammed, so I had to squeeze in and out to have a bath. The good thing was the team managed to fix it for my second night.

The garage was very small, and I had to park my vehicle outdoors one night. Part of the garage was flooded, so I had to step on the poodle to get in and out of the car.

Overall, it was a bad experience, I'll never stay there again.
showerReviews.author: Rodrigo Buccazio

showerReviews.reviewText:
The room was very small. It didn't even have a desk. All the appliances (microwave, toaster, coffee machine, etc) were in the wardrobe. The shower door was jammed, so I had to squeeze in and out to have a bath. The good thing was the team managed to fix it for my second night.

The garage was very small, and I had to park my vehicle outdoors one night. Part of the garage was flooded, so I had to step on the poodle to get in and out of the car.

Overall, it was a bad experience, I'll never stay there again.
showerReviews.author: Rodrigo Buccazio

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well, first of all as soon as we got in our room it was not the room we had paid the room we paid for was WAY more nicer. Secondly we went down to the reception and explained the situation (before hand we had looked around the room, some dishes were dirty, there was a wrapper on the floor)

The reception was nice however we had to paid a cleaning fee of 85 and wouldn‚Äôt be able to swap rooms until the next day, and what we could have gotten could have been worse we decided to stick with our room. Dish  washer didn‚Äôt work, shower drain was blocked luckily we got it fixed the next day. Parking is a bit tricking and awkward spots especially if you have a large car. There was even a dead flat frog on the floor. The elevator was broken on the north tower. The first floor smelt like vomit (and there was a vomit stain) The garbage disposal room had a broken door. The sliding door in our room always came off the hinges. One of the only things that lighten the mood was the free tester cookies.

look I know that is a lot of problems but sovreign isn‚Äôt completely bad, it‚Äôs good value I guess.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Don‚Äôt stay here if you‚Äôre camping and rely on the amenities. Maybe fine for cabins as they looked alright. Camp somewhere else.

Amenities are disgusting and cleaned ONCE A DAY from my observations (only 9:30pm). It feels more like a hostel with the level of courtesy amongst people using the kitchens and bathrooms. I‚Äôve stayed in a lot of caravan parks but this one is the worst! It‚Äôs so big and clearly they make more money from their cabins and do not prioritise any cleaning or maintenance for the campsite amenities.

You can tell they don‚Äôt care if you look at the reviews and see they only respond to the good ones. Never staying in this hole again!

This is unacceptable given the price, even during the Christmas period. They should schedule more frequent cleaning rounds considering how full the campground is. The reception staff don‚Äôt even seem to be aware of the cleaning situation in their own campground. As for the washing machines, apparently three are enough for the entire campground!

Honestly, don‚Äôt trust the Discovery brand image, because this place does not meet the quality standards of the other campgrounds in this chain at all. Stay away!!

locations.title: Mumma's Hostel - Surfers Paradise
locations.address: ÓÉà18 Peninsular Dr, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lot went wrong with this stay. I called a few times the day before to ask about early parking, but no answer. Thankfully, they let me park early when I arrived which i did appreciate, but communication was non-existent.

Check-in could have gone badly, this hostel clearly preferences foreign travellers, I was told I must show a passport, and my valid Australian government issued driver‚Äôs licence wasn‚Äôt accepted. As a local Queensland citizen, that felt incredibly unfair. The policy is buried in the fine print, but if I didn‚Äôt happen to have my passport, I would‚Äôve been turned away after already paying a deposit. Even though I was able to check in, the fact that I could‚Äôve been refused entry had i not had a passport in my own country really stuck with me. To be fair, the man at reception was friendly, he was just following a policy that clearly isn‚Äôt designed with Australians in mind.

The room was poorly maintained, with scratched walls, a mouldy, dusty air conditioner, and no remote to use it. Based on the state of the room, I wouldn‚Äôt trust the pool to be clean either. We were so over it, we ended up booking a room at the Mantra just to finally feel comfortable.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hostel to Australian travellers or to anyone expecting even the bare minimum level of comfort or hygiene.
showerReviews.author: Bailey Maguire

You get two beds and a desk, for what we booked at least. There was a shared bathroom but that was fine, it said so on the booking. While checking out we had to wait a few minutes but that was okay. You also had free breakfast but had to wash your own dishes afterwards, which is totally fair. The staff was friendly and you can easily meet people if you just start up a conversation. You get what you pay for, enough.

locations.title: Surfers Paradise Esplanade
locations.address: ÓÉà60 Esplanade, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚ÄúSurfers Paradise Esplanade is a beautiful stretch along the beach and one of the best places to enjoy the Gold Coast. The wide, clean walkway is perfect for a morning jog, bike ride, or a relaxed stroll with ocean views. There are plenty of seats and shaded spots to take a break and watch the surf, and the landscaping and public art make it feel fresh and inviting.

The area is well maintained and safe, with easy access to the beach, shops, cafes, and restaurants along Cavill Ave and beyond. There are regular events and markets that add to the atmosphere, and it‚Äôs just as nice at night with the lights and ocean breeze.

Parking and public transport are nearby, and there are water fountains, showers, and toilets which make it practical as well as scenic. Whether you‚Äôre exercising, sightseeing, or just enjoying the coastline, the Esplanade is a must-do when visiting Surfers Paradise.
showerReviews.author: William Murphy

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
A vibrant and iconic destination on the Goldy. With its stunning views of the Pacific Ocean, pristine sandy beaches, and a lively atmosphere, it's a must-visit for anyone looking for a taste of the Australian coastal lifestyle.

The esplanade is lined with a variety of shops, cafes, and restaurants, making it a hub of activity throughout the day and night. Whether you're strolling along the beachside promenade, enjoying a meal with an ocean view, or shopping for souvenirs, there's something for everyone here.

The golden sands and crystal-clear waters are perfect for swimming, sunbathing, or simply taking a leisurely walk. Lifeguards are on duty, ensuring safety for swimmers and surfers.

The Esplanade comes alive at night, with street performers, live music, and a buzzing nightlife scene. The Surfers Paradise Beachfront Markets are a particular delight, offering a range of handcrafted goods and delicious street food.

One drawback is that it can get quite crowded, especially during peak tourist seasons, which might not be for everyone. However, the lively atmosphere and the endless entertainment options more than make up for it.
showerReviews.author: Mutia U

showerReviews.reviewText:

locations.title: Rackley Swimming Miami
locations.address: ÓÉà80 Pacific Ave, Miami QLD 4220

showerReviews.reviewText:
My child has been swimming here for the past 4 years. We‚Äôve had many wonderful instructors over this time and really appreciated their effort, except for one instructor, Eva C., who unfortunately was often distracted and at times came across as rude.

The main concern for us has been the reception and management team. Customer service is consistently poor ‚Äî staff can be impatient, unhelpful, and sometimes even raise their voices at parents. When I wanted to leave the school, management convinced me to put classes on hold due to a large number of makeup lessons. However, the parent portal is very frustrating: once your child levels up, previous makeup lessons no longer appear, meaning the only way to book them is by calling reception, which is not convenient.

Overall, after years of trying to make it work, I feel the administration is unprofessional and the experience has been very disappointing. We will be moving to another swim school.
showerReviews.author: PEI ZHAO

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a terrible experience with the swimming school in the Miami location due to poor customer service. I had to cancel two classes because my son had chickenpox, and I simply wanted to reschedule the lessons. However, instead of allowing me to reschedule one of the existing classes, they insisted that I change my plan to once a week, which would increase the cost of each class.

I reluctantly agreed to this change, even though I knew I would be losing money, but then they still refused to let me alter my schedule to once a week without paying for two additional lessons over the next two weeks. They claimed I needed to give a two-week notice for any cancellation. The issue was, I just wanted to temporarily switch to once a week for two weeks to use the two missed lessons, and then return to my regular two lessons per week.

The whole system is extremely complicated and frustrating, and this was the second time I was treated poorly by their staff. Now, I feel forced to continue going to the school for the next two weeks, even though I‚Äôve already paid the full price. I‚Äôm also being pressured to take three classes in one of the weeks, which is not ideal. I am incredibly disappointed and no longer want to go back to this place.

To be honest, I would prefer a refund for the six pending lessons and would rather never step foot in this place again.
showerReviews.author: Mirian Molina

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a terrible experience with the swimming school in the Miami location due to poor customer service. I had to cancel two classes because my son had chickenpox, and I simply wanted to reschedule the lessons. However, instead of allowing me to reschedule one of the existing classes, they insisted that I change my plan to once a week, which would increase the cost of each class.

I reluctantly agreed to this change, even though I knew I would be losing money, but then they still refused to let me alter my schedule to once a week without paying for two additional lessons over the next two weeks. They claimed I needed to give a two-week notice for any cancellation. The issue was, I just wanted to temporarily switch to once a week for two weeks to use the two missed lessons, and then return to my regular two lessons per week.

The whole system is extremely complicated and frustrating, and this was the second time I was treated poorly by their staff. Now, I feel forced to continue going to the school for the next two weeks, even though I‚Äôve already paid the full price. I‚Äôm also being pressured to take three classes in one of the weeks, which is not ideal. I am incredibly disappointed and no longer want to go back to this place.

To be honest, I would prefer a refund for the six pending lessons and would rather never step foot in this place again.
showerReviews.author: Mirian Molina

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely appalling treatment of a nervous toddler

After spending thousands of dollars at this swim school, I am beyond disgusted by their shocking lack of empathy and unprofessionalism today. My 3-year-old daughter has anxiety around swimming, and any change in routine or teacher is extremely upsetting for her. Despite this, we were making progress - until today.

Without any prior warning, we arrived for her lesson only to be told she'd been kicked out of her class and she is being ‚Äòmoved up‚Äô to make room for other children who "needed more assistance." This was blatantly untrue, as those children were more competent swimmers and weren't crying at all. My daughter was left sobbing hysterically on the side of the pool while the teachers made eyes at each other and everyone was staring. I was also there by myself with my toddler and my other baby in the pram.

I begged them to please let her join her familiar class for today only so we can avoid months of regression, but I was completely ignored for 15 minutes while my daughter screamed/cried. To spring this on a sensitive toddler with zero notice is simply unacceptable.

If you have a child who needs a little extra understanding and support, avoid this swim school at all costs. It doesn't take much effort to call or email me before to let me know we have changed classes. Their disregard for my daughter's wellbeing was appalling, and I will be taking my business elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Melanie Jane

showerReviews.reviewText: My two sons currently swim there, but we are exploring other options due to the poor management. The policies for make-up lessons are unclear and inflexible, the online portal is clunky and unusable, and communication from some of the receptionists is terrible. Jackie at the reception is particularly arrogant and lacks patience, displaying no sense of customer service. The only positive aspect is the excellent instructors, but the overall management is extremely poor. We're forced to look for another swimming school because of the lack of customer care. The owner needs to pay attention to this issue as you will lose a lot of customers like us!

locations.address: ÓÉà158 Ferny Ave, Surfers Paradise QLD 4217

showerReviews.reviewText: Spa journey for 2 was indeed a journey! Approximately 2 hours in duration, everything was so luxurious and relaxing. They start you off with a welcome drink, shot of delightful floral/citrus drink, introduce you to the locker room that has dry and steam shower/sauna, quick feet wash and then take you into a couples massage room, and start you off with a body scrub and couples bath/shower and then hour of amazing massage. Bath was very interesting, you get to bath together for about 30 mins before the massage. Afterwards,  you can relax and lounge with tea or champagne, hop onto sauna before exiting, all at your pace. It was one of the highlights of our stay at the Jw.

locations.title: Franks Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà14 Lanyana Way, Noosa Heads QLD 4567

showerReviews.reviewText:
Used Franks while visiting Noosa recently. It‚Äôs not a bad space with plenty of equipment, though much of this is a bit careworn and tired. Handles/ curl bars used for the cable machines are worn with bearings gone making for jerky movements / screeching, and cables easily coming off pulleys etc.

24$ for a single visit isn‚Äôt the cheapest but you pay for convenience, and prices are advertised at the reception desk, so that‚Äôs fine.

Main comment is that it really needs a good clean. All the touch points are filthy, and when you look a little closer there‚Äôs a layer of grime over most surfaces, whether it‚Äôs the floor, weights benches, cable machines or amenities. I noticed the same discarded disposable water bottle in the same spot for three days running- presume no cleaner had been in those three days or it would have been removed.

The above said- I did attend three times in a week and got in a decent workout, though there‚Äôs definitely a need for a deep clean.

Edit- following response from owner: I don‚Äôt think commenting on amenities provided, price and cleanliness constitutes a strange review‚Ä¶?
showerReviews.author: lewis wilkinson

showerReviews.reviewText: I'd rate the gym itself five stars for its top-notch equipment and facilities in the Noosa area. However, the hygiene, particularly in the restrooms, is a major letdown.  They're consistently dirty, and I've heard the men's are even worse.  Another issue is the sheer number of school kids.  Many seem to be there without memberships and are just let in by friends.  They often make a mess, don't know how to use the equipment properly, and generally get in the way.  I've overheard other members complaining about it too.  Honestly, it would be a much better experience if it were adults-only.

The showers were excellent and soap and toilet paper etc was all available. We had a fire (need a raised firepit). It was great for our family with kids. It was only a couple minute drive to the ocean and a beautiful beach. It was a great weekend.
showerReviews.author: Brocky Aspland

showerReviews.reviewText:
We highly recommend the BIG 4, Noosa North Shore. We recently had an exceptional experience there, and everything about our stay was tremendous.

The amenities are excellent and cater to children of all ages, including pools, a bouldering wall, arcade area, and paddle boards. The rooms were modern and clean, the staff were incredibly helpful, and the location offered true tranquillity.

I highly recommend Noosa North Shore to anyone seeking a relaxing, fun-filled, and enjoyable stay for their family.
showerReviews.author: Megan Seeley

The park has a beautiful complex that contains reception, a restaurant and a shop.

locations.title: Habitat Noosa Everglades Eco Camp
locations.address: ÓÉàElanda Pt Rd, Como QLD 4571

showerReviews.reviewText: Our family had an excellent time at Habitat Noosa.   Starting with the booking process, LeAnn was extremely helpful working through some tech challenges placing the reservation from the US. Our stay over Christmas holiday was great - the kangaroos are everywhere, staying in the shade of our tent during the day. We reserved the premium paperbark glamping tents with the ensuite bathroom and shower- they were in great shape and clean. This time of year there are often massive thunderstorms in the evening, and the glamping tents were very sturdy and dry. Restaurant/bar were a nice bonus with more food and drink options than I expected at a campground. Access between the campground and nearby towns/highway was easy.
showerReviews.author: Mike Kneale

showerReviews.reviewText: Our family had an excellent time at Habitat Noosa. showerReviews.reviewText:
It‚Äôs overhyped. The site is too big for the amount of guests and the size of the campsite. The pitches are very lumpy. The bar area is very nice but this is evidently where they have spent their money‚Äîthe toilets and showers are lacklustre. We camped in the gums and we were too far from the showers.

Little to no internet connection across the site; but free WiFi available at the bar.

Also, they have an unnecessarily restrictive check-in process. They‚Äôll flat-out turn you down and leave you stranded if you check in after 21:00. Not ideal if you‚Äôre travelling long distances to stay here.

The camp kitchen did not have any hobs for normal cooking. Many other sites have far better cooking facilities.

Cool that there were tonnes of kangaroos and lizards around. The lakeside is also very nice, although the powered sites back directly onto the sandy beach area. It feels like you‚Äôre invading other guest‚Äôs space if you sit on the beach in the evening.
showerReviews.author: Ben

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great Family Camping at Habitat Noosa
We had an absolutely fantastic time camping at Habitat Noosa with our kids! It's the perfect spot for a family getaway. The best part for us was the beautiful, shallow and warm water. It meant we could relax while the kids splashed and played safely for hours.
The facilities were top-notch, especially the proper bar with food. It was so convenient to grab a meal or a drink without having to leave the site. We didn't have to worry about cooking every night, which made the trip feel like a true vacation.
Overall, if you're looking for a stress-free camping experience with great amenities and a safe, kid-friendly swimming area, Habitat Noosa is an excellent choice. We can't wait to go back!
showerReviews.author: Marek Migurski

showerReviews.reviewText: We camped for 3 days in this beautiful spot.  It is idyllic and the large sites, the lovely trees for shade and abundant wildlife adds to the relaxed holiday feeling. We enjoyed the Tavern and appreciated the service from staff.  Just a couple of suggestions.  With so many campers, more showers attached to the toilets closer to camp sites would be a bonus.  We were a bit disappointed with the state of the toilets.  There was often no soap which to me indicates that more soap dispensers are required.
showerReviews.author: Jannine McGarry

showerReviews.reviewText: We camped for 3 days in this beautiful spot.  It is idyllic and the large sites, the lovely trees for shade and abundant wildlife adds to the relaxed holiday feeling. showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the second time we have stayed here but first time doing waterfront. I do not recommend the waterfront camping, although the spot is beautiful, and unfortunately the wind was insane that we left early after one night, we couldn‚Äôt even cook on the stove. But we had booked five spots, with three families right on the waterfront, unfortunately other guests ruined the experience for us. People walking through our camp to get to the beach, using the shower late at night next to our tent, which therefore affected my sleep and my babies sleep. There is a picnic table near the end spot and we had people sit there until 10.15pm talking and laughing so loud. If you want quiet, waterfront isn‚Äôt for you. You also have huge groups walking past throughout the day to use the jetty, and they are loud and nosey. It wasn‚Äôt peaceful at all. Not one bit. Unfortunately because I have camped up the road at boreen point and it was quiet, I assumed this waterfront would be the same.
You can camp elsewhere at habibat noosa and have quiet spots but waterfront is not a quiet spot.
Had we known this, we wouldn‚Äôt of booked it. People actually sat on our camp site to watch the sunrise - so other guests ruined our experience which is no fault of habitat noosa. The area is amazing, and the service in the bar is great. The options for things to do are good too and the bathrooms are clean and tidy. So at no fault of habitat Noosa, other than it not being made obvious when booking, waterfront camping is not a peaceful experience and as we had to leave early and lost out on money, we wouldn‚Äôt choose to stay here a third time.
showerReviews.author: Abigail Harcus

locations.title: South Pacific Resort & Spa Noosa
locations.address: ÓÉà179 Weyba Rd, Noosaville QLD 4566

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros: Great location, 5 minute drive to Hastings street, walking distance to farmers market. Also located next to the river.
Easy to check in after hours. Instructions to get to the unit and general instructions for the stay were clear.
The Thai restaurant is amazing, food was perfect and great tasting cocktails.
Pool and garden area is pretty.
Reception staff were helpful.
Room was clean, tidy and nicely styled. The Bed was very comfortable.

Cons: lack of tea towels, 1 towel for the duration of the stay, fees for extra towels.
Enough toiletries for 1 person only.
People smoking on balconies- haven‚Äôt witnessed this in a long time. Balconies are very close together. The smoke goes into your apartment. It should be banned with a smoking area provided.
Unit walls are paper thin, in our experience it was a very noisy stay with lots of kids yelling and disrupting the peace between 9pm-11pm. Not the hotels fault but I think it‚Äôs worth noting for future visitors. Every footstep can be heard from upper levels.
No access to staff on site from 4pm-ish onwards.

Without the noise and smoke it would be a 5 star review. I‚Äôd visit just for the Thai food it was that good.
showerReviews.author: C F

locations.address: ÓÉà1295 Noosa Rd, Tandur QLD 4570

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the most relaxing/easy camping places.
Communication, respect easy going people it was a pleasure staying with them.
definitely best hosting we come across.
Cabins were clean and had everything we needed and if we didn‚Äôt have something we just had to send a text .
Celebrated our daughter 13th birthday (12 kids and 2 adults) everyone was happy from the beginning to the end.
Nice bathrooms, hot showers and a very sweet little canteen.
We even got to feed the horses.
Kids were happy on bikes and just exploring the grounds looking at the kangaroos, cows, horses etc.
100% recommend this place for your next camping trip cabins or tent (we did both)
Thank you

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a camping spot!
Dog friendly, no size limit.
Trish and Trev were so helpful.
One week fell into many months living there and I am forever grateful to be surrounded by lush green grass, Bush and serenity while horse and cows roam the paddock. Chickens in the pen, it's a great family spot.
Great little walk to the river, would be great with a dog.
Lagoons to swim in with  rock pools just down the road.
Clean shower and toilets.
Slushies, ice and firewood for sale.
Horse jumping, X Country track
Only 15 mins to Gympie for shopping, central to Tin Can Bay (Dolphin feeding, fishing, ), Rainbow beach (Coloured Sands) or Noosa Sunshine Coast.
The location is perfect as a base for those touring the area with so much to do.
I highly recommend Noosa Equestrian and camping for those looks for quiet space. I was sad to leave, thanks for having me!.
showerReviews.author: Jacinta Cocking

Its paradise. So quiet and the owner Trish is a lovely , welcoming, helpful, lady,  i love it out here, surrounded by Horses whinnying, watching them play in the paddocks.üê¥üê¥ The morning is filled with the sound of Kukaburras laughing.
Hot showers and toilets provided for the cheap price, water, rubbish bins even a dump point wow

Thank you Trish for providing the best camp i have been too and I have been travelling for mny years and seen many camps.
Thank you for providing an affordable safe place to camp and  no prejudices what vehicle or tent can stay here.
Most places only take RV,s
I highly recommend this wonderful place you can stay as long as you like.
Margaret

locations.title: Nomads Noosa Youth Resort

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a really nice hostel, unless you want to cook. The kitchen was filled with flies and people left their dishes, I had to constantly waft flies off my food whilst trying to make it.
Some signs saying that fines are given for left dishes might help. And clear instructions to wash dry and put away before eating to everyone who intends to use the kitchen when they check in might help.
If the hostel has budget the kitchen could do with some wooden spoons and new (sharp) knives too.
And if there's even more budget for this hostel some new sofas would be good.

Positives were the staff were all really friendly and helpful. And the rooms were nice and cool, clean and comfortable.
showerReviews.author: Joe Henley
