showerReviews.reviewText:
We loved our stay here! The staff were lovely from when we arrived to leaving. It's a nice social atmosphere with activities on every night.
The rooms were perfect, very large space with on ensuite and shower! One of the best rooms we have stayed it for a while.

Kitchen was clean enough for hostel standards as you do expect a small amount of mess as it's used so much.

My only improvement would be the bar. From the room you couldn't hear any music which was great! And it was a party atmosphere.

I'm unsure if the bar is a separate business as I couldn't find any contact details so hopefully this is passed on. We really wanted to go to the dirty disco bingo on the Thursday evening and had made plans to go.
I have epilepsy so I'm super careful with pubs and bars. We went and had to pay $10 entry to get in. The flashing lights where unbearable and we had to leave after 5 minutes as it was too high risk.

This is a common problem in Australia but a sign on the door 'flashing lights used at this venue' or something to highlight it would go a HUGE way in making it more inclusive and safer. If I had known prior I could have changed our plans without wasting $10 and the disappointment of not taking part.
Overall a very good experience!
showerReviews.author: jasmin ronan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Horrible experience. Nomads is known for prioritizing value over comfort, but this is not to Nomads standards. AC was broken (it was cooler outside than in the rooms at night) and there was no hot water in the showers. Talking to other guests, it seems like these are common problems in almost all rooms and nobody fixes anything.
There is no night manager (or he is nowhere to be found), so if your phone runs out of battery at night, you cannot get into your room (key as a phone).
Overall just a bad experience, spend a few more bucks and go somewhere else
showerReviews.author: Samuel Diablo

locations.title: Halse Lodge Noosa Heads
locations.address: ÓÉà2 Halse Ln, Noosa Heads QLD 4567

showerReviews.reviewText:
Halse Lodge is one of the best places I‚Äôve stayed at in Australia! The location is absolutely amazing, in the middle of Noosa Heads just 2 minutes away from Hastings St. and the beach.üèñÔ∏è The environment in the woods gives it a nice and peaceful vibe while still being close to the buzzing life.
I stayed in a 6-bed mixed dorm and I absolutely love it! I had my own curtain, free towels (2!), a locker that could have fit two 70L backpacks if I wanted to, and plugs and a light right above my head when I was laying down.
I absolutely loved the staff as they were so incredibly friendly and kind, going the extra mile to accommodate me by letting me check in early, helping me arranging a taxi, and even walking through a thunderstorm with an umbrella to make sure we got safely back to reception and our room.
I would absolutely love to go back again and if you were looking for a reason to book your stay, see this as your sign!üòâ
showerReviews.author: Danique Klunder

locations.address: ÓÉà14/16 Duke St, Sunshine Beach QLD 4567

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the Closest Backpackers to The Beach you will get!
Huge facilities, Clothesline, Big fully equipped Kitchens And massive fridge in the Rooms, Ultra Quiet, Cross Flow and AC in Every Room..
Trusting Backpackers that want nothing but happy Vibes.
Places cleaned and new bath mat and tea towels everyday.
Lovely hot showers with proper flowing Jets.
Huge size bathroom.
Small four bed bunks not like others that have 10 and everyone is making noise all night.
You don't need lockers because everybody looks after everybody's gear And you always have someone about.
Surfboards for use just with passport before 10a.m. and  after 2:00 p.m.
Forgot to mention many hammocks to relax in. Very comfortable lounge areas TV power points everywhere.
I reckon it's only 300 to 400 M to the beach.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely stay at Dolphins - easy access to town via buses (and only 50c or free on the weekends!), beaches and lush coffee shop 1 min walk away. The common area is super nice to hang out both in the day and evening and has a very relaxed feel.

Staff are lovely and very on it with cleaning and keeping the place organised. We were able to check in super early, rooms had AC and bathroom shared between 9 but you could use any on site. The private kitchen with an oven was a highlight and a nice change from dirty, communal kitchens you find in other hostels.

My only negative comments are lack of storage/lockers in the room and the door itself not even locking so leaving valuables felt a bit risky. Also the wifi only worked in the communal areas so didn‚Äôt quite stretch to our room and the checkout was on the early side (9:30) but you can still use the common area and store bags during the day. Highly recommend!
showerReviews.author: Harriet Moxey

showerReviews.reviewText: My wife and I had 18 days at 71 Hastings. We can highly recommend it. The location is so good being right on the beach, beautiful views over  Laguna Bay,  step out on to the boardwalk., enjoy first class well maintained,and clean facilities, and have pleasant and efficient staff to assist when need be.

showerReviews.reviewText: Our stay at 71 Hastings was outstanding - from start to finish. The lovely Tamara met us at the property after we arrived at 8:30am from our early flight. we were not expecting to be able to have access to anything (we had planned on just waiting around at the beach until our room was ready) but we were given an early check-in which was unexpected and SO helpful with 2 young kids in tow. We were given a complimentary bottle of wine (we chose a Prosecco) to enjoy during our stay (which we did!) and Tamara even return the following day with a gorgeous complimentary chocolate Easter hamper from Maleny Chocolate Co for us and the kids to enjoy. The room was always impeccably serviced (daily) which was SO helpful as we often brought in wet towels from the pool and sand from the beach. Our toddler had accidentally wet the bed during his lunchtime nap the second day after we arrived and they changed the bed sheets without any issues. The lovely Kathryn also allowed us to have a late check out - also unheard of! The location and stay was just magic - we cannot wait to be back, we've found our place for our Noosa getaways and wont stay anywhere else. Thanks to the team at 71 Hastings for making our stay spectacular. Your attention to detail and effort in going above and beyond really made it feel not only stress free, but we felt spoilt - we really appreciated it.
showerReviews.author: Ross L

locations.title: Howie's Place Noosa
locations.address: ÓÉà19 Seagull Ct, Noosaville QLD 4566

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location was at the end of a cul de sac with bushland on one side. We were only 5 mins drive from Gympie Terrace where we caught a shuttle to our all day cruise of the Everglades. It was very quiet & very private.
Our hosts ensured facilities were clean. The bathroom is very spacious with shower & spa, the bedroom boasting a King size bed & the toiletries provided were of good quality.
We particularly liked the strip lighting along the garden path giving us a safe passage back to our room at night.
showerReviews.author: Dianne Cesari

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quiet. Private. Serene. Clean. Immaculate. Not the place for revelers.
My stay was of two nights at Cathie and Howard's wonderful Howie‚Äôs Place in Seagull Circuit Noosaville.
A single traveller for compassionate reasons.
An address geographically the centre of  Noosa.
Taxis are cheap in Noosa $12 typically for anywhere within the town area.
The distance to Noosaville Shopping Village is 1.2 km.
Main shopping centre for Noosa which has everything.
I chose to have all meals in for the time.
Cathie offered driveway parking but the quiet cul-de-sac is easy.
A separate side path leads to the rear where the guest suite opens off a shallow garden.
Across the fence is a fauna and flora reserve.
A lovely night space to enjoy.
Some of the night creatures were happy to start chatting.
In the morning becoming a lovely small al fresco.
...................................................................................................................................................
The large main room.
Best firm king size bed ever.
Giant TV.
Perfect wardrobe with iron and board.
Set-up for tea/coffee requirements with kettle, microwave and toaster.
Fresh milk in bathroom fridge.
AC plus ceiling fan perfect for sleep on a tropical night.
.................................................................................................................................................
The large bathroom better than most hotels offer.
Spa bath looking out onto the courtyard through a picture window.
The shower huge and the rose at a great height for tall persons.
...........................................................................................................................................
To conclude- simple thoughts from the hosts.
Like maps and books and guides.
Thank you Howard and Cathie for my visit to Noosa made special by your fine place.

Leonard
showerReviews.author: Leonard Martin

showerReviews.reviewText:
I took a friend for a treat spa and signature massage.   I have been to the spa many times before with family and friends we have always loved it.  Unfortunately today‚Äôs visit was really disappointing, the spa pool surrounds were dirty and several of the spa jets were not working.  We had a blitz shower and many of the jets were not working, the sauna was dirty and overall the place looked tired and a but grubby.    Our massages were fabulous, however one of the massage rooms had tiles missing and it was dirty.   We ordered the champagne and cheese which was given to another guest, i only found that out when i asked about it at reception.  We did get a refund.   Overall it was disappointing and a big step down from my previous visits.  I thought you should know and hopefully these areas can be improved
Karen Gahan
showerReviews.author: Karen Gahan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I took a friend for a treat spa and signature massage.   I have been to the spa many times before with family and friends we have always loved it.  Unfortunately today‚Äôs visit was really disappointing, the spa pool surrounds were dirty and several of the spa jets were not working.  We had a blitz shower and many of the jets were not working, the sauna was dirty and overall the place looked tired and a but grubby.    Our massages were fabulous, however one of the massage rooms had tiles missing and it was dirty.   We ordered the champagne and cheese which was given to another guest, i only found that out when i asked about it at reception.  We did get a refund.   Overall it was disappointing and a big step down from my previous visits.  I thought you should know and hopefully these areas can be improved
Karen Gahan
showerReviews.author: Karen Gahan

locations.title: Noosa Fair Massage
locations.address: ÓÉà3 Lanyana Way, Noosa Heads QLD 4567

showerReviews.reviewText:
If there was an option for zero, i would have given this. Very inexperienced, unprofessional and painful session that lead to my lower back bulging disc damage and i had been off work for now almost 3 weeks.

Recently we went to Noosa for a family vacation from Melbourne and decided to go for a full body massage.Three of us had a massage at this place as we were assured that they have 5 star rating.

The worst experience ever. The lady was using her elbow continously on my lower back bulging disc that resulted to my now ongoing lower back pain and disc bleed. She never asked if the pressure was ok. I felt like I was tortured. Then she put an extremely hot towel on me that resulted in my back being burnt.

Now when I read below reviews, I can see that more people have experienced this. I am now spending thousands of dollars fixing my bulging disc and cant return to work. I am on unpaid leave because of your massage.

You can check your records, we came between 13th Nov to 15th Nov 2024. I had a daughter with disability named Shilpa.
showerReviews.author: Roy Kumar

locations.address: ÓÉà43-49 Victoria St, Toowoomba City QLD 4350

showerReviews.reviewText: If there was any other swimming pool option in Toowoomba I would go there. This place is a continual disappointment. Pretty clean today, but as usual, there is literally 2 lanes given to kids' swimming area. The ENTIRE 50m pool is roped off for 2 people lane swimming. Almost the entire inside pool is roped off for.....zero lane swimmers! Its like this every time I visit. And the life guards yell at kids who dare to cross into a lane to retrieve a toy. Totally happy to share the pool with lane swimmers, but do 2 swimmers need it ALL? and in the school holidays? Its farcical. My cynical side says they do it so they have less area to patrol and therefore, fewer life guards on duty.
showerReviews.author: Trish Darvall

showerReviews.reviewText: So glad I chose this gym, loving the place right now!! (It's only day 4, my legs are not that sore yet). Staff are very kind & helpful, got the payment plan sorted day one. Gifted a back-pack & 2 drink bottles. I love the "all in this together atmosphere", good music, music videos available to view on all of the walking & bike machines. Very clean & tidy, all the equipment works perfectly, is brand new, Matrix written everywhere. A greenery garden in the middle of the bike area is lovely, half expecting a frog to jump out. There is a huge group fitness room, all new, great lighting, plus a pilates/ barre room, a circuit only room, plus a workout area with a view. Showers & lockers & WiFi available. 24hr access, I have already been in on the weekend. Group exercise classes are available plus you can study fitness through the club. Aren't we lucky.

locations.title: Anytime Fitness Toowoomba
locations.address: ÓÉà2/255 Herries St, Newtown QLD 4350

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm leaving a review from the perspective of an average gymgoer. If you do a bodybuilding style of training you will have everything you need. The amenities are very clean, and all the equipment is brand new so it's hard to complain about that.

However, I do have a lot of criticisms from a powerlifter/weightlifter perspective, and some general criticisms. Some of these are easily rectified, some not so much.

- There are 5 half racks, yet no olympic lifting/deadlifting platform?? There is currently nowhere to deadlift except for the normal gym floor
- In front of the racks toward the back of the building the floor is extremely un-level, so your barbell will just roll into the racks when you set it down
- Despite being massively over-provisioned on bumper plates (seriously, they spent tens of thousands on bumper plates that will never get used. 40 5kg plates, 48 10kg plates, 48 20kg plates) there is not one single 1.25kg plate, so make sure you BYO or your progression sensitive lifts will suffer
- No EZ Curl bar for the preacher station - I assume this will be rectified soon and they are just waiting
- No specialty bars whatsoever. I assumed there would be a safety squat bar, but alas I have to do my current lower body routine at home. Trap bar and Swiss bar wouldn't go astray either.
- None of the short back upright benches which are great for tricep extensions

All in all, good work on the launch team, I do really enjoy my upper body days there. I also like that there's only one giant screen, and I'm not being constantly bombarded with news about machete attacks etc
showerReviews.author: Luke

locations.title: World Gym Toowoomba
locations.address: ÓÉà59 Brook St, Toowoomba City QLD 4350

showerReviews.reviewText:
Updated:
Unfortunately the recent update to the functional room with the removal of the Crossfit style rig, kinda crippled this set-up. And the replacement units don't add much value for that style of training. Some components are also aging rapidly such as rowers which are way past their service dates and lifting bars which are either bent and rusted.
There is ample amount of room and a plethora of equipment. Two main halls for body building equipment. A full suit of treadmills, stair walks, and a dedicated hall for Crossfit and functional style training with rowers, free runners, treadmills, pull up cage (replaced with individual units) and assault Erg bikes. A dedicated room with two platforms and a pro squat rack for power lifting and some other dedicated rooms for classes such as yoga and spin. 3 showers in men's facilities and a 24 hr access as part of your membership. Big parking with ample amount of spots.
A lot of additions lately such as Ski Ergs and Rogue airbikes.
showerReviews.author: Mehrad A

However both times I‚Äôve stayed the cabins are always filthy, cups that haven‚Äôt been washed, linen with hair all over it, the toilet seat was sticky with hair and yellow substance and the shower not much better, even with a ‚Äúwe‚Äôve serviced your room card‚Äù the same day.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Do not book here - our stay was 1-6 Oct 25. It is the worst maintained park we have ever stayed in, and should not be a BIG4.  We should‚Äôve looked at Reviews before booking. I gave only 1 star because of generally quiet location, proximity to shops and Toowoomba city, and pleasant interactions with office and cleaning staff.
1. Communication. Days prior to arrival leaving phone and website messages to extend booking went unanswered, until we phoned the AH Emergency number to night manager so our request would be actioned. A return call the next day finally gave an apology with an explanation that the park was recently sold as the excuse for poor staff handling. We hoped that this would be the only negative for our stay , but this was not to be .
2. Sale of property. If true, then the previous owner has withheld not completing badly needed maintenance. These are:
a. Women‚Äôs showers - badly dripping outdated old-style shower roses wasting valuable water, a light sensor which does not turn on in quite dim conditions limiting shower use ,( when the men‚Äôs light always turns on when entering!), I noticed a shower wall with a sticker from a swimsuit/underwear liner that a lazy foul patron has just stuck it on a wall, but the cleaning staff have not removed and has been there the whole 5 day stayover. The bathroom smells like it needs a good dose of bleach down the drains. Which maintenance installer would think to put soap dispensers and hand dryers at 1.6 m high? No common sense. Where children cannot reach and water drips down your arm while using dryer. More modern eco shower roses would save water wastage.
Surely even if patrons have not complained or reported the dripping  roses and light faults the cleaning staff should have. So a response  on day 3 saying that repairs would have to wait for the maintenance staff is an excuse to send me on my way, when this already should‚Äôve been identified, reported and a maintenance person allocated to the job.
b. Small sites. We have a 8m motor home and a car. While the site was fine for our motorhome- just!; the car had to be parked across front of concrete area , as the parking as per the site map should‚Äôve been between our concrete path and the next van, but this was too close to open car doors without impacting our side curtain.
c. The internet only works in the camp kitchen area. Hot spotting doesn‚Äôt work either. Very poor connectivity and likely the cheapest plan. So the advertised Free Wifi is useless and misleading.
d. The roads in the far east of the park have potholes so big and wide and deep - in deplorable condition requiring urgent repairing.
e. No yellow bin for recycling. Very poor and disappointing not to have this available.
In general this park is in poor run down old condition requiring significant repairs and maintenance,  and funds to improve it. We didn‚Äôt even bother to try pool, BBQ or camp kitchen. Whilst this is in a quiet location, I would not come again nor advise anyone else to either. Bathroom cleanliness and maintenance is our most important item in a caravan park. Sadly, this park is way off the mark which does nothing to attract repeat customers.
showerReviews.author: Mary-Jayne Hayes

showerReviews.reviewText:
Do not book here - our stay was 1-6 Oct 25. It is the worst maintained park we have ever stayed in, and should not be a BIG4.  We should‚Äôve looked at Reviews before booking. I gave only 1 star because of generally quiet location, proximity to shops and Toowoomba city, and pleasant interactions with office and cleaning staff.
1. Communication. Days prior to arrival leaving phone and website messages to extend booking went unanswered, until we phoned the AH Emergency number to night manager so our request would be actioned. A return call the next day finally gave an apology with an explanation that the park was recently sold as the excuse for poor staff handling. We hoped that this would be the only negative for our stay , but this was not to be .
2. Sale of property. If true, then the previous owner has withheld not completing badly needed maintenance. These are:
a. Women‚Äôs showers - badly dripping outdated old-style shower roses wasting valuable water, a light sensor which does not turn on in quite dim conditions limiting shower use ,( when the men‚Äôs light always turns on when entering!), I noticed a shower wall with a sticker from a swimsuit/underwear liner that a lazy foul patron has just stuck it on a wall, but the cleaning staff have not removed and has been there the whole 5 day stayover. The bathroom smells like it needs a good dose of bleach down the drains. Which maintenance installer would think to put soap dispensers and hand dryers at 1.6 m high? No common sense. Where children cannot reach and water drips down your arm while using dryer. More modern eco shower roses would save water wastage.
Surely even if patrons have not complained or reported the dripping  roses and light faults the cleaning staff should have. So a response  on day 3 saying that repairs would have to wait for the maintenance staff is an excuse to send me on my way, when this already should‚Äôve been identified, reported and a maintenance person allocated to the job.
b. Small sites. We have a 8m motor home and a car. While the site was fine for our motorhome- just!; the car had to be parked across front of concrete area , as the parking as per the site map should‚Äôve been between our concrete path and the next van, but this was too close to open car doors without impacting our side curtain.
c. The internet only works in the camp kitchen area. Hot spotting doesn‚Äôt work either. Very poor connectivity and likely the cheapest plan. So the advertised Free Wifi is useless and misleading.
d. The roads in the far east of the park have potholes so big and wide and deep - in deplorable condition requiring urgent repairing.
e. No yellow bin for recycling. Very poor and disappointing not to have this available.
In general this park is in poor run down old condition requiring significant repairs and maintenance,  and funds to improve it. We didn‚Äôt even bother to try pool, BBQ or camp kitchen. Whilst this is in a quiet location, I would not come again nor advise anyone else to either. Bathroom cleanliness and maintenance is our most important item in a caravan park. Sadly, this park is way off the mark which does nothing to attract repeat customers.
showerReviews.author: Mary-Jayne Hayes

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here with a caravan and an extra person in a swag. The caravan site we were given was quite small and tight, making it a bit challenging to maneuver. It was fine for just one night, though. One thing we didn‚Äôt like was having to use a key for the amenities. As a family of three adults, we only had one key, which was a bit inconvenient.

Unfortunately, the toilets hadn‚Äôt been cleaned during our stay, and the showers were a bit of a hassle. While they were nice and hot, the water sprayed every time you moved, which meant my clothes kept getting wet even though they were on the bench.

On a positive note, it was pet-friendly, which was a big plus for us.

However with all that in mind we still had a pleasant stay.
showerReviews.author: Chloe Wood

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed six nights in our caravan on a powered site. The staff were friendly and helpful. The site was plenty large enough for our caravan, its awning and our tow vehicle. The site was opposite a nice grassy reserve. The site had a concrete slab for our van and the  awning, though they were sloped. The amenities were clean and in working order, though they need a renovation. The park was very quiet. There is only one boom gate for entry and exit and the keypad for the gate was a little difficult to reach from our tow vehicle. On the whole, I would recommend this caravan park.

God help the world with people like this.

showerReviews.reviewText: We loved our time at Crows Nest Tourist Park! It has everything you need for a relaxing family getaway. showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is a Great little hidden gem, close to bigger towns yet far enough away without the hustle and bustle of the city. Waking up to the sounds of birds and wildlife rather then trucks on the road. Just a stones throw away is the little township of crows nest,  that has everything you need. Staff are friendly as with all townsfolk at the local stores.
Amenities are in fantastic locations and always clean. Gardens and lawns are well maintained and looks great.
The new managers Karl and Corinna are very welcoming, making our stay very relaxing and chilled, they are very family orientated and great to see them around the park. Booking in was as easy as pie and given a map of the park for our convenience.
We loved the place enough to extend our stay by another week, it's just what we need after a big year.
showerReviews.author: monica Simpson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Check-in was easy, and they don‚Äôt charge your card until you arrive in person, which was good.

Unfortunately, the room itself was disappointing. When we first walked in, there were more than 40 moths and several mosquitos flying around. I called reception, and to their credit, staff quickly brought up fly spray.

The room had a single and a double bed, but when the top sheet separated, the blanket underneath had multiple yellow stains about the size of a hand, which was pretty unpleasant. The towels were also very small, and the toilet didn‚Äôt appear to have been cleaned properly, there was what looked like dried urine around the back of the seat.

On the positive side, the motel is within easy walking distance to the golf course, and the club can order you an Uber back if needed. There‚Äôs no allocated parking, but you can park anywhere you find a spot. Checkout was quick and easy, I just dropped the key cards off at reception.

Overall, while the location is convenient, the cleanliness and room condition need serious attention before I‚Äôd consider staying again.
showerReviews.author: Ben White

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very nice motel but unfortunately there are not enough carparks for number of rooms.
A problem for those planning on leaving  items in the car or arriving back late.
Certainly an issue for elderly with mobility issues.
Another issue we phoned to request a ground floor room due to health issues. Yes we were given a ground floor room but with the shower over the bath.....a safety issue and we would be unable to use. If we can't get up stairs surely we can't climb into a bath to have a shower.
OK for 1 night but not 5
Hopefully staff could be advised to let customers know of these issue and in advertising for safety and open disclosure.
The room is lovely but doorstop falling off back of bathroom door and bathroom not cleaned fully.
Room and Lamps dusty.
We must thank Brianna for her excellent customer service....nothing was to much trouble.
showerReviews.author: Catherine Golding

locations.title: Esk Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉà16 Hassall St, Esk QLD 4312

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great little caravan park, lots of well maintained amenities.

The camp kitchen seems pretty new and has great BBQs, pizza ovens, ovens/cooktops and utensils and heaps of seating.

There is a family pool and a separate adults only pool - the adult pool is much nicer than the family one, but both are pretty good, and there is a bbq space near the family pool.

The toilets and showers are clean and well maintained, with plenty of capacity.

Lots of nice established trees providing shade to pretty generous sized sites, and location is great, close to the IGA and Main Street/pubs and to the rail trail (Esk is a great place to start parts of the trail).

While we were here there was a duo playing live music at the camp kitchen on Saturday night which was great.

Will definitely stay again, thanks for having us.
showerReviews.author: Adrian Worthy

Wonderful dog friendly caravan park. We had one of the fenced sites for our fur baby which was in an awesome location, close to the second bathroom amenities and camp kitchen. The facilities were spotless and very well maintained. Although we didn't try either the family or adult pools they looked very inviting.
Saturday night live music in the main camp kitchen was very enjoyable.
The park is a short walk to town where you can find a well stocked IGA and a few choices for take away food.
Highly recommended and we will definitely be back!

The people were nice.
The location is nothing special.
Peacocks walk about a lot which would be nice for the kids.
The animal feeding option bis available (for a fee).

There is one unisex hot shower, but the water was beautifully hot and voluminous.

We thought it was expensive at $30 per adult per night.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great place to get away from it all, not far from Brisbane and plenty of room for all types of campers.
Powered and unpowered sites.
The amenities are clean.
Staff are friendly and offer lots of information about activities and walks nearby.
Large firepits provided.
Pet friendly and a fenced dog off-leash area.
Murphys Creek tavern just down the road if you don't feel like cooking.
Just beware of height of your caravan when coming in as there is a low bridge before the campground.

I fell the only 2 downers I can put on the trip is where we were staying in the powered site there was only 1 bbq and no bins for rubbish. The owner and the staff were great. The only reason I am dropping 1 start is for no nine for rubbish and only 1 bbq.

showerReviews.reviewText: Our stay at Goomburra Valley Campground was absolutely fantastic, and a huge part of that was thanks to Brad! He was incredibly kind and attentive, making us feel so welcome. The campground itself is truly amazing, impeccably well-kept and maintained. We loved the proximity to the creek/river, perfect for a refreshing dip, and having the fireplaces available was a huge bonus for cozy evenings. Our Starlink worked fine too, which was great. Every facility was clean and functional, with the kitchens working perfectly, complete with gas and hot water. We can't recommend this place enough!

locations.title: Laurel Bank Park
locations.address: ÓÉà50 Hill St, Toowoomba City QLD 4350

showerReviews.reviewText:
Laurel Bank Park in Toowoomba is a sensory delight and a local treasure‚Äîespecially for flower lovers and families. Here's what makes it shine:
Floral Spectacle
- Famous for its springtime displays during the Carnival of Flowers, with tulips, cherry blossoms, and themed garden beds that draw crowds and cameras.
- The Scented Garden, designed with input from the Downs Association of the Blind, features raised beds of fragrant herbs and blooms for an immersive experience.
Play and Relaxation
- A recently upgraded playground includes inclusive equipment like adaptive swings, climbing walls, and nets.
- Wide lawns, shaded picnic areas, croquet greens, and water features make it perfect for a leisurely afternoon.
Community and Charm
- Hosts events like the Carnival Parade and Devonshire teas at the Croquet Club.
- Interactive art, animal-shaped topiaries, and sculptures add whimsy and character throughout the park.
Accessibility and Amenities
- Easy parking, clean toilets, and nearby caf√©s like Urban Designs make it visitor-friendly.
- Dogs are welcome, and the park‚Äôs compact layout makes it easy to explore without feeling rushed.
Historical Roots
- Donated in 1932 by Samuel George Stephens, known as ‚Äúthe man of flowers,‚Äù who personally cultivated the land before gifting it to the city.
If Queens Park is Toowoomba‚Äôs grand stage, Laurel Bank Park is its intimate garden theatre‚Äîbursting with color, fragrance, and community spirit.
showerReviews.author: Mark Harvey

The staff, like Jenny, Sharon and Paul, are absolutely lovely, so warm, friendly and helpful. This is not always the case and certainly helps set this caravan park apart from others. We found our stay quiet and relaxing with everything we could want. It is perfect for those travelling with dogs. We cannot wait to return for another stay very soon. Highly recommended! Mel and Fred :)

locations.title: Garden City Backpackers
locations.address: ÓÉà61 Ruthven St, Harlaxton QLD 4350

showerReviews.reviewText: This excellent clean & safe, backpacker hostel is located at peaceful North Toowoomba, walking distance to North Point shopping centre with Coles, Newsagency, Aldi, Priceline Chemist, Subway, Pizza Cafes & restaurants, bakery, art & craft shops, Reject shop, parks and Toowoomba cycledrome. There are 8bed dorm rooms, & single rooms on offer, a large well equipped kitchen, games / lounge room with adorable comfy leather lounges, a huge TV & dining table, showers, toilets, laundry & outdoor tables, large grassy yard with x2 hills hoists. The rooms have comfortable bunk beds with bed linen, blankets & pillows provided. Each room has a bar fridge & cupboard space. Fantastic value, friendly staff contactable at all hours. See the jobs board in the foyer for seasonal work in the region. Wifi Internet is available. Lots of off street parking. Best if you turn up in person to view & book. Price is $50per night or $150per week.
showerReviews.author: Tabitha Lloyd Tanbwell

locations.address: ÓÉà192 James St, South Toowoomba QLD 4350

showerReviews.reviewText: Had a massage here today along side my friend & unfortunately it wasn't a comfortable experience. The salt cave environment is beautiful & calming & I think the sit in a chair & relax would be the nicer way to experience it. Please know there is no toilet in the building, but there is one in the shopping complex. Consultation before the massage was brief but still nice they asked us about our ailments prior to massage. The massage beds arnt very comfortable, they do provide nice big towels which was great. It was difficult to be comfortable as the massage progressed so it wasn't as enjoyable as we hoped. The staff are very nice though & thoughtful in their approach as the massages progressed. Still, it was a nice experience just not what we had envisaged.
